channel.title: Korea on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Go into the past! Gwangju Yangrim-dong Penguin Village - Nam-gu, Gwangju, Korea
item.description:
Penguin garden filled with all sorts of miscellaneous things

Go into the past! Gwangju Yangrim-dong Penguin Village

Nam-gu, Gwangju, Korea

2019, 2013, 1994, 1988 ... As soon as you step into the penguin village, the clock starts to turn upside down. Every step of the way I feel like I'm going back to the past more and more. You don't even need a time machine here. All you need is a camera for fun photos and a hat to block sunlight. Let's go to Penguin Village in Yangrim-dong, Gwangju, a memory playground for adults.
Explore another time in time travel
Yangrim-dong, Gwangju, Jeollanam-do, is a time machine travel destination to the past. Gwangju is a popular destination for modern history, and there is another time travel destination that evokes old memories. The penguin village is also very interesting. Although penguins do not live, there are many other eye-catching things to see. It is a place that emerges as a unique destination in time travel.
Gallery under the eaves of Penguin Village
The alleyway next to the Yangrim Community Center is a secret passageway leading to the time of the 1970s and 1980s. It is small and narrow enough to be easily overlooked, if not carefully examined. From the moment you find a penguin made of recycled gas cylinders at the entrance to the alley, the memories of the penguin town begins with a smile.
Penguin Village, with an unusually large number of watches
The old, shabby wall scenery that appeared as soon as one step into the penguin village jumped the time back a decade. The old, dark stained concrete fence is filled with all sorts of graffiti written in the old movers center advertisement, town map, and colored chalk. After a few more steps, I stop at all and burst into laughter. The amount of pan should be in the kitchen, and frying pans and colanders glisten as if they were sunbathing.
Wall with a silver pan and a frying pan
After a fun wall exhibition, a full-fledged village tour begins. The small village garden with small flowers and trees is a resting place for residents and a great photo zone for travelers. Of course it is not an ordinary garden. A guitar and a mirror ball are hung instead of the tree fruit, and the key that turns the grain between the flower fields occupies one place.
The wall of Penguin Village is an exhibition hall of memories.
Why is the name Penguin Village ?!
At this point, we cannot help but wonder why the village name is 'Penguin Village'. The Penguin Village contains the characteristics of this village, which has a high age among residents, including the elderly living alone. The old man's walking image resembled a penguin that was faltering and was called as an alias, and it became the name of the village. It is an affectionate nickname to make the atmosphere of a quiet village more enjoyable and energetic.
Kim Dong-gyun, the self-proclaimed penguin village chief
Along with the nickname, the Penguin Village began to look like it is now about 5 years ago. It started with Kim Dong-gyun, the self-proclaimed mayor of this village, decorating and decorating his hometown as a hobby with all sorts of old objects and junk stuff piled up in a vacant neighborhood. In the meantime, as the residents brought together the old objects they had and worked together to build a village, the garbage here became a great driving force for the time travel. It's all used in real life, so it makes me feel better. Perhaps this is the charm of Penguin Village. The ordinary town was reborn as a time machine travel destination, one of the hot places these days due to the 'conversion of ideas'.
Time machine destination decorated by villagers
An exhibition hall of memories that stops in alleys
The old objects packed in every alley reminiscent of the exhibition halls of memories that have compressed decades of time. The pace of the steps here is proportional to the amount of memory each person has.
Faded old movie posters on the wall
A middle-aged gentleman stops walking in front of a faded old poster and stands for a long time, and the old couple who leaned on each other for a long time reflects the years passed in front of the sculpture of the bride and groom stained with hands. The children are excited as if they have found something novel, and the young travelers have no choice but to take pictures of these alleys.
Groom statue and flower rubber shoes with traces of time
Penguin Village is enriched on Saturdays. This is because the alleyway flea market with handmade products, snacks, and a simple henna experience is opened from the morning. Although it is small and does not open regularly, the atmosphere of the flea market in the alleys of memories is more warm and warm than anywhere else.
Penguin village souvenirs made by villagers
It's fun to play with soap bubbles of memories that you've been struggling with when you're only going to blow alone.
Soap bubbles of memories that children and adults will enjoy
You should also pick up some souvenirs from the Penguin Village. Another precious time is engraved on the annual rings of life with the sunshine.
Dissolve sugar and add soda! Fun and delicious talgana experience
Han Hee Won Museum of Art and Holly Tree Hill Guesthouse
A good place to visit Penguin Village is the Han Hee Won Museum. The neat and neat Hanok building at the end of the alley is impressive. It is easy to find because it is located near Choi Seung-hyo's house. Opened last year, the Han Hee Won Museum of Art is a great place to enjoy a tea and chat after a picture. You can enjoy wonderful works with the charming atmosphere of Han Hee-won, and the cafe is operated unmanned.
Han Hee Won Art Center, a neat Hanok building
You can spend one night in Yangrim-dong. A hollyhock hill guest house is located on the hillside of Yangrim-dong, where hollyhock trees that are more than 200 years old grow. It was a historic space built by Western missionaries in the 20th century when they founded modern schools and hospitals.
Holly oak tree hill guest house using missionary residence
The antique atmosphere of the 70-year-old brick building calms the mind. The fresh green color filled through the window is very beautiful.
Greenhouse guest house kitchen
Travel info

item.title: Yongsan War Memorial, seeing Korea's last divided country - Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Scene of the reconstruction of Seoul's restoration of the armed forces displayed in the '6/25 War Room'

Yongsan War Memorial, seeing Korea's last divided country

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

On June 25, 1950, the dawn where everyone fell asleep before dawn. Gunshots echoed on the peaceful Korean Peninsula. The Korean War began when the North Korean army crossed the 38th parallel, which was the inter-Korean military demarcation line. The blood-sharing war between the Korean people continued with the casualties of the United States, the Soviet Union, and China until the July 1953 armistice. Even before enjoying the joy of escaping from the Japanese colonial rule. Introducing Yongsan's War Memorial, which records the history of the land half a century ago.

Remembrance Day and June, which embraced June 25, are the month of the Veterans' Day. Perhaps it is because of our ancestors who fought everything to protect the country that we can suffer from personal concerns such as dating, employment, and marriage. Before and after June 25th, how about remembering your ancestors for a few days and having a thankful heart? With that in mind, I visited the Yongsan War Memorial.

The history of the war recorded vividly at a glance
Before entering the war memorial, the giant pagoda at the front door and the statue of the patriotic army greet visitors.
Seoul Yongsan War Memorial
It was a picture of the time of the war, with vivid expressions and gestures from armed soldiers at the front to the youngest child at the back.
Seoul Yongsan War Memorial
On the left is the “Brother's Prize,” which symbolizes a divided country divided into South and North. Why did brothers with the same mother be divided into South Korean and North Korean forces and aimed at each other? I am sorry for the appearance of my younger brother who is digging into my brother's arms. After passing through the large square, we enter the interior of the war memorial.
The statue of the patriotic army
Let's start our full-scale war memorial tour. In order to properly examine the War Memorial, which consists of a total of three floors, a brochure is essential. When visiting the War History Room on the 1st floor and the 6/25 War Room on the 2nd floor, it is also very helpful to listen to the cultural narrator accompanying you four times a day.
2nd floor starting point for visiting the War Memorial
On the 2nd floor, where the entrance to the War Memorial Hall is displayed, the 'Hospital Memorial Room' honors and commemorates the ancestors who devoted their lives for their homeland, and '6 · 25', which displays all the processes of the Korean War from the North Korean invasion to the Armistice Agreement in an easy-to-understand manner. There is a War Room I and II. After that, you can look back on the 3rd floor, ‘The UN Room’, ‘The Donation Room’, the ‘Overseas Deployment Room’, and the ‘Army Development Room’. The history of war on the Korean Peninsula can be seen at a glance in the “war history” on the first floor.
Adding a description of the cultural commentator gives you a chance to see
A bloody ideological battle between the same peoples, the Korean War
On August 15, 1945, World War II war criminal Japan surrendered. This ended the war and the Korean Empire was able to escape the 36-year Japanese occupation period.
The site of the excavation of the remains of the Korean War was recreated.
The joy of regaining the country for a while, despite the independence movement in the meantime, the independence by Japanese ruin pushes the Korean Peninsula into another crisis. Despite the desire for 'self-independence and sovereignty', the Korean Peninsula is divided into south and north, where the waist is cut around the 38th parallel.
Weapons used during the war
In 1948, President Syngman Rhee was elected the first President of the Republic of Korea. As an independence activist, he was a thorough anti-communist and campaigned for reunification. In North Korea, there was Kim Il-sung, who had the Soviet Union on his back.
Our air force picked up the bomb and dropped it through the window.
In this way, even before the Korean peninsula enjoyed the joy of independence, the South had a democratic and communist (divided into) Han, but had a separate national system with two ideologies.
Detonating the Han River Railway Bridge to prevent North Korean troops
One day when the big and small fights between South and North continued around the 38th parallel, the dawn of June 25, 1950, North Korea went on a surprise attack before dawn. After that, the support of the Soviet Union was promised. South Korea, which lacks proper military training and equipment, is faced with helplessness. I broke the Hangang bridge and earned time, but it was pushed to the Nakdong River defense line. However, General MacArthur's Incheon Landing Operation (September 15, 1950) returned to Seoul in three months and recaptured Pyongyang and quickly advanced to the Yalu River.
President Syngman Rhee commanded North Korea with a desire for reunification
After the unification, the ROK military forces are pushed back to the south with the intervention of the Chinese army. It is a 1 · 4 retreat. At this time, the place where the South Korean troops, UN forces and North Korean refugees escaped was the Hungnam Wharf of Hamheung. In the movie <International Market>, this is where the main character lost his father and younger sister. The bloody war on the Korean Peninsula continued until the armistice was reached in July 1953. Even now, we are in a truce.
4D realistic video room where you can experience the time when you went to the evacuation route
While listening to the explanation of the commentator, you will see the “6/25 War Room I · II Hall”. It reproduces the appearance of the war and adds realism. From the background of the North Korean military invasion to the war and the Armistice Agreement, the process is clearly displayed. In particular, the 'Incheon Landing Operation 4D Experience Hall (7 minutes of screening time, 15 people watching once)' and 4D Realistic Video Room (9 minutes of screening time, 40 people watching once) 'show severe weather through 4D video, vibration, and blizzard effects. It is popular because you can experience the difficult evacuation process yourself.
Battle scene of white horse highland
Even if you look at the center of the '6/25 War Room', the hour of commentary is over 1 hour. After inspecting the 3rd floor and the donation room where you can meet the United Nations veterans, you will be transferred to the ROK military development room and overseas deployment room. It is no longer unfamiliar to say ‘Hochon’ I bow my head to the efforts of the ancestors who fought to protect the land. Learning about the history of this land is a bonus.
Turtle ship displayed outside the war history room on the 1st floor of the War Memorial
If you visited the War Memorial Hall with your children, it would be a good idea to go to the Children's Museum after visiting the 6/25 War Room. About a day in June, how about visiting the war memorial, thinking about the country?
A war history room displaying military relics of this land
TIP. War memorial
29 Itaewon-ro, Yongsan-gu, Seoul War Memorial Hall / 02-709-3139 / 9:30 a.m. ~ 6 p.m. (Closed on Mondays, closed the day after the last holiday if Monday is a holiday included) / Free of charge for permanent exhibition / 3000 won until 2 hours for a small car 1,000 won per 30 minutes)
https://www.warmemo.or.kr/front/main.do
TIP. War Memorial Children's Museum

Daily admission is limited to the number of admissions per visit, and reservations are made for 60% of online reservations and 40% on the same day (first-come, first-served basis). 15 or more advance reservations required. 9:30 a.m. ~ 6 p.m. (Closed on Mondays, closed on the day following the last holiday if Monday is a holiday included) / Free admission / 02-709-3200

https://www.warmemo.or.kr/kids/main.do

item.title: 'Cherry Blossom Ending' is on the way to Topsa, and Maisan Cherry Blossom Road - Jinan-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea
item.description:
Maisan Cherry Blossom Road is filled with spring mood

'Cherry Blossom Ending' is on the way to Topsa, and Maisan Cherry Blossom Road

Jinan-gun, Jeollabuk-do, Korea

I missed the peak of spring flowers, is it just swallowing the sadness? Jinan Mai Mountain is located on a plateau, where cherry blossoms bloom until late. It is a bulwark of cherry blossom viewing. The shading of Maisan reflected in the Top Youngje Reservoir and the rare stone tower of Topsa serve as a “travel insurance” even after flowering. If you take a walk at Jinan Red Ginseng Spa or Baekwoon Village Village, it is a springtime destination regardless of flowers.
When the flowers bloom in Yunjung-ro, Maisan blooms
Spring flowers are in full bloom in April. It is a good time to go to the mountains. There are many cherry blossom paths. It blooms brightly and abundantly with springtime
The Maisan Cherry Blossom Road is about 2.5km from the tomb of Isan to Topsa. Maisan cherry trees are 20-30 years old and are not large or thick. However, the road toward Sansa adds a sense of luck. It shines in harmony with the surrounding nature. The slope to the top temple is gentle, so walk slowly and cherry blossoms
Maisan Cherry Blossom Road is perfect for walking
Top Youngje, decal comani of spring day
From the road leading to the southern parking lot in Maisan, the streets of cherry blossoms make you feel the peak of spring. When you get off the parking lot, move towards the tower. A quiet cherry blossom path opens.
Restaurants are located at the entrance of Maisan Cherry Blossom Road
The first part is a restaurant around the ticket office. There are many foods in Jinan such as fried ginseng or black pork. It is a place to stop by and enjoy entertainment. It is not easy to overlook if you are hungry.
Representative menu of the cherry blossom road entrance Grilled black pork of Jinan
The nature of cherry blossoms in nature grows as they pass through the Golden Temple. It's the last cherry blossom, so there aren't many late spring visitors, but somewhere in the spring. Nevertheless, the pink cherry blossom branches hanging along the roadside are a constant excitement.
Cherry blossoms blooming in front of the Golden Temple
The essence is Top Youngje Reservoir. It makes Maisan cherry blossoms famous regardless of time. Cherry blossoms along the side of the reservoir
Cherry Blossom Road Bench at Top Youngje Reservoir
If it is a late spring flower outing, the reflection of the young Maisan in the Topyeongje Reservoir will soothe the sadness. Ammaibong and the green of the cherry tree that just sprouted cast a soft shadow on the water.
Reflection of young cherry blossom path and Ammaibong of Topyeongje Reservoir
Decalcomani of Mother Nature is a painting and art. It is a view with elasticity. If you sit still on the bank, it is full of spring energy.
The reflection of Maisan on the waterside is a spring day.
Classic boating is also tempting. It is a duck boat going up and down the water. If you are a lover, you are encouraged to enjoy the scenery of spring on the water.
Duck riding adds classic romance
If you hang over the edge of the cherry blossoms, the petals will fly like snowflake on the water, giving you a romantic moment.
Cherry blossoms blend in the reservoir landscape at sunset
Looking for a springtime spa or “signboard”
The stone tower experience area passes as well as a trip to Topyeongje and goes to Topsa Temple. You can stop walking and build a stone tower. If you are with a family member or a lover, you may wish to add a light wish.
Green and pink cherry blossoms harmonize and decorate spring
Cherry blossoms hang over the rustic stone tower. And when the last cherry blossoms disappear, Pagoda Temple is revealed. Top Temple also acts as an 'insurance' for late flower viewing. Maisan is a must-visit destination with a panoramic view of the tower.
Pagoda's towers are mysterious at any time, regardless of season.
As the name suggests, Pagoda is surrounded by huge towers. These are the 80 stone towers built by Gap-ryong Lee. Among them, Cheonji Tower, Moonlight Tower, and Yaksa Tower are famous. In this, it contained the rationale of the microcosm of Yin and Yang. Most of all, it is mysterious that it has not collapsed in the typhoon for over 100 years. Walk in between and climb to the top pair of heaven and earth. From the back of Cheonji Pagoda
Stacking stones at the Stone Tower Experience Center is also a small pleasure.
After visiting Pagoda Temple, you can pass through Eunsu Temple and Emperor Gate to descend to the northern parking lot. It is also recommended to enjoy the mountain hike in person. Starting from the southern parking lot, climb to Gogeumdang, Observatory, and Bongdubong, then descend to Topsa, or from the observation deck to the northern parking lot, the course takes 2 to 2 hours and 30 minutes. It is a road full of fresh green in springtime.
Cheonji Tower from the top of Pagoda Temple and surrounding mountains
After visiting the cherry blossoms of Maisan or going on a mountain hike in spring, you can make a trip to Jinan Red Ginseng Spa. Jinan is famous for ginseng, but red ginseng spa is a famous place to experience its efficacy.
Open-air hot spring at Jinan Red Ginseng Spa
Jinan Red Ginseng Spa is largely divided into Taiji Zone, Therapy Zone, and Aqua Zone. The Taegeuk Zone, which is a massage method with red ginseng foam, is the special treatment for the Taegeuk Bubble Sense Therapy and the Aqua Zone open-air bath while enjoying the view of Maisan Mountain. You can also spend a day in Jinanville, a lodging facility, and travel to Jinan.
Representative spa facility Taegeuk Bubble Sense Therapy <Photo courtesy, Jinan Red Ginseng Spa>
If you plan on staying 1 night, Baekwoonwon Village is also recommended. It is located in Baekwoon-myeon, about 10km south of Mt.
Interesting patterns in Baekwoonwon Village
It is the most 'good sign' village in the country. Mural villages are the mainstream for the village decorating project, but Wonchon Village maintained village signs in 2007. Uniquely shaped signs add to the fun of walking around town. It goes well with the rustic scenery of a rural village.
The spirit of a rural village will make you feel relaxed.

item.title: Heat reflection, 3 trekking in the backcountry valley, Wangpicheon in Uljin. - Uljin-gun, Gyeongbuk, Korea
item.description:
Gangwon Inje Morning Valley

Heat reflection, 3 trekking in the backcountry valley, Wangpicheon in Uljin.

Uljin-gun, Gyeongbuk, Korea

The weather is getting hot. Some Bangkok people say that it is enough to have watermelon in the air-conditioning wind, but there are those who want to leave the summer resort in nature. In this case, trekking in the valley along the cool stream is the best. Walk and paint water
#One. Uljin Wangpicheon, full of wild charm
Wangpicheon is a 61km-long waterway that flows from Wangpi-ri and Gusan-ri to Uljin, originating from the nutritional defense of Gyeongbuk. Surrounded by mountains and cliffs, it was not easy to reach, so people were less likely to walk, and thanks to it, it was considered a clean area to recognize. The name 'Wangpiri', meaning 'town where the king has fled', also indicates that this area was remote. It is in the same context that Wangpicheon area was designated as an ecological and landscape conservation area in 2005. It is the largest in Korea. In 2013, four ecological trails were opened in the vicinity of Wangpicheon and designated as eco-tourism areas, where local residents operate the Wangpicheon Eco Tour Group.
Wolmi, Yongso of Uljin Wangpicheon, one of the best places in the world <Photo courtesy, Uljin County Office>
The starting point of this Wangpicheon trekking course was taken to Gulguji Village. Gulguji Village, which is considered to be an outback in Uljin, is a name that says that only nine bends should go around the mountain. The trekking route between Wangpicheon Soksa Village, upstream of Wangpicheon and Gulguji Village, downstream of Gusan-ri, is the most successful. Either way, you can start, but if you are a beginner or a child with little trekking experience, it is recommended that you start at Goolji Village and return to the camp. The valley is gentle and you can trek gently.
Uljin Wangpicheon Ecological Trail Information Center

Wonderful scenery follows the quiet stream. Nevertheless, I am not careful that the water is shallow. Mossy stones are slippery. In addition, the Gulguji Village ~ Sangcheondong ~ Yongso ~ Turtle Rock Observation Course belongs to the 2nd course of the Wangpicheon Ecological Trail, so you can walk on the forest path, not the water path. If you are walking in the valley and become crowded, you can also climb the forest path. Still, trekking in the valley is recommended to properly see the skin of Wang Picheon. Walk about 4km from Gulguji Village and you will reach the best view of the Wangpicheon. The area where the dragon seems to be floundering must be violated due to the steep and rough cliffs. If individual valley trekking is a burden, you can use ecological exploration at the Wangpicheon Eco Tour Group.

Eco-tour inquiry, Uljin Wangpicheon Valley Eco Tour Project

http://www.wangpiecotour.com/ .

Uljin Specialty Geumgangsong
#2. Jade Valley, a hot-water fish, inje morning
Before walking in the morning, let's look at the Prophet Jeonggamrok of the Joseon Dynasty. In <Junggamrok>, there are three disaster-free locations that do not have three disasters: water, fire, and wind.
When you enter the morning valley from the vibrating valley, the wild forest road begins.
Inje morning valley where lush native forest and clean valley are combined. It means 'in the midst of a spooky mountain, where it is only about a year to plow the field in the morning'. It is a valley that still has the feeling of outback, as its name suggests. Morning Garrigol originated from Guryong Deokbong, flows about 20km and meets Bangtaecheon of Dongdongri, especially the 5km downstream section. In addition, the slope is gentle, so it is easy to go up the valley. The water path is easier to walk than the forest path, which is hard to see.
Water play in the vibrating valley
Trekking in the morning is going to start at the opposite side of the vibratory valley, Sanchon Cultural Recreation Center (or Vibratory Mountain House). As soon as you cross the vibrating valley, the forest path in the thick forest begins. As soon as you pass through the lush forest, you can go morning and reach the downstream. The origin return course that goes back and forth from the morning Gargol-Jogyeongdong bridge to Bangdong Yaksu is the most successful. If you want to see upstream in the morning, you need about 10 hours. If the distance is a burden, it is also a good idea to enjoy the water in the vibrating valley after watching the morning goal.
Valley trekking, aqua shoes or sandals
# 3. Deep mountain valley road, Jeongseon Deoksangi Valley
Deoksangi Valley, one of Jeongseon's remote areas. It was a secret valley known only to people who knew it until it was introduced to TV programs. It was revealed to the world when it was chosen as a place for outdoor weddings by famous celebrities, but the still waters still remain.
With a total length of 12km, there are Dosagok, Deoksangi, and Hebei-dong villages in the valley of Deoksangi, which is surrounded by Songdae. Dozens of households lived on the ground and left for flooding in 1979. Guest houses and pensions are located along the valley. In general, we find many courses from Deokuri to Budong-ri.
Deoksangi Valley, Jeongseon, one of the remote areas
Those staying in a pension or guest house in the Deoksangi Valley should park and walk in the Deoksan Bridge. The cement road continues for the villagers living in the valley of Deoksangi. A proud stand rising by the gentle stream greets you. To enjoy Deoksangi Valley trekking properly, it is better to go after rain.
Jeongseon Deoksangi Valley Trekking
tip. Safety checks for exciting valley trekking
Similar to regular trekking, but needs more 'valley' preparation. There are some gentle paths, but there are also valleys that reach the knees, so it is better to prepare extra shoes, and sticks make it easier. Moss is quite slippery, so walking barefoot

item.title: Good during the day! Better at night! One early summer's dream, palace outing - Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Night view of Buyong-ji, sponsored by Changdeokgung Palace

Good during the day! Better at night! One early summer's dream, palace outing

Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea

There are many ways to enjoy a 500-year history tour of Joseon in Seoul. Perhaps one of the first hands is the palace where the king of Joseon Dynasty stayed. The four main palaces in the Joseon Dynasty that remain in Seoul are Gyeongbokgung Palace, Changdeokgung Palace, Changgyeonggung Palace, and Deoksugung Palace. They open the night landscape under the name of night viewing. Jongno, Daehak-ro, and Gwanghwamun walk through the downtown of Seoul, and the night view of the palace that passed by is very popular. That's because it closes as soon as you start buying tickets every night. If you missed this special tour, take a look at the day and night scenery of the palace and try your next special tour. Clearly, it is our proud history that is unfortunate and unfortunate to see only at night.
Gyeongbokgung Palace
Gyeongbokgung Palace, located on the perfect Baesan Forest with the water of Buakak Mountain to the north and Cheonggyecheon Stream to the south, has the meaning of “a great blessing from the sky”. The main gate of Gyeongbokgung is the famous Gwanghwamun.
Gyeongbokgung Main Gate Gwanghwamun
It was founded in 1395 by Taejo Lee Seong-gye, and was destroyed in the Imjin War in 1592.
Gwanghwamun Water Gate, which is popular among tourists
When you enter Gyeongbokgung Palace, you will find the King's living space, political facilities, sponsorship, queen's living space, Junggung, and Seja's Donggung. Unfortunately, during the Japanese colonial rule, most of the cigarettes were demolished and only a few buildings remained, including Geunjeongjeon. The Gyeongbokgung Palace filled with large and small palaces can be looked at from the core spaces such as Gwanghwamun ~ Heungryemun ~ Geunjeongmun ~ Geunjeongjeon ~ Sajeongjeon ~ Gangnyeongjeon ~ Gyotaejeon.
When you enter Gwanghwamun, Heungryemun and Bukaksan are greeted
If it is the first route, it is a good idea to take a tour of the cultural commentator. 5 times a day on Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays (11:00, 13:00, 14:00, 15:00, 16:00), 6 times a day on Fridays and Saturdays (10:00, 11:00, 13) : 00, 14:00, 15:00, 16:00), and 12 free sessions on Sundays (every 30 minutes from 10:00 to 15:00, 16:00). Depart from inside Hongryemun in front of the Gyeongbokgung Information Center. It takes about 1 hour to 1 hour and 30 minutes.
Geunjeongjeon in Gyeongbokgung Palace shining in National Treasure No. 223
You may have heard the word Heungcheong Mangcheong. This word came from Yeonsan-gun, and [Heungcheong] refers to parasites who were drafted into the palace for entertainment in Yeonsan-gun. At the time of Yeonsan-gun, there was a government office called “Chae Hongsa,” which selects a woman with a beautiful appearance at eight degrees across the country. At that time, it was Gyeonghoeru that was the place that made a sound with Hungcheong.
Gyeonghoeru was used as a national banquet hall
Gyeonghoeru was a banquet place for kings to entertain foreign gods or to publicize them. We visit Gwangjeongjeon, the king's political space, Gangnyeongjeon, the king's settled and resting official resting place, Gyotaejeon, the queen's settled, and the supporting Ami Mountain, and Hyangwonjeong, which enjoyed relaxation and style. It is also added that the space where the woman stayed was decorated with flower walls.
The Queen's Settlement, Gyotaejeon
It is good to take a break from the heat, but after going around the commentary and Gyeongbokgung Palace, the study of history becomes a temple.
Hyangwonjeong, where the king and queen were at rest

Special nighttime viewing hours are held every year from 7 to 9:30 or 10 depending on the day of the week. Reservations are made through the Internet about a month ago. Unfortunately, on-site sales for the general public are not conducted. There is a purchase limit of 4 per person. The admission fee is 3,000 won, the same as during the day. Night viewing is possible up to Gyeonghoeru. Closed on Tuesdays. Advance ticket auction ( http://ticket.auction.co.kr ). Inquiries, Cultural Heritage Administration Gyeongbokgung Palace (02-3700-3900, http://www.royalpalace.go.kr/content/board/view.asp?seq=590&page=&c1=&c2= )

Geunjeongmun, the main gate of Geunjeongjeon in Gyeongbokgung Palace
Palace dug into nature, Changdeokgung
Since 1392, the current capital of Seoul and Hanyang was chosen as the new capital. Soon after, Jeonggung Gyeongbokgung was built, and during the time of King Taejong (1405), Changgung Palace was built.
Changdeokgung Palace Main Gate Donhwamun Gate
It is said that Gyeongbokgung Palace was the main palace, but the kings preferred Changdeokgung Palace. Perhaps it was because of the beautiful sponsorship of Changdeokgung Palace. The patronage of Changdeokgung Palace has been loved as a resting place for the royal family utilizing natural topography.
Recognition exhibition held an important national consciousness
At the time of the Imjin War, the palaces in Hanyang were burned down, and the Gyeongbokgung Palace was not rebuilt because of the ominous ground, but the Changdeokgung Palace was first rebuilt during the Gwanghae (1610). Changdeokgung Palace was used as a palace for 270 years until Gyeongbokgung was rebuilt.
Before selection
As the number of kings staying at Changdeokgung Palace increases, so does the royal family. Seongjong, who was prepared for the preparation of the subdivision, stands for Changgyeonggung Palace right next to Changdeokgung Palace. Even now, Changdeokgung and Changgyeonggung continue through Hamyangmun. In the Joseon Dynasty, it was used without boundaries with Changgyeonggung Palace, and the two palaces were called [Donggwol].
Contrast
Among the existing palaces in Chosun, Changdeokgung Palace, the best preserved archetype, was added as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997.
Naksunjae built for Mr. Kyungbin Kim, who Heonjong loved so much
Changdeokgung Palace can be largely divided into support and non-sponsored spaces. Once you enter Donhwamun, the main gate of Changdeokgung Palace and the oldest front door of the existing palaces, after passing the official ceremony of the king and the selection room of the king's office, the queen's living space touches Donggung, the contrasting space and the three educational spaces. After this, it is a support entrance. After passing Hamyangmun, which is located next to the entrance to the patronage, it leads to Changgyeonggung, and further down to the right is Naksunjae, who bears the love of Hyunjong and Gyeongbin Kim. Sponsorship for viewing only with a commentator Don't miss the beautiful pond of Buyong, Buyongjeong, Aeryeonji and Okryucheon, sponsored by the king's secret garden.
The first central garden sponsored by Changdeokgung Palace, Buyongji and Buyongjeong
Outside the patronage, Changdeokgung Palace is open from 09:00 to 18:30 (June to August), 09:00 to 18:00 (February to May, September to October), and 09:00 to 17:30 (November to January). If you go according to the guide time for free commentary that is held 5 times a day (09:30, 11:30, 13:30, 15:30, 16:30 (from March to October only)), you can take a more tour of the old palace. You must get a separate ticket to see your sponsorship. In addition, it is possible to visit with the cultural commentator only 6 times a day (10:00, 11:00, 12:00, 13:00, 14:00, 15:00). From March to May, from September to October, the time for viewing once a day (16:00) and from June to August twice a day (16:00, 16:30) increases. The admission fee for Changdeokgung Palace is 3,000 won, and the sponsorship is 5000 won. Closed on Mondays.
Changdeokgung Palace sponsored tour

Changdeokgung Palace hosts annual spring and autumn moonlight tours. Advance ticket sales started on March 21st and progressed from April 5th to 29th and May 10th to 27th. The first-come, first-served basis of the synagogue is limited to 100 people and the participation fee is 30,000 won. Up to 2 tickets can be purchased per person. The program goes around Donhwamun ~ Geumcheon Bridge and Jinseonmun ~ Injeongjeon ~ Nakseonjae ~ Sangryangjeong ~ Buyongji ~ Bullomun ~ Aeryeonjeong ~ Yeongyeongdang ~ Supporting Forest Road ~ Donhwamun, and adds commentary on the history, culture, and landscape of Changdeokgung Palace.
From August to October, the moonlight tour will be held in the second half of this year. Advance ticket auction ( http://ticket.auction.co.kr ). For inquiries, Changdeokgung Palace (02-3668-2300, http://www.cdg.go.kr/default.jsp )

Changdeokgung Palace recognition exhibition night view <Photo courtesy, empathy photo>
The Changgyeonggung Palace that Oro, the pain of the Japanese occupation
Seongjong, the 9th king of Joseon Dynasty, was built on the east side of Changdeokgung Palace in 1483 and used as one palace without borders with Changdeokgung Palace.
Changgyeonggung Main Gate Honghwamun
Changgyeonggung begins with the establishment of Suganggung for King Taejong in the 1418 Goryeo dynasty's Nangung Palace. Since then, Seongjong expanded and supplemented Suganggung to prepare for the preparation of three people, and named it Changgyeonggung during the construction. It wasn't used in the early stages, but after the Imjin War, Changdeokgung Palace played a role as a palace, increasing its utilization as a palace.
Myeongjeongmun Gate heading to Myeongjeongjeon Hall
Of course, Changgyeonggung also burned like other palaces in Seoul during the Imjin War. It was rebuilt in 1616 during Gwanghaegun. At this time, the reconstructed Myeongjeongjeon is the most existing blackout building.
Hamyangmun Gate connecting Changdeokgung Palace and Changgyeonggung Palace
Changgyeonggung, which seemed to have survived, becomes asylum during the Japanese occupation. With the intention of annihilating the dignity of the palace and the Joseon Dynasty, Japanese imperialism demolished most of the buildings in Changgyeonggung and established a zoo and a botanical garden. In 1911, even his name was downgraded to Changgyeongwon. Since liberation, it has been trying to revive the original appearance of the palace.
Chinese octagonal seven-storied stone tower different from the existing stone tower (Treasure No. 1119)
Changgyeonggung is open from 09:00 to 21:00, and is closed on Mondays with Changdeokgung every week. The admission fee is 1,000 won. Free commentary is held 7 times a day (10:30, 11:30, 12:30, 13:30, 14:30, 15:30, 16:30 (November to January 16:00)).
Punggidae (Treasure No. 846), believed to have been built for eight years

Changgyeonggung Palace will be open at night from 2019. It can be visited every day at night, so it is possible to relieve the inconvenience of not getting the special night tickets for Gyeongbokgung and Changgyeonggung. Inquiries, Cultural Heritage Administration Changgyeonggung (02-762-4868,

http://cgg.cha.go.kr/agapp/main/index.do?siteCd=CGG )

King Jeongmun's official office
Deoksugung Palace, which buried the history of the old Korean words
Deoksugung, the royal palace of the Korean Empire, was originally the home of Seongjong's older brother Wolsandaegun. Later, the ancestors used it as a palace during the Imjin War, and in 1611, Gwanghae-gun gave it a formal palace called 'Gyeongwoong Palace', which was called Jeongneung-dong Haenggung.
Deoksugung main gate
It was with the establishment of the Korean Empire in 1897 that Gyeongung Palace appeared on the front of history. At its peak, it boasted three times the size of today. Then, as Emperor Gojong retreated, Gyeongwoong Palace changed its status as the residence of the Emperor Seon, and the name changed to Deoksugung. Subsequently, a part of the Gaknaeksa Temple and the Hwangudan were demolished, and their status disappeared.
Seokjojeon, built by Emperor Gojong to use for sedimentation and seizure
After the death of Gojong, the brutality of Japanese imperialism becomes more persistent. The area of Saigon and Proof of War were sold out, and the palace itself was reduced. Afterwards, it was created as a park and released to the public. In the area around Deoksugung Palace, the modern and modern turbulent period of this land permeates every corner.
China's top-class exhibition held at the official event

Deoksugung is open from 09:00 to 21:00. Every Monday is a regular holiday, and the admission fee is 1,000 won. Like Changgyeonggung Palace, it can be viewed every night. Tue ~ Friday, 6 times a day (10:30, 11:15, 13:00, 14:15, 15:00, 16:30), Saturday (except 10:30 from Tue ~ Friday), 1 on Sunday 7 times a day (11:15, 13:00, 13:30, 14:15, 14:30, 15:00, 16:30), and 4 times a day on holidays (10:00, 11:15, 14: 15, 16:30) Free commentary will be held. Inquiry, Deoksugung (02-751-0734, http://www.deoksugung.go.kr/ )

Kwanheon Jeong adds traditional and Western architecture

item.title: Surfing trip between men, Songjeong Beach, Busan - Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea
item.description:
Local surfer surfing at Songjeong Beach

Surfing trip between men, Songjeong Beach, Busan

Haeundae-gu, Busan, South Korea

Surfing is no longer the subject of a movie or a longing. Yangyang, Taean, and Pohang have already established themselves as surf spots. What's the theme of this, because men are building strong friendships? In particular, the Songjeong Beach in Busan is suitable for beginners, making it perfect for first surfing.
Man travel, friendship and challenge surfing!
For several years, the fever of tvn <Youth over Flowers> has been strong. The ringing was loud for the cast and men in their 20s and 40s. In the meantime, there were many bad trips (?) For men's trips. However, <Youth over Flowers> harmonized with men's sticky friendship and the theme of 'challenge', dreaming of a healthy trip with friends.
Songjeong Beach, popular as a surf spot as well as a beach
Surfing satisfies both themes of 'friendship' and 'challenge'. Surfing in Hawaii or the Gold Coast is a misunderstanding if you think that surfing on the Internet is only a matter of other countries. There are more surf spots in Korea than I thought, including Yangyang Jukdo, Taean Manripo, Pohang Chilpo, and Jeju Jungmun. The equipment is also simple and relatively easy to access. It is no longer left as one of the bucket lists. It will be a challenge to meet your friends. There is nothing better than this, as we learn together and build up friendships.
Surfholic's exterior where you can learn to surf at Songjeong Beach
Among them, Busan Songjeong Beach is a good place to start surfing. Since the South Sea and the East Sea meet, the south swell from spring to summer and the northeast swell in winter can enjoy surfing in all seasons. In addition, the waves of the knee are frequent and the lessons are conducted at the depth of the waist, making it perfect for beginners to surf. Currently, about 10 surf schools and equipment rental companies have entered the beach. Local surfers have already emerged since the late 1990s, and almost 20 years have passed. International surfing competitions have been held since 2009. It is worthwhile to be a mecca of surfing in Korea.
Surfboards on display at Surfholic
Surfing, there is an entrance, but there is no exit
For lessons, use surfing schools such as Surfholic and Songjeong Surfing School around Songjeong Beach. Songjeong has been systematically taking classes since the first generation surfers in Korea took root. The course is generally divided into Day 1, Day 3, and Day 5.
Surfing lesson day 1 theoretical training
Day 1 is followed by theory, ground exercises, and practice of acquisition. The theory explains the title of each part of the board, the rules of surfing, and safety.
Day 1 surfers practicing paddling on the sandy beach
Ground exercises are conducted on sandy beaches. The basic movements of the surf are paddle padding to paddle with your arms when the waves come in, push-ups to raise your upper arms to reach the waves, and take-offs to raise your knees to the lower body, finally balancing and riding the waves Is divided into Repeat this motion on the sandy beach to wear it. It is boring, but the performance of practice is directly related to the practice. Of course, I usually realize this after a few bumps on the water.
Surfboard prevents loss by connecting with the leash cord of the surfer ankle
At first, the water practice is on the board with the help of the instructor, rather than speeding up with paddling. At this time, the position of the foot on the board, the gaze, and the process of quickly converting from push-up to take-off are important. Repeat this a few times and notice the timing of the waves. Quick learners stand on the board in two or three turns and ride the waves.
Push-up posture while standing on the surfboard
On the second day, start with paddling and practice climbing yourself. If the board focuses on going straight in by the 2nd day, from the 3rd day, challenge the side riding on the oblique side of the wave surface. Day 4-5 is the process of deepening what you have learned until day 3. The cost is around 65,000 won on the first day and 150,000 won on the third day, including equipment rental. Personal training is only possible after learning at least 3 days. Of course, after the 1st day experience, most of them continue until the 3rd day.
Surfers heading to the sea for surfing
Surfing is very special because it slides on the water. It is a pleasure that you have never felt before. It has a different charm than a snowboard running on a snowy field. It's hard to break up once you fall into the charm that flows like a fish over the waves. "Surfing is like a mob. Once you're in there, there's no exit," said Kelly Slater, former World Surfer (WSL) champion. Surfing is a passionate and fascinating report.
Surfboard as a symbol of Songjeong Beach
The class time is about 3 hours per day. Starting in June, you can overlap with the surfers, so you will teach in the surf zone. In the summer, there are many people who want to learn to surf, so it's a good idea to challenge before the peak season begins. Some companies, such as Surfholic, lend their equipment and help them practice personally even after the class is over until May.
You can ride the wave with only 1st day training
Surfing is not greatly affected by the weather. It is good to surf in the rain on a rainy day. You can't swim because you wear a buoyant suit. In addition, the surfboard is connected to the ankle with a leash cord, making it easy to manage underwater. Preparations include a swimsuit, light toiletries and sunscreen. Beginners are advised to make a reservation after confirming in advance as low tide time is safe. Children can challenge if they are over 135cm tall.
Surf training is relatively safe at shallow water
Trip to Busan, Walking along the tracks of Songjeong Station
After surfing, go to Songjeong Station on the East Sea Nambu Line at the entrance of the beach. Songjeong Station was opened in 1934 and was designated as a registered cultural property in 2006. In 2013, the Donghae Nambu Line reached its end of life and lost the function of the station. I can feel the faded time everywhere. Currently, it is operated as a citizen gallery. Works were installed inside and outside the station.
Permanent exhibition inside Songjeong Station
The Donghae Nambu Line has also been reborn as an old trail. It is 4.8km from Songjeong Station to Cheongsapo Saegil to Mipo Crossing. They go through short tunnels and walk while looking at the sea. Either from Songjeong Station or Mipo, it takes 40 minutes to Cheongsapo Saegil and the rest of the trip takes about 40 minutes. When walking is a burden, you can take a walk around Songjeong Station lightly.
Travelers walking on the old road of the Donghae Nambu Line

item.title: Mukho Port-Mangsang Beach, East Sea - Donghae, Gangwon, Korea
item.description:
Walk from Mukho Port to Daejin Port or Mangsang Beach

Mukho Port-Mangsang Beach, East Sea

Donghae, Gangwon, Korea

It is a good time to walk. Wherever you want to walk, the place I chose today is the Sea of Japan Sea Route. Among them, we walk on the sunrise road of Donghae City, where the magnificent seascape and charming sights are combined. The coastal road (ilchulro) hidden inside National Highway 7 passes through Mukho Port, Eodal Port, and Daejin Port. Mukho Lighthouse, Nongoldamgil, Kamakbawi, and many other attractions, simple and small houses and shops are in harmony. When you pass by car, you can see the scenes that you may have missed.

Nongoldamgil and Mukho Lighthouse, famous for filming and drama locations

The route from Mukho Port to Daejin Port or Mangsang Beach belongs to Haeparanggil 34 course. Haeparang-gil is an east coast trail that runs from Busan in the south to Goseong in Gangwon-do in the north. 34 of them depart from Mukho Station in Donghae City and pass through Mukho Lighthouse, Eodal Port, Daejin Port, Mangsang Beach, and Simgok Yakcheon Village to Okgye Market in Gangneung City.

Feel the whole body of the sea with the fishy smell of fresh seafood caught at Mukho Port. Pick your favorite seafood from the fish market and take it to a nearby restaurant for cooking. There are also many restaurants, such as Gomchikuk and grilled fish. After filling the boat, we begin our walking tour in earnest.
The mural of Nongoldamgil
Go up the Nongoldamgil along the alley of Mukho Port Hill. Colorful murals are painted along the narrow alleys of the hillside village. It contains the stories of the people of the sea who lived around Mukho Port. Nongol 1-gil, 2-gil, 3-gil and Lighthouse-Oreum are central. Each alley has the theme of mukho's past, present, future, and mukho of all, and a mixture of time. It is more meaningful because it is a mural that contains stories about the past and present in the neighborhood. As you climb the Nongoldamgil, you will reach Mukho Lighthouse.
The mural of Nongoldamgil
The heavy white circular Mukho Lighthouse is located in the middle of the mountain at an altitude of 67m, and is easily seen from Mukho Port, and the sea view from here is also cool. The Mukho Lighthouse, founded in June 1963, was the main filming location for the movie <Hate Once Again>, and in 2003 a monument to the "Hometown of Movies" was erected. Mukho Lighthouse also appears in the films <Mary Story> and <Blue Alert>. The lighthouse is 12m high and can be seen from inside. As you climb the spiral staircase, you will see a lighthouse observation deck, and you can see the scenery from all sides.
Mukho Lighthouse, the symbol of Mukho Port
There are small parks and cafés with a good view around the lighthouse. The 'Lighthouse Cafe', located just below the Mukho Lighthouse, stops many people's steps with picturesque views. When coming down, let's choose the side of the rock. Mungho lighthouse and adjacent bridge became more famous for the drama <Beautiful Legacy>. Large
'Lighthouse Cafe' where you can relax while enjoying the cool view
Secluded resting place for locals, Adal Beach
A large rock appears as you walk along the sea line lined with sushi and small shops. It is a black rock. It is called a black rock just because a crow has hit a young on this rock. There is a sign that stands in the direction of Jeongdong from Namdaemun in Seoul. Opposite is a large sushi town.
When you walk on the sunrise road, you can see at a glance the black rock
Keep walking north. On the left, large and small shops form one landscape, and on the right, the deep blue sea completes another. It resembles the scenery of the northeast coast of Jeju Island. The rustic beach scenery is nice.
Eodal Port, famous for sea fishing
If you go up a little further from Eodal Port, it is Eodal Beach. It is a famous spot known to locals rather than tourists. It doesn't get too crowded during the peak summer season, so you can enjoy the summer quietly.
Adal Beach, a quiet and relaxing atmosphere
An interesting attraction created by surfers, Daejin Beach
From Adal Beach, head along the coastal road to Daejin Port. The road becomes more secluded. Although new cafes and shops are rarely seen, the sea and old buildings continue for a while.
How to get from Daedal Beach to Daejin Port
It is known that Daejin Port is located in the direction of Jeongdong in Gyeongbokgung Palace in Seoul. At the entrance to the long breakwater, there is a large marine parking lot and a Daejin Port Seafood Center. Walking on the breakwater, sea scenery, Daejin Port and village
Daejin Port scenery
Daejin Beach is full of surfers. Surfing classes are being held, providing interesting attractions. Advancing through the waves and struggling It is interesting to see them fly on the waves in an instant, making it difficult to keep an eye on them.
Daejin Beach is crowded with surfers
You can end your walking tour in Daejin Port or go to Nobong Beach and go to Mangsang Beach. Mangsang Beach boasts a large white sandy beach and is perfect for enjoying the relaxation of the sea. Stroll on the wide sandy beach and enjoy a cup of hot coffee in a cafe with a good view in front of the beach. It leaves a strange feeling on the sea walking tour.
Daejin Beach is crowded with surfers

item.title: A fragrance filled with tears, Goseong Honey Lavender Farm - Goseong-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea
item.description:
One day it rained

A fragrance filled with tears, Goseong Honey Lavender Farm

Goseong-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea

Your figure came softly like purple ~ ♪

Why did you sway 'You who came gently' to 'Purple'? When I was heading for Goseong Lavender Farm, I suddenly came across the lyrics of 'purple scent'. The thought that I've never had in my life has passed on this road, perhaps because my curiosity and anticipation about the purple world I'll meet soon dominated my mind.

Shinni Lavender Farm, a new world met in Goseong
The road to Goseong is long and rough. When you depart from Seoul, you must travel through Inje and Jinbu-ryeong for about 3 hours. Inje is the 38th border area that created "When and when you go to Inje," and Jinbu-ryeong is the stem of the Taebaek Mountains connecting Inje and Goseong. Novice drivers are even more reluctant because there are many winding roads. Nevertheless, there is a reason to head to Goseong. This is because it is now time for the lavenders of Hanni Lavender Farm to burst into purple flowers and create spectacular views. Lavender is a thankful thing to offer new sights in this poor season, where there is nothing but green to show until the foliage leaves. Knowing its uniqueness, people deliberately visit Goseong even on rainy days.
Rather, a watercolor
You must go through the ticket office and the herb shop to enter the lavender field. People who were curiously stepping on each other stopped at the entrance and made a short elastic. The landscape in the snow without notice is quite surprising.
Scenery that must be left as a photo
After seeing the appearance, he decided to try a different reaction, but eventually failed. The exclamation of "Wow" comes to the temple even in the landscape facing you.
There is no reason to walk fast
If the main character is a lavender field that looks like a purple carpet, rye and poppy flowers in a colony are excellent supporting roles that shine lavender. Buildings with traces of the paintbrush left on the outer wall are also the best backgrounds for this flower garden. The mist that came down to the mountain is nicer today. It is like a stage device that maximizes the dreamy feeling of purple. Anyway, it all goes perfectly. I've never been there, but it's like any country in Europe I've always dreamed of. A smile never leaves the strange feeling.
Rye field completely different from lavender
Walking around the corner of Honey Lab Farm
Let's go on a full-fledged lavender farm tour with an umbrella. Looking at the entrance, there is a lavender field on the front and right and a rye field on the left. The promenade is divided into two branches, left and right. The starting point on the milestone is the left side. Eventually, it is a course that returns to the origin and returns to the origin. However, there is a farmer's idea of drawing such a great picture on the canvas of the field, so I decided to follow it.
Bicycle wheels reminiscent of lavender and poppy
The size of the rye field is not large. Even the expectation of rotten and tender rye can be a little disappointing. At this time, the rye has been overgrown, so it looks like a rice that is ripe in yellowness. Still, it has its own qualities, so it's good to walk along a path. After passing through the rye field, you will be greeted by a poppy colony located outside as if escorting lavender. Each one seems to show off its splendor with a bunch of water on it.
A blooming poppy flower

On the other side of the entrance, Metasequoia stands like a folding screen. There are several tables and chairs between the trees, so it's good to take a break. Someone might think of words like 'unexpected' or 'accidental' while looking at metasequoia. However, it should be noted that this is also a landscape thoroughly calculated by the farmer. When the site was purchased, the landscaping farm, which was the owner of the original land, was given extra money to buy metasequoia. From the beginning, there was an idea to paint like this. Chestnut flowers are in full bloom outside Metasequoia Road. 'Isn't this too?' Think for a moment.

Metasequoia Road
Now it is time to observe lavender in earnest. Looking at the petals up close, the first impression is modest. Metasequoia and Poppy are very different from the ones that showed their greatness alone. It is much shorter than I thought. It's barely covering the knee.
The scenery is diverse, so it's fun to take pictures
However, the story is different in the vastly spread lavender community. The fragrance becomes darker and the color becomes more vivid. It's even more so if it rains like today. It is fluttering in the wind and creates a purple sea.
A leisurely stroll between mother chickens and chicks
It is not only people who cross this sea. Chickens and chicks raised on farms find food and take a stroll here. Even bees, which are hard to see in the city, have no time to collect pollen. If you listen with your eyes closed, you can clearly hear the happy singing of the bees.
Lavender tractor
It takes about an hour to slowly walk around the Honey Lavender Farm. On weekends where there is a lot of experience, it can be longer.
When the sky is more cloudy than the blue sky, my color is clearly displayed.
Efforts in the fragrance of lavender
Until Hanni Lavender Farm became a wonderful farm as it is now, there was a bloody sweat of Ha Deok-ho. Lavender was the weapon of choice for selling different herbal teas online. I traveled abroad and looked for scenes that could be modeled. As a result, the honey lavender lavender farm was created by partially referring to the lavender fields in Hokkaido. In 2002, even the word landscape farming was unfamiliar.
Herb Shop Products
Goseong, Gangwon-do, which was warm in winter and cool in summer, was selected as the best place for lavender farm. There was no place like this to grow lavender, which had poor cold resistance. A variety of plants such as lavender, rye, poppy, and white pink celix were planted by purchasing suitable sites. At first it was difficult of course. Few customers visited the Goseong Valley, but the investment continued to be unknown. Eventually, some of the purchased land was sold to increase lavender. It's a small private farm, but it's a steady festival.
Lavender scent bag that became the best seller
This effort began to pay off in 10 years. Tourists are increasing every year, photographers from all over the country gather, and love calls from broadcasters and filmmakers follow. Work is still going on, but old fatigue flies away when you see the admirers of lavender.
Backyard with Sihwajeon open

'Honey Farm Lavender Festival' celebrated 12 times this year. At the festival, various experience programs using lavender, such as making lavender sachets, making aroma sprays, and making lavender pizzas, are operated. In addition, events such as drawing contests, scent concerts, and photo contests are also held.

Ha is planning to develop this place into an art farm in the future and use it as a local channel to promote the works of difficult artists.

Works produced by the Goseong Youth Literature Society are on display

I had a pretty scent in my eyes and couldn't forget it ~ ♪

The identity of 'You who approached lightly' appearing in 'Purple Scent' seems to be dim now. Perhaps he had a dreamy and subtle charm. It would have been better to shine than to shine yourself. If it met on a rainy day or at the dawn of the water mist, it would have shown a different face than usual. And at one time it was someone's tears. Like lavender.

Tree hanging over snowy lavender farm winter landscape
Travel info

Honey Lavender Farm

item.title: Finding the taste of everyday life in China, Daelim 2-dong Chinese Village - Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Chinese Village Street in front of Exit 12 of Daelim Station on Subway Lines 2 and 7

Finding the taste of everyday life in China, Daelim 2-dong Chinese Village

Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, Korea

If you walk around Daelim Central Market in Daelim 2-dong, Yeongdeungpo-gu, you will experience illiteracy unintentionally. Eight percent of the language you see and hear is Chinese. It is a place where the lives of Chinese people can be seen as if they were thought of as Korean villages in China, not Chinese villages in Korea. Let's meet a variety of different foods that Chinese people enjoy everyday in a Chinese village located in Daelim 2-dong.
Daelim 2-dong, a daily scene in China
Usually, the residential area is quiet during the day and has a busy time during commute. However, the streets of the Chinese village in Daelim 2-dong are a little different. As more and more Chinese people live in Daelim 2-dong, Chinese merchants entered one another. As Koreans begin to visit, the day and night of Daelim 2-dong is an ordinary week.
People enjoying a midday meeting
Daelim Jungang Market is located inside the alley in front of Exit 12 of Daelim Station on Subway Lines 2 and 7. The scenery here is different from any traditional market in Korea. Every other house sells Chinese-style ingredients, so it's hard to tell whether this is China or Korea when you walk around the market. medium
Chinese vegetables commonly found in Daelim Central Market
It is also common for shops to sell a variety of smoked meat, including Sochang, Daechang Sundae, and dried pork, on a board and sell them by weight. A Chinese-style tofu shop, which looks like a general tofu store, has a thick but soft tofu that rises in the middle of the seat.
Shop selling various kinds of smoked meat
Various main beaks stimulate curiosity along the way. Chinese dumplings, steamed buns, and steamed pears look similar to Korean hotteok, croquettes, and bindaetteok. However, whatever Chinese style is large, the texture, flavor and taste are completely different. Menus that I've never seen before are fragile. Although it looks like a tray of eggs of only one size, the bread that is cut into the shape of a pizza like a pizza, a pimento glutinous rice cake filled with glutinous rice in green peppers, and even the food with rice in thin tofu, the name and taste are unfamiliar, but there are things that you can try lightly It's very thick.
Spicy rice cake filled with glutinous rice
You can choose what you like and feel the taste of mainland China. There are so many varieties that I am greedy, but let's be patient. Now, you can go to a restaurant that does not speak Korean well, order Chinese food, and taste Chinese food.
It's also common to be hot-teak and pretzel.
Chinese shabu-shabu, hot pot
‘훠 냄비’, which means ‘hot pot’, is a Chinese-style shabu-shabu, which is cooked by boiling various ingredients over broth. It is a common hotpot eaten in most parts of China, but the ingredients used in the hot pot vary depending on the ingredients from each region.
One mandarin duck
If you taste mainland Chinese food for the first time, it is good to cook Yuantang. Mandarin duck is a type of bird that is commonly known, and here means ‘pair’. This is because clear white and spicy red hot broth are served together in a divided pot.
Boil it in a pot with a compartment and eat it.
The broth has a unique scent, and the amount of ingredients is very generous. Put the ingredients in the bath and wait until they are cooked, so you must prepare them to eat the ingredients. When ordering a hot pot, give the peanut sauce, minced green onion and coriander mixed with various seasonings. On the table is a Chinese spice, Tsuran. Tsuran is a spice made from the seeds of the apiaceae cumin. It is bitter, spicy and has a strong aroma, and it removes odor. Of these four, mix them with one that suits your taste and the sauce is complete. Coriander and Tsuran can be burdensome with their unique scent, so check the taste and scent beforehand.
Make the sauce by steaming it with peanut sauce, chopped green onion, coriander, etc.
'Daesikdae' and 'Eusseonbang' are divided into 1st and 2nd floors, but they are connected to each other. They sell a variety of Chinese foods, from traditional to fusion cuisine. The hot pot shabu-sha of this house
Tsuran is always on the Chinese restaurant table
In the opposite building, there is a restaurant called “Soonpung Seafood Shabu Shabu”, which costs 35,000 won per set for 2-3 people.
‘Daesikdae’ and ‘Eonseonbang’ which sells various Chinese foods.
Sweet and sour pork is perfect for the popular noodle soup!
If you have Champon in Korea, there is Maratang in China. Maratang refers to ‘tang hot enough to be paralyzed’, which is considered one of the hottest food in China. Pork bones are chopped with over 20 spices and seasonings. Various vegetables, dried tofu, and vermicelli enter there, but it is difficult to count them even with your own eyes.
Maratang, spicy noodle soup popularly eaten by Chinese
When ordering, there are places where the chef takes care of it, and there are also restaurants where customers choose the ingredients that go into the bath. ‘Bongseon Maratang’ is a specialty store that boils after ordering. There are basic (6,000 won) and lamb (羊肉) marathon (9,000 won). There are also several restaurants that order ingredients. Buffet over the window
'Bongseon Maratang' panoramic view
The dish that goes well with the spicy and fragrant marathon is definitely Kwabaru. Cucumbero is a Beijing-style glutinous rice soup. The sourness beyond the sour taste and the sweetness wrapped around the tongue make the mouth clean even though it is a fried dish. What is different with Chinese sauce is the thickness of the meat and the tempura.
'Maratang' is written in various places in the restaurant.
In recent years, many restaurants have Korean menus, but some do not speak Korean at all. In that case, don't panic and find another Korean-speaking guest and ask for help. It will be another pleasure to experience foreign food. The Chinese village of Daelim 2-dong is hard to find and there are many passers-by, so it is better to use public transportation.
Chewy and crispy

item.title: A mysterious island that opens a vast and mongdol-gil, healing trekking, Tongyeong retail water ~ lighthouse island - Tongyeong, Gyeongnam, Korea
item.description:
Lighthouse Island from Retail Waterway

A mysterious island that opens a vast and mongdol-gil, healing trekking, Tongyeong retail water ~ lighthouse island

Tongyeong, Gyeongnam, Korea

Tongyeong, a beautiful port city in the South Sea of Hallyeosu Island. The scent of culture and art, as well as the land spreading gently, is a jewel-like island scattered in the Tongyeong Sea. Among the numerous islands he embraced, he left for the rock formations, lighthouse islands, and retail outlets where “Mysterious Sea Road” unfolds. Finding a fairy tale island on a summer day.
Apparently, the retail price was 'island in fairy tales'. The retail road that was headed to a winter alone in the middle of the twenties was a pretty and Jericho island. Thanks to me, I used to think of it like my first love. Then, after about 10 years, “I still wondered, how did it change?” With a little bit of anticipation and excitement, the retail road that I found again was not a cute island, but a mountain. The body that has become heavy over the years has also played a role, but the retail product was not just the “small and beautiful island” that appeared in the confectionary CF.
It seems that the 'biasedness' about retail sales wasn't the only reporter. At first glance, I see beautiful women wearing high shoes that are sure to be new sandals. Pretty, but like any other island in the vast sea, comfortable shoes are a must to look around in the sleeves of 'Dolsan'.
Picturesque scenery created by wind and waves
Myeongdo Island is composed of three islands: Daemaemuldo, Retail Muldo, and Lighthouse Island. Among them, the retail waterway and the lighthouse island meet each other, making a path over the sea twice or twice a day. Located in the middle of the sea, the two islands facing each other as if they depended on each other boast excellent scenery thanks to the heavy waves and the rocks depicted by the wind. This is the reason why many people are looking for retail goods among the numerous islands that have filled the sea and the sea of Tongyeong, such as Hansando, Chubongdo, Yokjido, and Bijindo.
To go to the retail waterway, you have to take a boat at the Tongyeong Passenger Ship Terminal. Departs three times daily (06:50, 10:50, 14:30). Departures increase during peak season or weekends. Also, it is flexible depending on the weather and passenger situation, so it is better to check in advance. Especially during the summer vacation, the weather fluctuates depending on the weather, so check it again and again.
Bijindo Coral Beach stops at retail
How long has it been? The boat stops for a moment after passing through Hansando. Bijindo is famous for its beautiful coast. Even in the passenger ship, fine white sand beaches can be seen at a glance. People go back to the ocean, where the half-loaded ship continues to endlessly. Approximately 2.5 hours (about 756 pyeong) after 1 hour and 20 minutes of departure
Passenger ships that reached retail docks
As soon as you get off the boat, the ascent begins. Houses are gathered on steep slopes. On the quayside, there are convenience facilities such as accommodations and restaurants such as <Lighthouse Sashimi House>, <Dasol Pension>, <Retail Muldo Pension>. Retails also began to visit
The view of retail water from the dock
If you've solved both, start immediately. The road to Lighthouse Island leads to steep stone steps and wooden decks that run through the village. As the island rises in the middle of the sea, there is no way to go uphill. There is a shade that rests in the middle, so you can walk slowly.
The island sleeves also have a steep uphill path.
After a short walk in the shade, a forked road emerges. All of them are on the way to Lighthouse Island, but if you go to the left, you can directly reach Lighthouse Island, and if you go to the right, you can also stop at the retail store, Mangtaebong. If you want to photograph the great scenery of Lighthouse Island, we recommend the right path. Of course, you can go directly to Lighthouse Island. On the way home, even if you stop by Mantaebong
When you get off the boat, it overlooks the village and the marina.
Lighthouse Island crossing the Mongdol that rises above the sea
When you climb to the top of Mangtaebong, you can see the Customs History Office for sale. It was a former customs surveillance post that monitored smuggling around the South Coast in the 1970s and 1980s. The peaks of the net, the name of “Mantaebong,” is well suited to the lighthouse island scenery as well as the distant ocean.
Myeongdo-do Customs Office located in Mangtaebong
The foot of Mangtaebong and the picturesque Lighthouse Island unfold before your eyes. You can see Byeongpung Rock, the representative image of Gingsinggulgul and Mulmuldo Island, where the emperor of the Emperor Qin Shi, who came to save Bulcho, carved letters.
From Mantaebong to Lighthouse Island
That's it. Thanks to the clear weather, Daegu Eulbido and Sogu Eulbido appear far away. There will soon be a row of cobblestone paths connecting the retail waterway and the lighthouse island. I descend to the coast to go to Lighthouse Island.
The lighthouse island seen from the top view of Mangtaebong
If you find a retail waterway, cross the Lighthouse Island, which you will never miss. The retail island and the lighthouse island are about 80m away, but at low tide twice a day, a small “miracle of Moses” occurs between them. Mongdol Beach, also known as 'Yeolmokgae Gravel Road', is exposed above the sea. If you match the boat time and tide time, you can have a “special experience” that crosses the Mongdol towering over the sea and crosses the lighthouse island and retail waterway.
The retail view from Lighthouse Island
The cobbled road that leads from the large stones like dinosaur eggs to the small mongdols of various sizes is a little uncomfortable to walk, but it is unparalleled in the special experience of walking on the sea.
Lighthouse Island from Mongdolgil
The stairs continue through Mongdol to the lighthouse. The slope is a little steep, but it can be reached in 10 minutes. Don't miss the scenery of the retail water view from Lighthouse Island. In this way, it took enough time for the retail to pass from the pier to Mangtaebong to Lighthouse Island. It is time to add photos. Adding up to the time to go back again is enough for about 4 hours round trip. If you come in the first boat (6:50 AM) from the Tongyeong Passenger Ship Terminal and go out to the last boat (4:30 PM), there is no reason to wander around the island. The most important tide time is the National Maritime Survey ( http://www.khoa.go.kr ).
Retail water is also normal
At the pier, there are also ships to and from Tongyeong and Geoje, as well as cafes and restaurants. The fun of shooting the sea breeze while waiting for the ship to enter is also quite impressive. Wealth if time comes
Viewing Lighthouse Island and returning to the marina
TIP. Retail trekking
It is also called Myeongdo-do by bundling Daemaeul-do, Retail and also Lighthouse Island. A retail island that tourists usually visit is a small island of 2.5km, located alongside Lighthouse Island. Retail items also climbed from the dock to Mangtaebong. The main course to Lighthouse Island is 3-4 hours round trip. However, time and water
TIP. Tongyeong↔Retail water distribution
Departs three times a day (06:50, 10:50, 14:30) from Tongyeong Passenger Terminal (1666-0960, 055-645-3717). Peak season increases. Please check in advance as there are changes to the ship depending on the weather and the number of passengers. 3 times a day from the retail waterway to Tongyeong Port (08:35, 12:35, 1 http://island.haewoon.co.kr/ ), Hansol Shipping ( http://hshaewoon.co.kr ).

item.title: Invigorate the traditional market! Mayor of Jeung-dong, Gyeongdong Market - Dongdaemun-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Win-Win Growth Market in the middle of Gyeongdong Market

Invigorate the traditional market! Mayor of Jeung-dong, Gyeongdong Market

Dongdaemun-gu, Seoul, Korea

The traditional market slowly closes at 5pm. However, the win-win growth that has settled in the market starts to flourish from then on. I visited the 'community growth hall', a cultural complex that dreams of a marketplace where market merchants and young people coexist.
'Win-win growth' emerging as the future of traditional markets
There is a space that blends all of this, from food full of personality, to cold homemade beer to blow the heat into a room, and to a spacious rooftop overlooking Dongdaemun. It is also in the middle of the market! Sangsangjang, which has recently emerged as a hot place for Cheongnyangni, is located in Gyeongdong Market, a permanent market between Jegi-dong and Cheongnyangni, Dongdaemun-gu, Seoul.
Climb the stairs to meet the growth
Gyeongdong Market was originally a market where rural residents in Gyeonggi-do and Gangwon-do sold agricultural products, souvenirs, and specialty products. As the market grew, it became a traditional market of the same size. When you walk out of Cheongnyangni Station Exit 1 and walk about 200m, you will meet. Gyeongdong Market is home to a variety of agricultural products and fruitful fruits and vegetables. And nowadays, there is a win-win growth center, one of the best places in Cheongnyangni.
How to use Win-Win Growth on one side
Win-win growth is a compound word of 'win-win' to be together and 'jang' of the market to mean a coexisting space. The cultural complex space located in Gyeongdong Market began as a project to revitalize the traditional market. With the title of 'Win-Win Project', this place has been established as a space to attract young people to the traditional market.
The space on the left side of the entrance is used as a kitchen
In the complex and lively market, the first feeling that entered another space for growth was 'unique'. I think there will be a place like this in the middle of the market! The coexistence center was originally left as a space used by market traders for a long time, but now it has become a lively and vibrant place through the hands of young people.
You can enjoy various types of craft beer
The Win-Win Growth Center is open from Tuesday to Sunday except Monday. It is open from 5pm to 12pm on weekdays and from 12pm to 12pm on weekends. Is it because it is a space where young people and merchants in the traditional market come together, and there are various people who are looking for a win-win growth from merchants who stopped by to take a break to young friends who are dating.
Enjoy the food and appreciate the work of emerging artists
Choose what you like and eat
The size of the win-win market that uses the 2nd and 3rd floors of the market building is very large. On one side is a kitchen space where you can make food full of personality, on the other side is a space where people can enjoy food, and a space where works by various artists are displayed. It is more attractive because you can enjoy delicious food in a spacious and free space and enjoy various works.
Homemade beer that combines sweetness and bitterness
You can find a variety of menus with the personality of the young bosses in the coexistence area, and most of them are unusual menus such as 'Drop the Meat', 'Chicken and Waffles', 'Spinach Chili Pasta', and 'Spam Cheese Mousse Kimbab'. The menu is constantly changing, and the menu is selected and calculated at the counter located in the middle of the space. Beside the counter, you can enjoy homemade beer operated by a craft beer cooperative, and there are about 15 types of beer. You can enjoy fresh and unique beers such as 'Yuzu Ale', 'American Yellow Ale', and 'Alt Ale'.
Various menus with the personality of young bosses
Healing time at the rooftop
The 3rd floor is a highlight of the win-win growth and a rooftop overlooking the Gyeongdong Market. As a spacious space, the rooftop with a wide view is used as a concert hall for musicians, a talk concert hall for celebrities, a flea market, and an urban camping ground, and is a communication space for young people. At sunset, is there a better place than this to take a menu ordered on the second floor and bring it to the rooftop to gather together and enjoy a glass of beer? It is a win-win growth market that aims to reinvent the disappearing traditional market as a cultural space created by young people, while supporting the start-up of young people. The rediscovery of space is loved by many people and breathing new breath into the city.
Rooftop of Win-Win Growth Center on the 3rd floor
