item.title: Early Spring Day, Relaxing Sea Walk Gangneung Yeongjin Beach - Gangneung, South Korea
item.description:
Yeongjin beach landscape

Early Spring Day, Relaxing Sea Walk Gangneung Yeongjin Beach

Gangneung, South Korea

The spring breeze drinks a cup of hot coffee on the beach. The harmony of the sea and coffee enhances the value of relaxation. In order to enjoy the early spring time, we leave for Gangneung, the city of sea and coffee. Instead of the bustle of Gangneung Port (Anmok Beach) cafe street, which is already well known, the destination is Yeongjin Beach, which is well-known for knowing. Enjoy a half-day stroll at Yeongjin Beach, a place where you can relax and enjoy the calm springtime.
Relaxing springtime beach with a cup of coffee
As is the case with Gangneung, there are more and more cafes on the beaches of Gangneung. In the old days, Gangneung Port Cafe Street was the center, and now you can find cafes on various beaches in Gangneung. Some prefer Gangneung Port Café Street, where many cafes are crowded, while others prefer quiet, quiet beachside cafes. Sacheonjin Beach and Yeongjin Beach are the places that many people with the latter taste find. If Gangneung Port Café Street is a big star, is Sacheonjin Beach and Yeongjin Beach an indie star with mania fans?
Yeongjin Beach is located between Jumunjin Port and Sacheonjin Port. It is also the place where 12 courses of Baugil from Sacheonjin Beach to Jumunjin pass. On the shore of Yeongjin Beach, you can see the tranquil Yeongjin Port on one side and the bustling Order Port on the other. Yeongjin Beach has wide sandy beaches, clean, and light blue. The water is even brighter on sunny spring days. The water is shallow and the water is clean, so the floor is clearly visible. It is good to walk the trilogy while enjoying the warm sun. Soft sand and gentle spring light tickle the mind. There aren't many people, so it's great to enjoy a relaxing walk in spring. Add a cup of warm coffee to the spring sea walk, which still feels cold.
Early Springtime, Yeongjin Beach Scenery
There are not many cafes on the beach of Yeongjin, which looks like a peaceful fishing village. But it is also a special place with the history of Gangneung Coffee. Gangneung is a pioneer in establishing the city of coffee and Bohemian, one of Gangneung's two great mountains, is located on a small hill near Yeongjin Beach. If you enter the village from the beach, you can taste savory coffee in Bohemian, which is run by Park Yi-chu, a master of coffee.
Early Springtime, Yeongjin Beach Scenery
In front of Yeongjin Beach is 'Cafe Brazil' which started its business in 2008. A modern two storey building catches the eye. In the early days, single-storey houses were remodeled and operated as cafes. I roasted fresh coffee every day, serving high quality coffee.
Cafe Brasil, a modern two-story building
In the fall of 2013, it was transformed into the same stylish two-story building. Both the 1st and 2nd floors are equipped with glass windows, so you can see the sea at a glance. There is also a large outdoor terrace on the ground floor.
Outdoor terrace with cafe brazil inside
As you enter the room on the first floor and order a cup of coffee, you'll notice the words on the wall. "Coffee is as black as the devil, as hot as hell, as pure as an angel, as sweet as love." Swallow a cup of hot and sweet coffee in your hand.
Outdoor terrace with cafe brazil inside
Cafe Brazil's main character is not just coffee. Cool sea views co-star. The same is true on the first floor, but on the second floor, a panoramic view of the ocean over the tall glass is spread out.
Attractive glass windows overlooking the sea
While walking on the beach and looking at the sea from the front, the sea is beautiful, but the sea overlooking from a high space is also fascinating. Sipping warm coffee and admiring the sea so that your eyes are cold. Where do you want to see this eye again?
Attractive glass windows overlooking the sea
Squid Bread and Homemade Burger on Yeongjin Beach
If you're unhappy with a cup of coffee, you can go to the marshmallow and squid bread shop on Yeongjin beach. After walking out of Café Brazil, you will see a small two-story building with the big word squid bread. This shop features specialty breads made with Jumunjin's famous squid.
A marshmallow and squid bread shop on Yeongjin beach
The word squid bread stimulates curiosity. How does squid bread taste? The size is small enough to fit in the palm of your hand. Small but with everything from fins to eyes and legs. It's not just appearance. Inside is a real ordered squid.
A marshmallow and squid bread shop on Yeongjin beach
If you think that the bread with red bean paste is 'there'll be there,' it is a miscalculation. Let's get rid of the preconception that squid and bread don't seem appropriate. Squid and bread create a harmonious taste. Contains squid powder and squid extract, as well as real squid. If you take a bite, savory squid and sweet bread taste at the same time. One by one, two go hand in hand.
Gentle squid bread with real squid
The second floor is decorated with a cafe, overlooking the sea, with squid bread and coffee or tea. There is also a squid bread experience where you can draw your own pictures on squid bread.
Gentle squid bread with real squid
If you still have some regrets to leave this sea, let's go get a meal. There is also a homemade burger shop on Yeongjin Beach that is emerging as a cafe these days. Winnie Burger is a 2-minute walk from Juicy and Squid Bread Shop towards Jumunjin. There are many local burgers in Gangneung because you can taste a variety of homemade burgers in a busy atmosphere.
A hearty homemade burger looking out to sea
More than 10 burgers are available, including the most basic Winnie Burger with thick patties and fresh vegetables, the unique Sweet Pine Burger made with Donut Burn instead of hamburger buns, Winnie Cajun Burger and BBQ Egg Burger. Among them are wine burgers with garlic wine sauce and mozzarella cheese burgers that flow like a waterfall. If you feel overwhelmed with cheese, you can choose a hot chili burger with a spicy flavor. Depending on your taste, you can add toppings such as mozzarella cheese, pineapple, patty, egg, and jalapeno.
A hearty homemade burger looking out to sea
Winnie Burger consists of a small first floor where ordering and cooking takes place and a spacious second floor with unobstructed sea views. Enjoying a burger while looking out the sea through a large window doubles the taste. On a warm spring day, you can sit on the outdoor terrace to take a break from the tickling sea breezes and the sound of the last wave.
Winnie Burger 2F View
Travel info

item.title: 5 burning flavors to blow away your stress - Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Spicy Grilled Feet of <Changsin-dong Spicy Feet>

5 burning flavors to blow away your stress

Yeongdeungpo-gu, Seoul, Korea

In fact, 'taste' has nothing to do with the season. Didn't find hot food in the summer because of the heat. The same is true for winter. The cold noodles called 'cool noodles' were a winter delicacy in the north of Korea. Nevertheless, there is a ‘taste’ that crosses the season. The hot taste of the tip of the nose, the whole body getting hot, and the drops of sweat springing up one by one. Here's a spicy taste that will blow you away from the stress that comes up behind your neck even when you're in tears.

#One. Singil-dong Spicy Champon

The spicy taste of Seoul, the best champon restaurant that comes to mind when you first think of it.
Originally, the food itself has a spicy taste. Among them, spicy is one of the nation's wards, so be prepared. No matter how urgently the champon is, you should prepare a drink that will soothe the extreme spiciness.
When you enter the store, there is a warning saying 'Please don't try Wanpong'. 'Empty, pregnant women, senior citizens, high blood pressure, gastritis, gastric ulcers, bad condition champon absolute envoy' is added. I want to try spicy jjamppong. The appearance is not much different from the champon I've seen so far. Suffering, the pain begins as soon as you take the broth and take it to your mouth. It's spicy and spicy. But my hand keeps going. It is the same as those who ate champon with tears and runny noses. Not much seafood, but good for the price. It's hard, but it's spicy when I turn around. When it's complicated, it disappears as soon as it finds it. It's better to remember the hot soup season. However, be sure to include udon or gimbap for our stomach. We are precious.

#2. I shed tears, spicy pork cutlet, Shindaebang warm pork cutlet
Enjoy pork cutlet for all ages. To what extent can you think of the spicy taste of pork cutlet that is perfect for a weekend family outing? The champon, jokbal, chicken feet, and tteokbokki that are introduced as `` Seoul spicy '' are spicy in the seasoning itself, so it is not difficult to imagine the spicy taste. On the other hand, the cutlet taste is only remembered, but the spicy taste is not well associated. This prejudice (?) Disappears naturally when you look for 'Honjeong Dongas', which is famous for its spicy pork cuts near the Sindaebang Intersection.
Spicy pork cutlet of <warm pork cutlet>
Onjeong Dongas, already introduced several times on TV programs, is a tonkatsu specialty store. From authentic cutlet and fish gas to spicy seasoned cutlet and spicy cutlet. Up to this point, you can not find much difference with the general pork cutlet shop.
Authentic pork cutlet boasting a generous amount at an affordable price
The point is spicy cutlet which is not on the menu. If you eat everything within 20 minutes, you have to pay for free. You can't eat spicy, but if you're a big eater, you can try the giant tonkatsu. If you eat it within 20 minutes, it will be free. If you inhale two inexpensive pork cuts within 10 minutes, you can taste pork cuts for free for 6 months if you inhale within 2 minutes and 5 minutes.
Spicy Pork Cutlet
Rather than ordering spicy tonkatsu from the beginning, try the pork cutlets on the menu. Spicy pork cutlet service to all customers. A quarter of pork cutlet is put in your mouth and spicy. Sweat on your forehead will heat your neck and face. The warning "Galphos + Milk Required" was not okay. It's better to taste this tasting pork cutlet and decide whether to order one.
A piece of spicy (dinda) pork cutlet for tasting
For reference, the reporter ate only one piece, but struggled to shake off the spicy taste that goes through the head and torso. After an hour or so, my stomach started shaking. The first point is to try and taste spicy pork cutlet.
Comparison between regular cutlet and spicy (dish) cutlet
# 3. Delicious spicy, Changsin-dong hot pork feet
What would you have thought about adding spicy sauce to the pig's feet? I think it's a dish equivalent to 'donuts with donuts'.
Changsin-dong Spicy Pig's Feet
Just jogbal does not feel a bit boring, spicy jokbal has no place to think. The meat is as strong and chewy as it is. It also adds spicy rice balls, which makes it a good choice for meals and snacks. Governor Giza also had plenty of food to eat. It's a spicy flavor that keeps going.
Changsin-dong Spicy Pig's Feet
Get off at Dongdaemun Station or Dongmyomae Station, enter Changsin Market, and go out at the entrance. This is the main store. From the beginning of the market, the smell of grilling seasoned pork feet vibrates. The smell is amazing Even when I see it, my stomach becomes full and strong.
Spicy grilled chicken feet. I added rice balls to reduce the spiciness.
If you like lean meat, you can order miniatures if you have better collagen areas with grilled pig feet or assorted pig feet. There is a cool piece to reduce the spiciness.
Spicy Mini
Instead of 'strong medicine' where sweat oozes out of your head like <Shingil-dong Spicy Jjambbong> or <Ondondon Gas>, the smoky spicy taste that makes your lips tingle is attractive.
Spicy Chilled Coolpeace
#4. Eat red pepper, Dongdaemun Yeopgi Tteokbokki
If you really want a spicy taste, there is Dongdaemun Yeopgi Tteokbokki, called `` Yuppteok. '' The tongue tastes spicy but can't stop eating. After eating, you should be ready to walk in and out of the bathroom for about a day. Some people are angry that they are spicy, but once you step here, you will come back to the taste. The addictive spicy taste is a powerful taste that makes modern people suffering from stress forget all of it.
Spicy Tteokbokki Representative Celebrity <Dongdaemun Bizarre Tteokbokki> Basic Set
Steamed eggs and rice balls are a must, and add slush to your mouth. As you sweat, your annoyance disappears, leaving only the mouth and lips pain. Still, the idea of delicious does not disappear. However, no matter how motivated, do not eat soup with a spoon.
Thank you reinforcement spicy, rice balls and steamed egg
Tteokbokki is high on price but high in quantity. Add one saree, enough for three to four people to eat. If you choose set menu, you can taste it a little cheaper.
The most spicy noodles in Tteokbokki
# 5. Delicious spicy Bangi Binja chicken feet
Do you like chicken feet? It's very mysterious and gross, but once you taste it, the slight stipples that the appearance gives you are gone. It is understandable why so many people found chicken feet. delicious. Bony chicken feet are fun to eat with bones, and boneless chicken feet are easy to eat in a bite. Although there are differences depending on each person's taste, I think the whole bone is better to feel the natural taste of chicken feet. Spicy seasoning was added to these chicken feet. Spicy chicken feet are great as both side dishes and side dishes. Dudong!
<Ijinja chicken feet> grilled chicken feet
Like spicy pork feet, chicken feet are a must for rice balls that will reduce the spiciness and prevent heartburn. `` Ijinja Chicken Feet '' is located at the end of Bangi-dong Eat Alley. If you call 20 minutes ago, the chicken fried chicken soup is also good. The chicken feet that are just coming out are spicy, but if you want a stronger spicy taste, you can adjust them when you order them.
Seasoned Chicken Feet Before Roasting
Chicken feet dressed in seasoning are grilled over the grill. Dishes Cooked Roasted chicken feet boast a strong spicy taste with added fire. President Lee Jin-ja, the owner of the restaurant, accepts orders, cooks and pays, so wait. In addition, the opening hours are flexible, so it's a good idea to check beforehand. The system is not equipped, but the chicken feet are known as one know. It is located in the alley next to Bang Middle School.
Grilled chicken feet for grilling

item.title: The face talked, the story came out - Gwangju, Gyeonggi, South Korea
item.description:
Portraits of Japanese Military Comfort Women Victims

The face talked, the story came out

Gwangju, Gyeonggi, South Korea

The grandmothers of the Japanese comfort women history have nothing to say. Tell the past years with your face. The grandmothers in the paintings are deeply stacked with sad stories in fan folds. There are about 1000 faces on the face of the museum. Some faces seem to want something, while others seem to realize the uselessness of emotions over time. Seeds of time and woven faces of stories. He visits Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do to listen to the myriad faces.
The tears on her face have wrinkles
The fluffy white girls of the 1930s became gray-haired grandmothers in 2019. It has been 80 years since the victims of the Japanese comfort women. Of the 238 grandmothers who were registered with the government, only 22 survived. Their average age is in their 90s. There may not be much time left. We need a place where we can better remember our grandmothers. So good news. The Japanese military comfort women's museum in Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do was newly expanded.
“We must leave in history the work we did not overcome.” It was first opened in 1998 on the back of Grandmother Kim Hak-soon, the first to testify to the damage of the Japanese military 'comfort women'. Since then, in late 2017, a relic exhibition hall and memorial archives have been established. It is a memorial to the back of the sharing house, passing through the entrance where the girl's flower, which is a symbol of victims of the Japanese military 'comfort women', and the bust of grandmothers. It is a two storey building with tiled walls. The memorial building on the first floor is divided into three parts. There are grandmothers portraits in the exhibition hall, the relics of the grandmothers in the relics exhibition hall, and about 20 paintings painted by grandmothers in the paintings exhibition hall.
Grandmother bust of `` comfort women '' at the entrance of Japanese comfort women history museum
There are 10 paintings side by side that are more than 1 meter wide. It is a picture of grandmothers by performing artist Poppin Hyun-joon. He said. "I painted it again with the hope that my grandmother's face would not be forgotten." Every grandmother has a different look and mood. Grandmother Park Ok-ryon of the white hair shut firmly on the date of her mouth, and Bae Choon-hee raised her mouth as if smiling. Kim Gunja grandma soon said, "Did you eat?" It's playful eyes like I'm talking. Instead of opening up their mouths to explain themselves, grandmothers spend much of their lives with expressions of lines and colors. The girl's tears dried up and became her grandmother's wrinkles. The grandmothers in the painting closed their eyes without receiving official Japanese apology.
Portraits by Grandmother Poppin Hyun Joon
Older girls talked and painted
"I don't know why things are so vivid, even if I can't remember what's near."
Kim Soon-deok says. In the exhibition hall, there are seventeen grandmothers' life histories, photographs, and items they used during their lifetime. 'Live a life together' is the title of the exhibition. It was a life where there was something more lonely than something pleasant, something more than something to remember.
Exhibition of exhibits
"All of my friends are dead and I'm just living back."
11 years old, the youngest of the "comfort women" registered with the government. Grandma Kim returned home alone from Hokkaido, Japan. Kim Ok-joo was deceived by a Japanese landlord saying she had a job. The arrival was a comfort station in Hainan Island, China. Each story is long and long to abbreviate in just a few lines.
Relics Exhibition Hall
The things you used in your life are so simple. Magnifying glass, Hwatu, Hangul textbooks, passports that would hold 'Dandy' in hand . I was crying and angry, and I was slowing down as I calmed my heart.
Grandma's Rustic Keepsakes
There is still music in the picture exhibition. Seochon Alley, it seems that you entered a small gallery. Grandmothers have been painting since 1993. At first, I was drawing along things around me, but as time passed, I began to express the past.
A picture exhibition featuring over 20 paintings painted by grandmothers
Maybe fifteen? A girl in a white jacket is drawn to someone's arm. The wild flowers that bloomed in her homeland were so beautiful that she could not hear the girl's cry. Kim Soon-deok's <Attracting> vividly depicts the moment she was taken to the comfort woman.
Grandmother Kim Soon-duk's Work
Most of the girls in the paintings cover their faces with their hands, their eyes closed, or they have no expression.
Grandmother Kang Deok-gyeong's work
Yes. The only thing a girl could do in front of the Japanese soldiers waiting in line and waiting for one person to lie down.
Kang, Deok-Kyung's work <Penant Officer>

In the memorial hall, you can see the hand-printing of the victims, photos of 105 victims of domestic and foreign “comfort women” and a list of 280. It is the face of courageous accusers of Japanese war crimes. If you want to know more about the history of the Japanese military 'comfort women', you should also look around the existing history. The background of the establishment of the comfort women system, a record of activities on finding out facts, and a map showing the location of the Japanese military comfort station are arranged in detail. In the third exhibition space, there is a comfort station model with reference to victim testimony. The side room is 5 ~ 7㎡. I was upset at the moment, but I put up with it. Don't lose your composure and vow to see the historical truth.

Don't turn around. Don't forget to not forget even in the midst of your busy life. Face the pain of your current grandmother. The grandmothers in the painting are handing over.

Photos and lists of domestic and foreign victims of comfort women
Huge archive of faces
With a deep tingling feeling, he heads to the museum face to meet more diverse faces. Should it be like a junk or a loft that gathered all kinds of miscellaneous secrets? This is the first impression of the museum's face in Namjong-myeon, Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do. This museum is the first time. The exhibits are not organized by age or have friendly explanations. Faces sway across the times and regions. There is a picture of actor Audrey Hepburn next to the shamanism and James Dean next to the Buddha. The museum's face exhibits more than 1,000 facial sculptures, from photographs, paintings and portraits to masks, puppet and stone statues. It's a huge archive of faces. It has been collected by senior theater director Kim Jong-ok for over 50 years.
Inside view of museum face
The center of the first floor is empty. It's like a theater stage. It is the architectural intention of the director who thinks that the works of the museum are actors on the stage and wants to make a festival ground with the old people. There are colorful masks on the left wall and pictures of theatricians on the right wall. Traditional masks have a slightly different look just by the eye. Eyes that are raised uphill are biting impressions, and eyes that are gentle like downhill are sullen. Stone Buddha has nothing but a peaceful face. Actor James Dean is keen on something.
Various face sculptures including masks, sculptures
Unlike the first floor, which is a mix of East and West works, the second floor is rich in oriental colors. The exhibition focuses on bonuses and marionettes, especially the various marionettes.
Kiln to carry dead body to grave at traditional funeral, bonus
The puppet was decorated with bonuses at traditional funerals. A friend of the road that sees the souls of the dead. There is no saddening puppet. He is dressed in colorful clothes and smiles. 'Let me forget all the hardships of my life and have a good memory.' I pray for the paradise birth of the deceased.
Cheerful expression of puppet to accompany dead man's journey
“Don't frown, everything will be washed away”
The highlight of the museum's face is the stone gardeners in the outdoor garden. A stone man is a stone in the form of a man who was built at the entrance of a tomb or village. Jangseung acted as the patron saint of the village, and the gates and copper seats in front of the tombs honor the dead.
Stonemason in the outdoor garden
There is no one person like Seok-in brought from each province such as Jinju-si, Gyeongnam-do, Jindo-gun, Jeonnam, and Jeju-do. Some have a serene look, while others have round eyes. It usually wears off over time and winds down, making it hard to see. What did the mason look like when he pricked stones and breathed freshly? Imagine a face hundreds of years ago. An open mouthed stoner speaks. “Don't frown like that. Don't be so happy. Then everything is washed away. ” It is comfort that only those who endure for hundreds of years can do. Those who have passed through these long and long years teach without change.
Tianjin Innocent Face
When you enter the face of the museum, you may be confused about what to look for. The viewing method is simple. Keep an eye out for the disordered objects, and then look at them when you see a catchy face. Soon silence will be broken. A museum with thousands of faces is full of quiet turmoil.
There are many faces in Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do. Look carefully. To hear beyond what he does not say. So we dare to understand others. If 'expansion of awareness' is called travel, Gwangju is a good destination.
Stoneman showing the passage of time

item.title: The museum is alive! Hanseong Baekje Museum - Songpa-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Pungnaptoseong Wall Section of Hanseong Baekje Museum Lobby

The museum is alive! Hanseong Baekje Museum

Songpa-gu, Seoul, Korea

It's been a while but it's still cold. However, as the morning dawns, spring is waiting for the end of winter. It is the season that shows the passage of time. As we move from winter to spring, we left to meet Baekje, which once took center part of the land. The main character is the Hanseong Baekje Museum, which bears the history of Baekje, which occupied the Han River.

The Hanseong Baekje Museum is a space where you can see 'Hanseong Baekje' at first glance. With the focus on Hanseong Baekje, it has embraced the ancient history of this land beyond the times of Woongjin Baekje and Xabi Baekje. Let's take a time trip to Baekje, along the foot of Mongchontoseong, a defense facility of Hanseong Baekje.

How did the Baekje live?
Hanseong Baekje Museum is free. Feel free to travel to ancient Baekje. The museum is open from 9:00 am to 9:00 pm on weekdays and from 6 pm (November to February) and 7:00 pm (March to October) on weekends and holidays. Closed day is every Monday. The parking fee is 2,000 won for up to 2 hours, after which it is added to 150 won every 5 minutes. Card payment is possible. It is also easily accessible by public transport. You can find it at Exit 1 of Mongchontoseong Station (Line 8) or Exit 3 of Olympic Park Station (Line 5).
Hanseong Baekje Museum Lobby
Baek jae. The first country of the Three Kingdoms occupied the Han River. Let's start with the name. 'Baekje' comes from 'People have crossed the sea' or 'Baekjehae' or 'People have enjoyed'. This is easier to understand when following the founding myth of Baekje.
'Prehistoric Seoul' held by Exhibition Hall 1
King Onjo of Baekje is from Goguryeo. His mother is Sosono, who is married to Jumong who founded Goguryeo. Onjo's new father, Jumong, was established by marrying Sossano, the daughter of a powerful patriarch. Jumong cared for Sosono's son Onjo and his brother Liu, but he passed down the throne to his son Yuri from Buyeo. Onjo and Biryu leave their hometown with Sosono, where Biryu is located in Michu Hall, Incheon, and Onjo is located in Saori, which belongs to Mahan Land.
Onjo, the Liu brothers and their mother Sosono
Baekje, which started in the small country of Mahan, developed and developed in exchange with Japan and China based on the fertile land around the Han River. Baekje's first capital is Wiryongseong, south of the Han. It is the old name of Hansung. Hanseong means Bukseong (Pungnaptoseong), which had palaces, and Mongchontoseong, which had a palace. It is so solid that it has survived for more than a few decades.
Pungnaptoseong built by the stem of the Han River
The northern province of Hansung, Pungnaptoseong, is an ancient castle built on flat soil. It is also quite large. The Han River flows north and west of Pungnaptoseong. Climbing to this stream, Baekje would have developed civilization by interacting with various countries. It is estimated to be 43m wide and 11m high. Some remain (except 2.2 km) except for the collapsed western wall. When you enter the Hanseong Baekje Museum, the first person you encounter is the soil layer made by removing the cross section of Pungnaptoseong.
Soil layer which removed actual pruned soil section
It was restored to the Pungnaptoseong castle, which was unearthed in 2011. At first glance it's huge. Hanseong Baekje Museum commentator said, "Though tens of centuries have passed, it means that it has been built up so firmly." "They built it and buried it together." Looking at the cross section of Pungnaptoseong castle wall in the museum, the situation is drawn by itself.
Exhibition Hall 2 introducing Hanseong Baekje era
Korean Peninsula Ancient History of the Museum

Passing through the lobby where the Pungnapseong cross section is located, you will naturally see the prologue and head for the exhibition room. In Seoul, Seoul, which was known only as the capital of Hanyang and 500 years of Joseon, recognized the capital of Baekje a long time ago. Kings, royalty, nobles, and people lived and died in Pungnapto (North) and Mongchonto (Male) and were buried in Seokchon-dong burial mounds.

Exhibition Hall 1 introduces the prehistoric era of Seoul. Stone Age
In Exhibition Hall 1, you can meet 'Prehistoric Seoul'. From the Paleolithic period to the Neolithic and Bronze periods, Mahan, Jinhan, and Hanhan's alliance are shown. The history of Baekje Empire, which started as one of Mahan's 50 countries, begins here. Baekje, which occupies the Han River, integrates Mahan by rapidly accepting and developing China's iron culture.
We show life of Neolithic clearly
If you move to the second exhibition room, you will begin to explore the royal road Hanseong. A kind explanation of the history of Baekje is known. Baekje, which was founded in Seoul in 18 B.C.E. and survived until 660 C.E., started out as the first capital Hanseong (Seoul) and reigned in Woongjin (Princess) and Xabi (Buyeo). Among them, Hanseong era accounts for more than 70% of the 600-year history of Baekje. During this period, Baekje enjoyed its heyday, expanding its territory from the present Hwanghaehae Island to Jeolla-do and Jeju-do.
Representative of Baekje. Seven map
After the heyday of Baekje, the third exhibition room, “Actualism of the Three Kingdoms,” will emerge. Baekje's first royal Hanseong was captured by the attack of Goguryeo Jangsu King in 475. For more than 70 years, the owner of the Han River was Goguryeo. In 551, Baekje reunited with the Silla to find the Han River basin again, but for a while. Silla, who became the new owner of the Han River two years later, has occupied the area for over 300 years. Baekje moved to Woongjin after the fall of Hanseong. Although the Han River was lost, Woongjin and Sabigi Baekje bloom unique cultures and influence Japanese ancient culture. A variety of attractions await you along with the ship model that was in charge of the trade of the Baekje era.
Baekje Geumdong Hyang-ro excavated from Buyeo Neungsan-ri
After the Three Kingdoms era, Epilogue ‘Seoul, to the world! To the future! ”Begins. Seoul, the capital of the Korean peninsula for 2,000 years ago, is the main character. Seoul, which was the capital of Baekje and a key point during the Goguryeo and Silla eras, served as the second capital to supplement the geographical weakness of the opening of the capital of Goryeo. Since then, it was chosen as the new capital of Joseon in 1394 and has been serving as the capital of the Republic of Korea.
Stone Beast excavated from Royal Mausoleum
The Hanseong Baekje Museum shows the ancient history of Seoul, focusing on the Hanseong era of Baekje, the first capital city of Seoul on the Korean Peninsula. Along with the history of Baekje, ancient history of the Korean peninsula can be seen as a vividly embodied material, which is perfect for studying history. Do not know history, difficult to answer children's questions? Do not worry The rich and diverse materials of the Hanseong Baekje Museum will solve all the children's curiosities. Oh, if you are still burdened, you may want to take advantage of the six-day commentary. Why don't you take a trip to a living museum and join a child in spring break?
Geumdong Gwanmo excavated from Gongju Suchon-ri Tombs
Travel info

Hanseong Baekje Museum
-Address: 71, Wiryeseong-daero, Songpa-gu, Seoul (In Olympic Park)
Inquiries: 02-2152-5800
-Free admission, 2000 won (up to 2 hours, 150 won every 5 minutes thereafter)
-Closed: Every Monday, January 1, closed by the market / closed, but not closed if Monday is a public holiday

http://baekjemuseum.seoul.go.kr/

Nearby attractions

item.title: There is a sea in Daegu! Alive Aquarium Daegu - Dong-gu, Daegu, South Korea
item.description:
Alive Aquarium Daegu's main tank

There is a sea in Daegu! Alive Aquarium Daegu

Dong-gu, Daegu, South Korea

A hot place like an oasis has appeared in Daegu surrounded by mountains such as Palgongsan and Bisleul Mountain. The main character is 'Alive Aquarium Daegu', which was ambitiously presented at Shinsegae Department Store Daegu. It's a sea in the inland city. Alive Aquarium Daegu, as its name suggests, contains lifelike sea life every tank. Visitors are immersed in the mysterious sights of the ocean.
Underwater trip from the top of the department store
Alive Aquarium Daegu (hereafter Alive Aquarium) can be found on the 9th floor, the top floor of Shinsegae Department Store Daegu Main Building. It is an aquarium set in the highest position in Korea. The sea creatures on display are about 200 species, including manatees, California sea lions and zebra sharks. Viewing routes consisted of a one-way that allows you to look around all the exhibition spaces from the entrance to the exit in one direction. It is about 800m long and takes about 95 minutes.
Fantastic view of the jellyfish aquarium
The first thing you'll encounter past the entrance to the Alive Aquarium is the jellyfish aquarium, which embellishes the interior with a fluorescent sky. The moment you see it, it is a sight that makes you resilient. As the jellyfish floats across the cylindrical aquarium, spreading its caps, a small full moon, like its name (full moon jellyfish), floats. Elegant movements that cannot be imitated by any living creature add to the ever-changing lighting, giving you a slightly dreamy atmosphere. The jellyfish aquarium is mirrored on four sides, creating a magnificent view.
Jellyfish wide open
When you leave the jellyfish aquarium, three long rectangular tanks occupy space. The garden is a scary garden where the tail is buried in the sand, the Bangga Cardinal with its cute looks and slender fins, the unicorn with its horns on its head, and the parakeet that resembles a parrot's beak. Can be.
Sea ecosystems in long tanks
Garden-il attracts the attention of visitors because of its rather silly appearance. The elongated body that oozes out over the sand is like a blade of grass swaying in the wind.
Garden work with a tail buried in the sand and swimming Bengalika Cardinal
Cafés and kids zones greet visitors as they pass by the fish tank and photo tank where you can take commemorative photos. Kids Zone has a touch pool where children can touch eel and octopus, and a facility where children can play with various toys. There is a sketch aquarium on one wall. After coloring the paper on which the sea creatures are drawn, scan the finished picture on the device and the animal appears on the screen to swim. While energetic kids are engrossed in playing, adults can enjoy a bit of tea at a cafe.
Kids Zone for Children
There is also a small zoo inside the Alive Aquarium. You'll find a cute hare, land turtle Sulgata, a crazy meerkat and a raccoon that rides through trees. Rabbits and turtles can be touched directly by the zookeeper. Children squirm behind the rabbits, imitating rabbits, and stroking their mothers and zookeepers and petting them.
Children petting a rabbit
The Seaso Manatee is the mascot of the Alive Aquarium. I am proud of a cute appearance not to match the size and get a lot of popularity. There are only a thousand rare species left in the world, so it is worth noting.
Manatee Enjoying Swimming <Photo courtesy of Alive Aquarium>
The Manatee Aquarium reproduces the depth of Manatee's main habitat, a lagoon (a shallow lake separated from the sea by sedimentary obstacles such as sand). Manatee eats 20 kg of vegetables per day, including bok choy, cabbage, cabbage, and jerk. It's interesting to see how people use their hands to eat vegetables as if they were people. Excessive amounts of waste are excreted frequently, which feed on omnivorous fish in the same aquarium.
State of Manatee Aquarium
If you keep moving along the viewing route, you will have a spacious space. You can meet the treehouse where you can feed animals such as parrots and interact with them. The screen also allows you to observe the features of parrots and otters in detail.
Mother with Child Looking at California Sea Lion
After watching the magic show and walking, the 360-degree sardine aquarium on the ceiling reveals itself. You can enjoy the lively group of sardines. The ecstasy of the sardines' movement in groups. A little exaggeration is the feeling of seeing the Milky Way swirling in the night sky. The dark interior, herds of sardines revealing a silver belly, and the aquarium design reminiscent of human eyes create an artistic harmony. Seats are reserved for convenience.
Herd of Sardine Swarm
From the sardine aquarium, you can meet the clownfish, famous for Nemo, while passing through a tunnel reminiscent of a tunnel. Then, after leaving the corner, the main tank, the sea of Daegu, will appear. It has a small sea with zebra sharks, large stingrays and sea turtles.
An aquarium was placed in the passage reminiscent of the tunnel.
It's amazing and fun just to look at it, but the specialty of the main tank is complete with a variety of programs. The Blue Mermaid is a beautiful feast of three mermaids among sea creatures. Every time the mermaid waved and smiles at the younger crowd, cheers burst out. 'Alive Girls' is a delightful underwater ballet performance, and 'Igley and Friends' is a program where the aquaticist closes the sea creatures with a camera in the tank.
A Blue Mermaid performance <Photo courtesy of Alive Aquarium>
The Shark Bridge is installed near the main tank. Literally, it's a bridge where you can walk on sharks. After the Shark Bridge experience, the tour ends with a giant grouper called `` Siktam Hemp King ''. The Giant Grouper was originally from the main tank and was thrown out of his current tank because he was eating a shark.
Visitors walking the Shark Bridge
Move space from the sea to the jungle, 'Juraji', a rooftop theme park
After watching the Alive Aquarium, go out through the aisle and you will see the rooftop theme park 'Juraji' with the concept of a jungle. The underwater journey ends and the jungle exploration begins. You are moving from space to a completely different environment.
Panoramic view of the rooftop theme park `` Juraji ''
In the Juraji, various sculptures that fit the concept were placed. The elephant 'Choji' lies down in front of the fountain, and the three ladybug trains carry the children and run between the legs of the giant spider 'Buibui'. The wood crocodile Gumu is willing to slide his head out for the kids. On one side, bamboo baobabs stand majestic. In the meantime, various wild animals such as giraffe and rhinoceros hang out. Visitors can walk through a wooden deck that extends into the air, overlooking an African-like landscape.
There is a wooden deck among the baobabs.
At the end of the roof, you can step on a fluffy mound and have a view of downtown Daegu and Palgong Mountain. It is popular as a date place for lovers to see the night view at night. Dongdaegu Station, shown to the right, is the main stage of the movie <To Busan>. It is a scene where a train running toward Busan stops in the ruins of Dongdaegu, and people who are not infected with zombies, such as sharing, struggle with zombies that have increased exponentially.
Giraffe Sculpture
Concentric Filled Aquarium, Alive Aquarium
Throughout the Alive Aquarium, the children's laughter and groaning continued. Responding violently to every mysterious gesture of the sea creatures, he revealed the pleasures of raw foods. The feelings of the child were conveyed to the adults, and the adults looked into the aquarium with pure eyes as if returning to their childhood for a while. The aquarium of Alive Aquarium was filled with generational concentricity.
Travel info

Alive Aquarium Daegu
-Address: 9th floor, Shinsegae Department Store Daegu, 149 Dongbu-ro, Dong-gu, Daegu Metropolitan City
Contact: 053-247-8899

http://www.aliveaqua.com/


Restaurants near
P.F Chang's: Mongolian Beef / Shinsegae Department Store Daegu 8F, Luang Street / 053-661-6873

http://www.pfchangs.co.kr/

-Gangsan Myeonok: Pyeongyang Naengmyeon / Shinsegae Department Store Daegu Branch 8F, Luang Street / 053-661-6862
-Tong House Night: Tempura Tung House / 12, Ayang-ro 7-gil, Dong-gu, Daegu, Korea


Rooms
Daegu Grand Hotel: 305, Dongdaegu-ro, Suseong-gu / 053-742-0001

http://www.daegugrand.co.kr/grand/main/index.php

-Benikea Hotel Suseong: 106-7, Yonghak-ro, Suseong-gu / 1899-1001
http://www.hotelsusung.co.kr

item.title: Autumn trip to Cheongju, from 'silk' meat street market to 'Unbo's house' and 'romantic' Cheongnamdae - Cheongju, Chungbuk, South Korea
item.description:
The main entrance to the stylish meat market

Autumn trip to Cheongju, from 'silk' meat street market to 'Unbo's house' and 'romantic' Cheongnamdae

Cheongju, Chungbuk, South Korea

Cheongju's autumn is more vibrant than ever. For the 2016 Fall Travel Week (October 24-November 6), various side events are being held in conjunction with the Korea Sale Festa at the General Street Market and major tourist attractions. If you set the schedule well, you can get cash gift vouchers. Cheongnam University Chrysanthemum Festival is in progress at this time. That's why we should leave for Cheongju right now.
The best meat market in Cheongju market
The six-way street market is a permanent market located in Sang-gu, Cheongju-si, which is the largest of the dozen Cheongju markets. In the past, the place was opened because of the name of the street, but now it is reduced to a range. Nevertheless, the front of the market gate with its huge tile roof is crowded like a street. Many people want to buy cheap goods. Don't panic if the front door is crowded. There are three public parking lots inside the market, so you only have to choose where to go.
The first thing you'll notice is the miniature trotters sold by the front door. Not long ago, it was introduced in TV shows and became popular. Unlike ordinary pork feet that have a lot of lumps, you can feel the chewing taste properly. A small alley behind the mini jogbal restaurant is the food alley at the meat street market. Tteok, Jeon, porridge, dumplings, and whole chicken are the main menus, and rumors of Sundae's popularity are overwhelming. Seemingly not so different from ordinary sundae, the taste becomes more curious.
Weekday afternoon, inside the market where guests are missing
Meat Street Market and Seongan-gil Shopping Street have opened the cooking process of Jjajangmyeon, fish gas and rice cake since last September, and share food with them. Bonus scales ', '80% sale event' that sells up to 80% of seafood, agricultural products, and livestock products by date, 'Merchant experience' to make cotton candy, and 'Movie Day' to watch movies and animations in multi support center. The event has been going on.
Various foods sold at the food alley
Currently most of the events have ended, but some will last until this weekend (October 30). A concert featuring Hong Jin-young and Hwang In-sun will be held at the 2nd parking lot from 2 pm on the 27th, and the family cultural heritage tour will begin at 1 pm and 4 pm on the 29th and 30th. 'Travel of Family Culture Ruins' is accompanied by a professional cultural commentator and tours Cheongju-eupseong, Jungang Park and Namseok Bridge.
Various foods sold at the food alley
The most popular money bag will be held on both the 29th and 30th of the last day. If you purchase more than 20,000 won at two stores and submit the receipt to the event headquarters on that day, you will receive a certain amount of Onnuri gift certificate (5,000 won) depending on the amount used.
Various foods sold at the food alley
If you've played well, worry about parking. Luckily, you can enjoy up to 30 days of free parking for up to 30 days if you show your receipts at three public markets in Seongan-gil and Seongan-gil shopping streets.
Various foods sold at the food alley
Find hidden pictures in a fun way ~, Suamgol Mural Village
Suamgol, which is not far from the meat market, has the nickname 'Cheongju's last moon.' Several houses barely stood on the mountain slopes, and even the refugees settled here after the Korean War. The village, which was almost a gimmick, faced a completely different fate since 2008, when various murals were created as part of a public art project.
Suamgol Mural Village Scenery
The stories in the murals are the lives of the elderly, as the artists completed their works by directly communicating with the local people. This is why pine trees and cranes that pray for disease-free life appear, as well as laundry scenes and briquette rear cars.
Briquettes buried in the ground
The unusual thing is that the mural doesn't just stay on the wall. The briquettes that played their part completely face each other. They have speech bubbles such as 'I love you when they are broken and broken!', 'I love you just as you are' and 'Okay, spring is coming soon'.
There is a lot of briquette art in Suamgol
There are also some pictures of amateur feeling. On the tiles that decorate the walls of someone's house, each person's face is drawn with a comment, "anything coming back", "anything ♡".
There is a lot of briquette art in Suamgol
Anyone can decorate their personality by participating in the shared wall painting experience held on October 30 and November 6 during the autumn travel week.
A diary on a wall
Another name of Suamgol is 'Kim Tak-gu Village'. This is the actual location for the national drama `` Kim Tak-gu, '' which has the highest viewing rate of 49.3%.
Palbong Bakery, a symbol of Suamgol
Palbong bakery sells a variety of cafe menus, including the ones in the drama.
A loaf of bread
After watching the drama script, the sign and poster of the cast on the first floor, enjoy the drinks and bread on the second floor.
'Baking King Kim Tak-gu' Script
Unbo Kim Ki-chang
In Hungdong-ri, Naesu-eup, Cheongwon-gu, Cheongju, there is Unbo Kim's house, the sister and artist of Kim Ki-chang. In 1976, after his wife and painter Park Rae-hyang passed away, Kim Ki-chang built his home in his mother's hometown and spent the rest of his life working there. Due to the rainy weather, the clouds and misty landscapes of the mountains were quite strangely matched with his hounbo. Engraved on the pillar of the entrance, 'I did not think it was unfortunate that I could not hear. . (Omitted) I think it was fortunate that I was able to concentrate on my art in quiet… Rainwater flowed vigorously over the writing.
View of Unbo's house
There was no one in Unbo's house except the caretaker. Thanks to this, the space of 50,000 pyeong ranging from Anchae, Art Museum, Sculpture Park, Bonsai Park, and Senior Park seemed to be my home. It was huge but it was cozy because everything was in place. A lot of small courtyard roses bloomed in Sarangchae, and the bonsai and the chiefs who expressed his taste around the well-organized inner house revealed their presence here and there. The texture of the old hanok was elegant and elegant. Sitting on Daecheong floor and watching the rainy garden was so precious that I didn't want to change anything. Artistic souls of artists who painted masterpieces such as Fool's Water, King Sejong's portrait of 10,000 won bills, Blue Green Water, and Gunmado were everywhere.
Sitting at Daecheong and looking at the rain landscape
After seeing the museum, the rain stopped and the sun started to glow. The cost of painting is as beautiful as painting wherever you can see it. Delicates that will never get tired even after dozens of times have attracted people. In particular, elephants, lady statues, Baekkyung, and meditation stones are among the nation's top ten gemstones.
I preserved Unbo's studio
Cheongnam University Chrysanthemum Festival
I can't come back to Cheongju without seeing Cheongnamdae. It is already famous for the presidential villas, but at the time of the chrysanthemum festival, you will be able to enjoy the visually near perfection. This year's chrysanthemum festival begins on October 22 and runs until November 13.
Cheongnam University Entrance with Falling Leaves
At this time of year, Cheongnamdae is filled with colorful leaves and the waves of Daecheong Lake.
Chrysanthemum Festival full of flowers
If you follow the direction of viewing with the smell of soil, grass, and water at the same time, you will naturally enter the chrysanthemum festival. You pick up the camera.
Beautiful chrysanthemum
On one side of the courtyard, there is an experience booth that supports tasting chrysanthemum tea, calligraphy of fallen leaves, and bonsai powdering.
Beautiful chrysanthemum
If time permits, I recommend you pick one of the six trails named after the president. It takes as long as 1 hour and 30 minutes and as little as 20 minutes, but each has their own unique features.
The fish farm in front of the Presidential Memorial was used as a skating rink.
It's important to note that you can't use your car to look around. Private cars cannot be driven without prior approval. Since 500 cars are booked a day, people who want to use their car must park before paying a fee.
Daecheongho from the front of Ohgakjeong
You can also take a city bus from the bottom of the mountain.
Metasequoia Road in Cheongnam University

item.title: Gochang Book Village Harry - Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea
item.description:
Wolbong Village Book Village Harry Bridge

Gochang Book Village Harry

Gochang-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

The school where the children left was lonely for a long time. In the ten years since the school has been awakened, a dense “book forest” has entered and people have come back. In this school, reopened as a book village, numerous stories of “writing together” are written on paper. It's our ordinary but precious story.
Reborn school
Gochang Wolbong Village where you can hear the sound of waves in the distance and see the detailed movement of stars. In 1933, an elementary school entered this small town. A small building was built and children's friendly fauna were found throughout the campus. Many students grew up dreaming in this small course. But in time, Naseong Elementary School closed in 2001.
Transformed from a closed school to a book village
Lee Dae-gun, the village chief of the book town Harry, who had been a publisher in Seoul, thought he had to wake up the sleepy school he had set up. In 2006, he started to build a ruined school with the dream of building a book village. In 2012, he settled with his family.
Autumn mood complete campus
“There are many book towns in Europe. It's a place of tradition with old books. Book Village Harry wants to be a place where you can combine your thoughts, life and stories into one volume. It's a town where you become an author, a real publisher, and a dream come true in a book. ”
Autumn mood complete campus
The squeaky corridor was rebuilt, the classroom neatly refurbished, and the pictures were painted on the walls. Then I put in a book
The dog, Harry's family, “Harry.”
Book Village Harry was born, and Wolbong Village, where more than 20 households lived, rose to life.
Old building
I don't know much about it, but my grandfather, a farming doctor, and my grandmother, a child-raising player, have released their stories, and it remains a precious record.
Onnuri books warehouse with lots of books
Book and noni space
Book village has also entered full autumn. Ivy vines covered with red bricks add to the flavor of the season. Book Village Harry has 120,000 books. Books donated by stations, publishers, libraries, and individuals.
Book Village Harry's Main Space, Book Forest Time Forest
The book forest of book forest time, where books are stacked from the ceiling to the floor, is a heavy time. There is a strange cross between the wooden rafter that is exposed and the books that have been piled up together. Next to the book forest is the Hanji Studio where you can make paper.
Book Village Harry's Main Space, Book Forest Time Forest
When you enter a small house made of paper in the middle of the studio, the soft air is wrapped. There are a few young trees growing beyond the studio windows. There is also a typography in the next classroom. It looks old, but it still works.
Giant letterpress
The “Bulled Snow Library”, which consists of two classrooms, is full of tens of thousands of picture books and children's and youth books. Interesting things happen in the Nuri Book Studio, where people plan books, write, and draw.
Friendly wooden corridor
It is a space full of children drawing their hips on the floor and drawing with their children's passion to learn more.
Dorando is a book-sharing space, willow library
Head to the place where you can hear the roar of chickens.
Library with old blackboards intact
On a full moon Friday, a small festival is held here. The Owls and Small Full Moon Festival is a time to share a fun book story late at night by setting a topic every month. You can spend a romantic time playing music with a recital.
The open air stage where winds blow directly from the West Sea
Book Village Harry's unique space is by far the book book prison. It is a welcome place for those who cannot read a book properly due to lack of time or lack of concentration. When you enter here, you have to read books, but there are a growing number of volunteers!
Oddly, book jails are growing
Book Village Harry has 'flowering minbak' and 'byeolheun minbak', so it's good to stay overnight.
Oddly, book jails are growing
Create a book impregnated with thoughts
Book Village Harry doesn't just read books, he works hard to make things. Participation in the publication camp program makes it easy for anyone to create a book. Well-preserved tidal-flats and wetlands around the book village, dolmens listed on the World Heritage Site
In addition to the travel record, you can also write a book with family events to celebrate, and interview your parents.
Children who make books with the five-stable stabilization method
“When I write an introduction, I ask you to write something like a tombstone that looks back on your life. If you think about what kind of title, what kind of company you're going to go to, you have a specific dream. ”
Yoon Dong-Ho, Experience Team Manager
All the experiences related to books, such as planning, writing, editing, and binding in the traditional way, are packed with people. It is a family of seven book villages, including editor Lee Dae-gun and director Lee Young-nam, including Lee Yuk-nam's painter, Yoon Dong-ho and Kim Min-kyung.
Kim Jong-ja's smile makes her first book
Everything around me and me can be made into books. As we make books, we unleash a lot of thought. In other words, he is meaningful enough to be a book and a library.
President Lee Dae Gun and Lee Young Nam, who established the book town Harry

“I want to be able to write together beyond reading together in the book town Harry. The book slogan, “Everyone's Books, Everyone's Library,” means that everyone can relate to personal thoughts. It's difficult to write alone, so it's 'together', so it's not difficult. ”

President Lee Dae-gun is special in capturing the stories of ordinary people and carrying out the history of books that have been around for a long time.

Book Village Harry Family

item.title: Muju, where have you been? - Muju-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea
item.description:
Muju Bandiland

Muju, where have you been?

Muju-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

In winter, mountaineers who want to enjoy snowy country from skiers become paralyzed. However, Muju is a good trip even for those who do not have eye contact. This is because there are various places to see and eat that were not thought. I am meeting the charm of Muju hidden for you who are curious about the unique appearance of Muju outside of Deogyusan.
Here instead of Fabre insects, Bandiland
Fireflies light up tail lights only in clean areas. Muju is the place that has the most signals to indicate that it is clear water, clean air, and unpolluted land. Why is it that Bandiland is located in Muju?
Bondiland is a place where you can see various insects in your eyes. This is a customized, hands-on learning space for children. In addition to the largest insect museum in Korea, where you can meet rare insects in a large space of more than 120,000㎡, there are various facilities such as youth camping ground, natural recreation forest facility, firefly natural school, and astronomical science museum.
Muju Bandiland
The main experience center here is the Insect Museum. From the entrance, various insect models approach the children's curiosity and awaken adult's conscience.
Insect world is also amazing for adults
At the entrance of the museum, a model of a firefly, representing Muju, keeps its center cool. The main entrance to the main exhibition hall, which is located in the basement, is mysterious, creating an atmosphere that enters the cave with typical fauna and flora fossils from the Paleozoic to the New Saengdae.
Firefly model perched at the entrance
As its name suggests, it is full of insects from Muju, the world's first insects in Korea. Even for those who are not friendly with insects, this is a curious paradise.
Children looking closely at the butterfly model
There are various exhibits from the birth of the earth through insects, the story of dinosaurs from the past, and the realistic and mysterious evolution of vertebrates. In addition, the 3D stereoscopic video room and the dome screen video room where you can lie down to watch the world of insects are fun.
Children focusing on their exhibits
Meet the soul of Taekwondo, Taekwondowon
Taekwondo, representing Korea. The sacred place of Taekwondo is right in Muju. Muju Taekwondowon, the only specialty Taekwondo space in Korea and abroad, is half the size of Yeouido. It is a dream place for the world's taekwondo people who have everything about taekwondo, including not only museums but also international games, experiences, training, education, and research.
Taekwondo Museum where you can learn about Taekwondo
Everything from the spirit of Taekwondo to the fields of technology and the history of the development of Taekwondo can be seen at the National Taekwondo Museum. From the military martial arts of ancient Korean nationalism to the folk martial arts of the Joseon Dynasty, and to the present, the history of Taekwondo is melted in a three-dimensional exhibition space. In addition, Yap! Is a hands-on experience hall where you can experience the T1 performance hall where you can see your skills and skills. There is a `` challenge for challenge '', so visitors can go one step closer to Taekwondo.
Robot Taekwon V visits Taekwondo Museum
If you have plenty of time, take a look around Taekwondowon. If you take the shuttle bus in front of the challenge field, you can see Taekwondowon with a friendly announcement.
Monorail to the observatory
For the taekwondo people's training, they arrive at the entrance of the observatory through the traditional garden, Hoyeonjeong, after a leap where the accommodation and fitness facilities are arranged.
Nicely made gazebo
You can use a monorail or hiking trail to the observation deck. The view of Taekwondowon, which is in harmony with the surrounding mountains, from the panoramic observation deck is also an attractive point.
From the observation deck on the third floor, you can enjoy the scenery of Muju.
Gourmet vanity only steamed! 'White Island Geumgang Freshwater'
There is a restaurant that you only want to know. “White Island Geumgang Freshwater” is such a place for old regulars. But a good restaurant is rumored someday no matter how hidden. There is a visitor who misses this place from Chungcheong area near to Seoul from far away. Also, after the visitor writer Heo Young-man visited the house, he became more famous as a restaurant restaurant.
Pagasari Spicy Bath
The menu that makes this place famous is eoju porridge and pagasari spice soup. Depending on which vegetables and seasonings are used, the main taste is different, so it is not the right answer. However, every year, the deep taste of the three-time beats, including the sincerity of drying the radish finely, the deep hand taste from the soaked intestine, and the fresh flesh of the fresh fish, are stimulated by the tip of the tongue.
Unusual sujebi in Maeuntang
Another secret that this house is famous for is the sincerity of the health of its guests. Make all the side dishes yourself and do not use any seasonings. Boil the broth with 3 years old camphor ginseng from Geumsan, Chungnam. In addition, the use of persimmon tree, also known as rumors and medicinal trees, as a broth material is good for bones.
Ginseng is made with every effort to make ginseng
Let's plan a Muju trip for a healthy body and mind on the last weekend of January. Exciting trips for children and exciting trips for adults.
Deep-fried freshwater prawns with taste and price

item.title: Fun and sweet winter museums in Jeju - Jeju, South Korea
item.description:
Chocolate Museum

Fun and sweet winter museums in Jeju

Jeju, South Korea

There are many fun museums in winter even on Jeju Island. Among them, the museum introduces an experience museum that can be used to educate children and also be enjoyed by adults.
Chocolate Museum
The Chocolate Museum is amazing from the outside. Once the facade of the museum looks like the architecture of the South American Inca civilization, the birthplace of cacao. Also, as soon as you enter, you are welcomed by the coffee and it is more fun. The Chocolate Museum is a fun place to look at all the chocolates in each region, including the history of chocolate. The museum features chocolate statues and famous cultural works. Is it because it melts because many people touch it with their hands? Of course you should look only with your eyes.
The pavilion starts with a poster for the chocolate factory of the movie Charlie, which will be interesting to children. Also explain how to make chocolate from cacao. There is also a space that reproduces the chocolate of the ancient Aztec civilization, which is intrigued by the model train coming and going around. One side of the museum explains the types and benefits of cacao. I only know that chocolate can help me regenerate, but I first learned that there are so many different types of cacao.

In the museum, there is a quiz game to convey knowledge of various chocolate cacao through not only exhibitions but also quizzes.
It is not just an enumeration, but an exhibition that induces the interest and participation of visitors through various attempts such as chocolate quiz, chocolate misunderstanding and truth.

The second floor displays chocolates and tea cups, mostly from medieval Europe. Chocolate is now popular, but in the past it was only used by the upper classes in Europe as a premium drink. The spaces that explain the colorful and diverse look-and-feel exhibitions and related stories also attracted many people.

Chocolate Museum Experience Center
On the first floor of the museum, there is a space that shows the scene of making chocolate. Unfortunately this is not a place for visitors. For the unfortunate audiences, there is a Junior Experience Hall on the first basement floor where you can make chocolates with your children.
Chocolate Museum Production Room
Teddy Bear Museum
Now let's go to the Teddy Bear Museum located in Jungmun, Jeju Island. Teddy Bear is a teddy bear that everyone knows. I've made and constructed a museum and I'm curious how to decorate it. First of all, it seems to be popular with children in terms of the theme of teddy bears.

Once inside the museum, it consists of various structures, such as a history hall decorated with teddy bear dolls, important events of modern history of humanity, and an art museum decorated with works of art in teddy bears, and exhibitions. Starting with the birth of the car, various events such as the moon landing of mankind and the return of Hong Kong to China are centered on teddy bear dolls. It is an educational museum for children and a cute and cute museum for adults.

The museum's interior art gallery draws Van Gogh's paintings as teddy bears and draws visitors with a variety of themes such as Teddy Bears decorated with Louis Vuitton. There is also a teddy bear souvenir shop in the basement. Parents who have been holding their children's hands can get out of here by buying teddy bear dolls.

Teddy Bear Museum Souvenir Shop

Lastly, there is a hidden teddy bear performance, Elvis Presley. The show is not long, but Elvis Presley dances and music in Teddy Bear and is worth seeing. The venue is located a little far from the main exhibition hall, but don't forget to stop by.

The Teddy Bear Museum has outdoor gardens and outdoor stages as well. These days it's midwinter, so I couldn't go outdoors, but if it's a nice day in summer, the outdoor garden with grass plaza and walking trails will be a good gift for nature with cool sea breeze.

Teddy Bear Museum
Haenyeo Museum
Now move to the Haenyeo Museum near Seongsanpo. Isn't it a haenyeo that can not be missed in Jeju Island? Haenyeo Museum is operated by Jeju Island and consists of three exhibition rooms with the theme of Jeju Island Haenyeo.
The dormitory of Haenyeo, the first exhibition room, shows the life of haenyeo in Jeju Island. A traditional house was recreated and the village of Jeju Island was modeled next to it. In addition, there are various exhibitions such as living utensils, food culture and customs.
Haenyeo Museum

The second exhibition room, Haenyeo's Workplace, is a showroom that maximizes the visual effect by decorating the dolls and showing them as images. You can also find out about the hierarchies of haenyeo and the daily life of haenyeo. There are also spaces that show the achievements of devoted women who have dedicated themselves to the nation, such as the Haenyeo Anti-Japanese Movement.

In the third exhibition room, Haenyeo's life, she can become the first woman in her life and see her various hierarchies. There are also interesting exhibits, such as a video where you can listen to live experiences of divers.

Haenyeo Museum

Lastly, there is the Children's Haenyeok, an experience hall for children. This is a place where only children and guardians can enter. Children can become more familiar with Haenyeo by playing with Jeju Haenyeo related rides.

Haenyeo Museum is proud of its outdoor park. The open-air large park is called Haenyeom Square, which also houses the Jeju Haenyeo Anti-Japanese Movement Memorial Monument.


Haenyeo Museum

item.title: Youngdong Shenzhen-ri Village, the hometown of the heart when we miss the countryside - Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk, South Korea
item.description:
Small station with impressive green roof, Shenzhen Station

Youngdong Shenzhen-ri Village, the hometown of the heart when we miss the countryside

Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk, South Korea

"I want to go back!" There are times when anyone wants to go somewhere, like the lines in a movie. At any point in the past, or anywhere in the past, there are times when you will be reminded of your memories. Especially when a big holiday is over. When the word family and home come to mind, busy hands are slowly turning upside down.
A simple station where memories live and the town scenery spread out like a black and white photo
But going back in time is not easy. As time goes by, the appearance of hometown is changing. In the meantime, there are some places that retain their former appearances as if they were passing away. If you want to go back to a moment in the past, take a slow train to Shenzhen station in Yeongdong, Chungbuk.
Shenzhen Station is a small convenience station. The station was opened as a regular station in 1905. The station has been newly built and moved to Gyeongbu Line double track construction in 1934. The history of the 1930s was preserved in the original form of the gable roof and was designated as Registered Cultural Property No. 297 in 2006. When you get off at the small station, you can see the green roof and the words 'the station where the old memories stay'. There are not many people getting on the train and getting off. The scent of dull feelings abounds in history and railroad tracks. The waiting room is small too.
"Once there were a lot of passengers and bustling times. The market was activated and many people gathered, but now it's a very quiet station." The station worker looks at the empty waiting room and explains the old look of Shenzhen Station.
Simple Shenzhen Station Waiting Room
Exiting the waiting room leads to the station square. The square is quite wide compared to the small train station. It is not only the station that Shenzhen has gone through.
Old drugstore centered on the station square
Right in front of the train station is an old pharmacy called Supergang Pharmacy, and at the entrance to the plaza there are two stores that have annual rings instead of common convenience stores. It's like a movie set set in the 1970s.
Old commercial center centered on the station square
The view inside the drugstore is also nice. Bacchus boxes are lined up. Even if there is no sore place, I want to make a ping pong and cross the threshold once.
A video store that brings memories
In front of 'Brother's Club' and 'Reverse Chamber of Commerce' there are beautiful trees. Underneath, a few of my grandmothers are chatting together. It is the scenery of a rural village that I remembered when I was young. Miraculous. Is time passing by here at a different speed?
Membrane Mill
There are shops and houses along the two-lane road along the Brotherhood. There is a cotton office, a restaurant, a pesticide shop and a mill. The neighborhood where Shenzhen Station is located is Shenzhen-li, Shenzhen-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk. It was hard to imagine the bustle of the past without the guidance of a station worker in Shenzhen, who once said that it was a busy and noisy neighborhood. The neighborhood was quiet.
An iron gate is also a medium for memories
"Oh, is this store closed today? You have to open the doors on Saturdays to help the farmers with their farming." This conversation is coming and going. The voices of the uncles on the road can be heard across the street. When someone passes by, they pretend to know and talk with each other.
An iron gate is also a medium for memories
Take a picture of a rusty fence in front of a farm machinery store. A faded video store signage is also pictured. Lack of scenery seems to be warming somewhere. "What do you use to write it?" The uncle who passes by throws a horse. I'm glanced at doing something really useless. Yeah. The scenes were common 20-20 years ago, but now it's amazing that I'm trying to capture every single camera.
The friendly scenery you encounter as you walk slowly through the town
Sometimes the bus, sometimes a car, and the words 'slowly' written on a quiet road are noticeable. Yes, sometimes it's good to go slowly in either side of the world.
The word 'slowly' written on the road sticks to my heart
Add beautiful sound to your memories trip, Yeongdong Gugak Village
It doesn't take long to get around the neighborhood around Shenzhen Station. If you want to spend more time here, take a bike hire from Shenzhen station. It is also known as 'blue bike'. Passengers traveling to Shenzhen on a train can travel for free. You can ride a bicycle along the nearby river or explore the nearby attractions.
If you visit Shenzhen by train, you can use the bicycle for free.
One course (8.1km) to Okgye Falls, two courses (9.4km) to Iwon Bridge, and three courses (5.8km) to Yeongdong Gugak Village.
Yeongdong Shenzhen-myeon, North Chungcheong Province is famous for the hometown of Nanji Park.
Now that we came to Shenzhen-myeon, Yeong-dong, Chungbuk, which is the hometown of the Nangye Park Yeon, one of the three malice in Korea, let's head to the Yeongdong Gugak Village. Yeongdong Gugak Village has Cheongogak along with facilities such as performance halls and experience rooms. The Cheongogak is the largest drum in the world, and is the space where the Cheongo is registered. The ceiling is 7 tons in weight, with a diameter of 5.54m, a diameter of 6.4m and a width of 5.96m.
Yeongdong Gugak Village, a free performance of Korean traditional music every Saturday
If you want to make full use of Yeongdong Gugak Village, visit on Saturday. This is because the permanent performance of Nanji Gugak Orchestra is held every Saturday. You can enjoy a variety of genres, from authentic Korean traditional music to fusion. During the performance, a description of Korean musical instruments may be given. There is also a space where you can touch the lyre, gayageum, and janggu at the entrance. After listening to the Korean traditional music performances, we will deal with musical instruments. The Korean traditional music, which felt difficult and far away, is approaching intimately.
You can play lyre, gayageum, and janggu yourself.
Near the Yeongdong Gugak Village, Nangye Gugak Museum, where materials about Korean traditional music and egg-based yeon are displayed, Nangye Family House, which is the place where Nangye Park Yeon was born. have. The journey started at Shenzhen Station, where 'old memories stay', leads to the Youngdong Gugak Village where 'old sounds stay' on a blue bicycle. Nostalgic sound is added to the nostalgic memories. Stimulates travel sensibility in autumn.
Let's visit Nangye Gugak Museum with Yeongdong Gugak Village
