item.title: Autumn leaves left by yellow leaves, Cheongna bank village - Boryeong, South Korea
item.description:
Ginkgo biloba shedding leaves already

Autumn leaves left by yellow leaves, Cheongna bank village

Boryeong, South Korea

Autumn begins in heaven and ends on earth. Looking at the clear sky without a cloud, we realize that autumn has come. Autumn is in full swing as you look at the colorful leaves colored in the air. And looking at the carpeted land where falling rain drops fall, we feel that autumn is about to leave. Choosing to enjoy autumn until the last moment when it runs from the air to the ground is Cheongna Bank Village in Boryeong-si, Chungnam.
The largest ginkgo colony in Korea
Enters Cheongna Bank Village, located at the foot of Oseo Mountain, Cheong Ramyeon, Boryeong-si. Even in early November, autumn is in full swing. Some ginkgo trees have begun to drop ginkgo biloba due to their temper, but there are still many ginkgo trees that are slowly green.
Ginkgo leaves seem to be a week slower than any other year because of heat and drought, the locals say. This year, you will be able to enjoy the yellow waves of Cheongna Bank Village until a little later.
Ginkgo tree still green
Cheongna Bank Village looks like the largest ginkgo grove in Korea. Ginkgo trees come in from the village entrance to the snow. It is not an exaggeration to say that over 3,000 ginkgo trees are growing in the village.
Cheongna Ginkgo Village
How did Ginkgo live here? The legend of the village is told. Since ancient times, Janghyeon Village (Cheongna Bank Village) has been called Oseosan because there are many crows. A yellow pit lived by a small pond under the mountain. The worm prayed for ease every day for a thousand years. On the day of the millennium, the goblin finally became Hwang Ryong and ascended with Yeouiju. Crows around Oseo-san watched this scene. Later, the crows looked for food, found a yellow bank, and thought that it was Yeoui-ju, which Hwang was biting. That is why Ginkgo trees are now inhabited in Janghyeon village.
Ginkgo trees can be found anywhere in town
Apart from the legend, there are also entities that reveal the origin of Cheongna Bank Village. It is a 500-year-old Sugo tree in front of the nerve house (Chungcheongnam-do Cultural Heritage No. 291). The ginkgo trees of Cheongna Bank Village are almost dark trees. After a round of town, the smell from the tip of the shoe proves this. The 500-year-old ginkgo biloba has played a role in bringing the fruit of many dark trees in the Cheongna ginkgo village.
Walking through the village, you can see the drying up of the banks.
Ginkgo trees that are aesthetically cultivated in the city have many trees that do not bear fruit, but in rural areas, they grow many trees that bear fruit because their purpose is for living. At one time, the villagers called ginkgo trees as 'college trees'. When the bank quotes were good, a few trees helped me get my college tuition.
You can buy banks in town in the fall.
Although the value of the bank is not so great now, it is still a good source of income for the residents of Cheongna Bank Village. It is known that the amount of banks held in Cheongna Bank Village alone is over 100 tons. The nickname of 'Bank town with a bank' is not just funny.
You can buy banks in town in the fall.
A round of bank town of 'Trial History'
You don't have to worry about where to look around the Cheongna Bank Village. It's enough to walk along the road around town.
Bank village round road sign
Ginkgo trees stand along the fields, along the streams and along the earthen houses. There is no artificial feeling. It's as natural as it is. That is because the Cheongna Bank Village is not a place for planting and decorating Ginkgo trees to show people. As the villagers planted and grown a lot of ginkgo trees, they became known for the autumn leaves and tourists began to visit.
Closed Janghyeon Elementary School transformed into a green farming experience
Because it is not an artificially created tourist spot, there is no large parking lot. The park is set up at the old Janghyeon Elementary School or Jeongchon Organic Farm, which is used as a green farming experience center in the bank village. Rural scenery of the village and the ginkgo trees scattered here and there complete the scenery in autumn.
House of old houses and old trees are the best place to live
The points of the bank villages are Sinseop House and Jeongchon Organic Farm. Among them, Sinseop house is the best rice in the bank village. The house is a hanok, the late Joseon Dynasty. Around the old house are ginkgo trees over 100 years old. Dignity can be felt in the landscape of old-fashioned houses and trees. At first glance, it's too bad to see it. It is fun to look thirsty outside. When thirsty for the intact landscape is at its peak, spraying the yard takes its foot. It's as if you're walking into a single elegant painting. The scenery of thirsty staring outside the fence and the view from the courtyard are attractive.
House of old houses and old trees are the best place to live
Jeongchon Organic Farm provides another flavor. The center is equipped with a small ecological park, a hanok pension and a rural healing cafe.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard Surrounded by Beautiful Ginkgo Trees
The yard, surrounded by beautiful ginkgo trees, is perfect to feel the fall. Ginkgo leaves full of trees flutter in the wind and fall one by one.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard provides a comfortable resting place in autumn
During the autumn, when the ginkgo trees are yellow, there is a snack market at the café and a small produce market in the yard.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard is full of cute autumn items
Banks, sweet potatoes, and chestnuts harvested from Jeongchon Organic Farm are often delicious jeonjuburi in autumn.
Jeongchon Organic Farm Yard is full of cute autumn items
The annual Cheongna Bank Village Festival is held from late October to early November. During the festival, there are various experience programs centered on the former Janghyeon Elementary School. This year's festival took place on October 29 and 30. The festival is over, but don't be afraid. The peak of autumn leaves has not passed since this year's bank leaves were late. Rather, the village's advice is that from the first weekend in November to the second week of the week, you can savor the yellow waves of the Cheongna bank village. It would be great to visit Cheongna Bank Village during the best time to see autumn leaves, but it may be a little early or a little late. The lush peaks of the beautiful ginkgo trees are beautiful, but the mysterious moment of the transition from fresh green to yellow is also fascinating.
A rustic country village becomes special with ginkgo in autumn
Travel info

Cheongna Bank Village
-Address: 150-65, Oseosan-gil, Cheong-myeon, Boryeong-si, Chungcheongnam-do
Contact: 070-7845-5060

http://www.은행마을.org/


Restaurants near

-Samdae Cold Noodle (Green Hall): Cold Noodle / Cheong Ram 6 Cold Wind Bathway Road / 041-932-8280
-Seokhwachon: Seokhwachon Settlement / 15, Gangseo-gil outside Jupo-myeon

http://www.석화촌가든.kr/

Rooms

-Jeongchon Organic Farm Hanok Pension: 150-32, Oseosan-gil, Cheong Ramyeon / 010-5452-8466

item.title: Daegu Metro Line 3, Sky Train Running Through the City - Jung-gu, Daegu, South Korea
item.description:
Daegu sky train running into the sunset

Daegu Metro Line 3, Sky Train Running Through the City

Jung-gu, Daegu, South Korea

Daegu Ground Railroad, which opened in April, is called a running observatory. A 10-metre high sky train runs over downtown Daegu and presents dynamic scenery. Passing between tall buildings, running across a wide river, flying over rooftops, you encounter Daegu with a different face. Sunsets and sunrises between buildings are also special. When you get off the sky train, you will see Daegu's attractions and food. Line 3 is the new starting point for the exciting Daegu trip.
Daegu's attraction in the sky
"Aze ~ This station is a achievement park." “Yeah, this station is Aigar Park Station where Saturn is located. If you are going to Dalseong Park or Daegu Native History Museum, you can get off at the right door. ”The Daegu Urban Railway Line 3, where the dialect announcement is heard, is catching the air. The first urban railway was opened in Daegu in 1997. Line 2 was completed in 2005, and line 3 began service on April 23, 10 years later. By May 31, there are 3 million visitors. An average of 76,500 people a day ride the train, which makes it more popular.
Run cool on the city without blockage
Daegu Metro Line 3 is a ground train called the Sky Rail, not a subway that runs through the basement. The sky train, with an average height of 11m, offers a panoramic view of the city.
Line 3 leaving Dalachi Park Station
When you cross the 200m wide Kumho River, you will feel like you are flying above the river. In Nam-gu, the mountains in front of the dense dwelling roofs face each other, and the Suseong Pond appears to the right as the Suseong Pond Station approaches. Behind the scenes, the sun breaks along the white waves and the train slides through the buildings. It is unexplored in Daegu.
Shincheon scenery from across Daebong Bridge
The view of Daegu through Line 3 after dark is also new. One or two lights are lit in each building, and the clothes are changed with colorful neon signs. Car lights passing under the trains flow like rivers, and the buildings standing on both sides along the Beomcheon stream catch the eye. It's also special to see the sun shining and reddening the building forest on the train.
The sunset seen from the train is more special
The sky train that runs from Daegu to north and south passes through 30 stations, ranging from Dongho-dong Chilgok Gyeongdae Hospital Station in Buk-gu to Beommul-dong Site in Suseong-gu. It takes 48 minutes to pass through the entire 24km section. It runs cool without waiting for a signal or being stuffy. It took 20 minutes or more to take more than 70 minutes when using a car. It runs from 5:30 am to 12:00 pm, every five minutes during morning and evening rush hours, and every other seven minutes. The rubber wheel of the vehicle is wrapped around the track beam to drive, so there is little noise and vibration, and the ride is comfortable, so you can feel comfortable in the scenery.
Passengers with a comfortable view of the city
Daegu Sky Train is Korea's first public transport monorail. In the world, there are not many examples of monorail in public transportation. It operates in 14 countries around the world, including Tokyo, Japan, Osaka, Chongqing, China and Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Among them, the Daegu sky train is the longest. We are proud of the best in technical part. As you pass through apartments and dense residential areas, a window-blocking device will protect your privacy. In the event of an emergency, Spiral Chute and a water spray-type automatic fire extinguishing system were installed to escape safely to the ground. It's an unattended operation, but worry can be put aside. One safety officer rides on each vehicle and monitors Chilgok vehicle base control system in real time through CCTV.
Korea's first public transport monorail
To transfer to another line, you can transfer to Line 1 at Myeongdeok Station and Line 2 at Sinnam Station.
Moving Observation Deck in Daegu City
Attractions in Daegu on Line 3
The station that people ride most is Seomun Market Station. The opening of Line 3 increased the number of visitors to the market by 40% on weekends. Exit the escalator at Exit 3 and you're at the market entrance. Previously, you had to walk 10 minutes from Sinnam Station on Line 2. Seomun Market, which was selected as the three largest market place in the Joseon Dynasty with Pyongyang and Ganggyeongjang, is the largest traditional market in Daegu. There are 4,700 stores in eight districts, including Dongsan Shopping Mall, except street vendors. There are so many things to see and do that you can't go around with half a day.
Attractions in Daegu on Line 3
In Seomun Market, you can't miss the food. In the Kalguksu Alley, where more than 50 noodle crises are gathered, people looking for hot kalguksu are hot even in hot weather.
Seomun Market Kalguksu Alley
Don't miss the barley rice. If you rub a lot of herbs in gochujang, you can literally taste honey. In addition, to eat flat dumplings, hotteok, tteokbokki, Sundae, etc., it takes several days to starve. The good news is that the night market will open in August. The night scenery of Seomun Market is already awaited.
Kalguksu and Barley Rice
After exploring the five senses at the Seomun Market, head toward the modern alley. Crossing Dalseong-ro from the market and walk about 400m to the side of Dongsan Hospital, Cheongna Hill is where the modern alley begins.
Flat dumplings belonging to 10 Daegu
If people are crowded at Seomun Market Station during the day, it is Suseongmot Station at night. Beomeocheon, which stretches straight up and down the Suseongmot Station, is a newly emerging photo zone. The dimly lit buildings and colorful buildings blend together to create a new look of Daegu night view. After watching the night view of Beomeocheon, you can walk about 5 minutes to Suseong Pond. Unlike the daytime scenery where you can enjoy the cool breeze of the lake and take a duck boat, the night view of Suseong Pond is gorgeous. A cool fountain show takes place to match the lighting and music. A variety of street performances take you around the promenade around the lake.
Night view of Suseong Pond with a music fountain show
When you get off at Dalseong Park Station, Dalseong Park is a place where you can meet old Saturn and mysterious animals, and you can walk to the Daegu Art Power Plant for free.
Dalung Park Gwanpungru
Get off at Daebong Station and walk for 10 minutes along Sincheon. In the alley full of murals reminiscent of singer Kim Gwang-seok, Kim Gwang-seok's song flows. The children's hall has the largest number of children. The lawn is a shelter for families, and an exhibition hall for various scientific experiences is a children's playground.
Citizens enjoying green walks along Saturn Park
Among the trains, the train with the theme of “Robocar Poly” is popular among children. Suseongmot Station, Dalseong Park Station, and Seomun Market Station give another fun to the broadcast by the friendly dialect.
Children cheering as Robocar Poli train comes in
Travel info

Daegu Metropolitan Rapid Transit Corporation / 250, Wolbae-ro, Dalseo-gu, Daegu, Korea / 053-643-2114

item.title: Buyeo County, Chungnam, South Korea - Where to ask for autumn leaves, the best season
item.description:
Bright martial arts grounds in autumn

Where to ask for autumn leaves, the best season

Buyeo County, Chungnam, South Korea

To catch the end of the fall, he buryed the dead warriors to bury the last season. Yun Dae-nyeong, who wrote the novel, called Muryangsa as “the jangji (season) where the seasons sink.” When the leaves run out, it will be reminiscent of the sadness of a year. However, the bitterness of autumn, which is more abundant than gold, is swallowed up at once. Can we ask about the season that passed from Buyeo Muryangsa where Kim Si-ryong, the wind luck and genius poet of Joseon, spent his last years? .
Coriander
This fall, which has been bitten, goes to Buyeo in a month because the leaves are falling early. Fortunately, martial arts haven't completely dropped the fall yet. There's still a lot of energy last summer. Passing through the ticket office is one order soon. On the forehead of one order, there is a large board called 'Mansusan Muralosa'. It is a harmonious combination of 'unquantity', meaning immeasurable, and the name of the mountain, 'Mansu,' which means enjoying a long life. Muryangsa Temple is a millennial temple that was founded during King Munseong King (Unification 839 ~ 857). However, like most temples and architectural cultural assets in Korea, all martial arts disappeared during the Imjin War, but were rebuilt in 1623 (Art. 1) to reach today.
One order
Passing through a small valley and reaching the Cheonwangmun gate, a handsome party holder welcomes visitors to the right. The party holding means an elongated pole that hung the flag of the temple, or a holding seat that supported the party from left to right. This is a sign that the grounds of the temple begin here.
Mugi Corp
Ascending to the Cheonwangmun Gate, the paradise of Muyongsa Temple, the Five-storied Pagoda, and beyond are in the square frame of Cheonwangmun. Too stable angle. Even if you don't specialize in photography, you can naturally lift the camera. But the designer who designed this stunning view did not expose 100% of the paradise, the heart of the temple. The paradise roof was slightly covered with pine and zelkova branches. I sat and stood trying to take a picture to avoid the branches. 1 minute left? Ah! Realize that it was a wonderful piece of coriander to cover the Buddha's dwelling place. Wouldn't that branch have been cool to see through the paradise? Rather, the tree branches add to the secret paradise of paradise.
Paradise view from the Cheonwangmun
Slowly approach to paradise. When you reach the pine tree that covered the roof, you can see the stone lanterns, the five-storied pagoda, and the paradise. The stone lanterns, five-storied pagoda, and paradise of Muryuksa are all national treasures. It may seem as if it is a cultural asset, but the history of the cultural assets filled with signs and the knowledge of art history do not seem to help this autumn. So I don't deliberately go in detail. The dust of knowledge in my head seems to sit on the surface of the sticky emotion. Just look at the three treasures at a distance. From a large perspective, the gaze that originated from the ground raises a sense of ascension through the stone lanterns and the top of the pagoda, leading to the paradise ridge. In addition, five hundred and one thousand years of history, without serious damage and damage, adds dignity.
State and seat of majestic paradise war
Watch the paradise round from left to right. The boats of the pillars supporting the eccentric structure of the paradise are extraordinarily bulging. It is a commonly called shedding column. The exterior looks like two floors, but the inside of the paradise is a layered structure with no layers. It can be seen that this structure is not for the actual use of the second floor, but for the formality and dignity of the building.
Tombstone Pillar
Turn around the paradise backyard and stand under the maple tree in front of the fence on the right side of the building. It's good luck to come to the last martial arts afternoon. The sun has started to head west of Mansusan, and the warm autumn afternoon sun plentifully covers the grounds. Under the maple tree, the backlight is covered with maple leaves and the shutter is released. It's not wrong to say 'take photos with your feet'. As soon as the monk passes by.
The grounds of martial arts temple from the right
Kim Si-sook, a poor genius writer or owner of a free soul
There is one person you must meet in Muryangsa Temple. Kim Si-seon (1435 ~ 1493) is a monthly leader who is always introduced with nicknames such as Pung Un Ah, genius author, and Shin Dong. Pass the paradise and cross the small stream to the left to see the portrait of Kim Si-seop in Yeongjeonggak. Kim Si-sook did not recognize the seizure of the throne and lived as a monk and wife forever. He left the world at age 21 and wandered all over the country.
Let's take a look at the portrait of Kim Jung-shik. Yeongjung differs from the intense primary color discord commonly found in verses. It is also different from the portrait of the Joseon Squadron who dressed nicely in Gwanbok. Kim Si-seop in Yeongjung's hands are kept neatly in the sleeve, but he is frowning with frowns. That is why many critics say that they have captured the features of dissatisfied intellectuals who are dissatisfied with the world. You can see that. At twenty-one years of age, when King Sejo came to the throne, he burned all the books he had read and left the world and became a monk. However, Kim's life is not filled with bad luck, hoarding and criticism of society.
He left the world and toured Kanto and Hunan, enjoying scenery and writing poems. In his thirties, he spent six years in Gyeongju Geumosan, the current Gyeongju Namsan, dedicated to his work. The result of the immersion is Kum-O Myth, which is regarded as Korea's first Chinese novel. Was Kim Si-sook a poor genius who met the times wrongly? Or was he the owner of a free soul? Eventually, he sees his wandering as an alienation from power and mainstream or a will of free life. I give a small hint to that not easy problem. Kim Si-seop writes the motive of wandering in the preface of `` Every Month House ''
Young Si Kim
"I … In order to wander through the mountains and find a good view, I would boast of my friends to enjoy the poem, but I didn't think of getting into office with a sentence. It is a shame that one day, after being overwhelmed (the usurpation of the throne) by a man, a man can be born in this world and walk on the road. "
A monk is sweeping leaves
The light way, the way to Taejoam
After exploring the grounds, head back one week for a deeper autumn walk.
1.2 km from Mouyangsa Temple to Taejoam
Before reaching the order, left to Taejoam and Dosolam to the left. A wide open area leads to a well-paved road to the left. The road lasts 1.2 km to Taejo Rock.
The driveway into Taejoam is a good way to walk.
Shortly after entering the street, there is an old martial arts site on your left.
Bench on the way to Taejoam
It is now covered with pampas grass, weeds, and shrubs, but excavations in 2000 confirmed the podium, headstone, and prestigious flag stamped with “Muyangsa”.
Old martial arts site
Going way again It immediately passes through Dosolam and reaches Taejoam. Only two toilets and benches are placed sparsely on the way to Taejoam. There are no magpies on this road, but only red persimmons are hung on persimmon trees that have run out of leaves. It's a sleek but simple way to take a quiet walk. Passing the garden to the right of Taejoam begins the full-scale hiking trail. If you plan to climb Mansu Mountain, you can climb along Taejoam Trail.
Mansusan Mountain Trail begins in Taejoam
Exit Taejoam and leave the temple completely. There is one more thing to see before going to the parking lot. To the visitor who wants to leave, Muryangsa presents Kim Si-sook's bankruptcy. The fact that there are a lot of Buddhism, the tombs where Buddhist monks are buried, means that they have produced a lot of monks.
Murangsa Temple Budo-gun
Muryangsa Budo-gun is on the way to Mujinam. Of all the defaults, Kim Si-sook's bankruptcy is the tallest. Both size and appearance are the most complete. The default of Kim Si-sook is a double base. The dragon pattern is vivid on the surface of the second podium's gown stone (medium stone), which is decorated with a lotus flower. It is very good for the stone relics of Chosun Electric.
Bankruptcy of Kim Si-sook
So is there really a Kim Si-suri saree here? During the Japanese colonial period, the typhoon swept away and the surrounding trees fell. At that time, the Budo was also collapsed, and the sari of Kim Si-sook was found. Kim's sari is currently on display at the National Buyeo Museum.
Dragon pattern of Kim Si-seop Budo middle stone

item.title: Seocheon-gun, Chungnam, Korea - From Hongseong to Seocheon, take the sea of Chungnam! Sea bathing and tidal flat experience at once!
item.description:
Boryeong Muchangpo Beach Low Tide Shellfish

From Hongseong to Seocheon, take the sea of Chungnam! Sea bathing and tidal flat experience at once!

Seocheon-gun, Chungnam, Korea

What is the west coast's greatest attraction? The West Sea is filled with charm that is different from the East Sea, which attracts street hands with clear and beautiful water. You can enjoy sea bathing on the boardwalk and enjoy the tidal-flat experience under the influence of high and low tide. So prepared. Along the coast of Chungnam, head to the gem-like beach and tidal-flat experience hotspots located in Hongseong, Boryeong, and Seocheon!
Before starting the mudflat experience, let's know this!
In order to enjoy the tidal-flat experience, some preparations are required. If you have comfortable shoes such as boots or sneakers, or a basket or a basket for fish and shellfish, you do not need to rent them. Some of the rental fees are included in the experience fee and some are separate. At low tide there are many beaches where you can enjoy clamming for free. Extra clothes are also required.
The tidal-flat of Cheonsu Bay is caught with various foods, of which clams are the most common. Going south, the clams, the clams and the lilies are added. Familiar clams can be caught at all times except during the spawning season, from early July to mid-August. Don't worry about overlapping with summer vacation. Most experience centers manage and divide the experience zone, so visitors can collect their clams.

The most important thing in the tidal-flat experience is 'water time'. National Maritime Research Institute http://www.khoa.go.kr/

If you enter, you can see the timetable of the area where you want to experience the tidal flats. Depending on the region and date, you can experience the tidal flat for two hours before and after “low tide”. This is directly related to safety, so be sure to check it out.

Basic experience of tidal flat
“Find a small hole in the tidal flat. The clam pores. The clams live just below the tidal flats, so scratching them with a pitchfork hurts them. Lightly press the rake and poke it, then lift the mud flat as it looks.
I think if you scratch with a pitchfork, you will get clams in between, but if you scratch a tidal flat, you will get a cut on the surface of the clam that lives closest to the tidal flat. If you sit still and do it yourself, you can quickly get a feel for it. Thanks to the natural way of knowing how to collect. Here's a tip, a small chair that will help you focus more on clam collection. This is because the squat position is inconvenient. Most experience sites limit the amount to 1kg or basket per person.
Ice box to store the collected shellfish safely
Haesong and Moseom walk is a bonus, mixed tidal flat Hongseong Sokdong tidal village
Let's look at Hongseong first. There is Sokdong Tidal Flat in Hongseong, which faces the Taean Peninsula, which stretches across Cheonsu Bay. In the middle of Sokdong Tidal Flat, Gungripo-gu is above and Namdang Port is below. In addition to the wide tidal flats, it boasts a beautiful scenery that includes the Sokdong Observatory, which belongs to the Hongseong Eight View.
Sokdong Tidal-flat Village in Hongseong, South Chungcheong Province
It is easy to reach thanks to the road next to the big road (west coast seaside tourism road). At low tide, you can face the Sokdong Tidal Flats, which are not ashamed of the sea.
The pine trees greet you along the wooden deck that leads to Mosum.
To experience Sokdong Tidal Flats, you should visit the Hongseong Sokdong Tidal Flat Village Village Information Center. If you pay the experience fee (Adult / Infant 7,000 won), you can borrow an experience tool such as boots and a rake to start digging clams. Even beginners can enjoy the taste of clams according to the guide's instructions.
Observatory

The most important thing is that you have to come in time. Sokdong Tidal Flat Village (070-7763-8450)

http://sokdong.invil.org/index.html

Find the tide and book your experience at.

Cheonsu Bay from the Sokdong Observatory
If you enjoyed catching clams, don't miss the Sokdong Observatory. Only wide open waters spread out at a glance. In front of it is Sokdong Tidal Flat Experience Center.
Beating of tidal flat
Go up to Mosum, which is located 100 meters away. As you climb the island through the wooden deck in Haisong Forest, another observatory awaits you. The fall here is also famous, so check it out.
Clam of fast-paced tidal flat
Tidal Flats in the Sand, Boryeong Muchangpo & Seocheon Chunjangdae Beach
It leaves the Sokdong tidal flat and heads to the coast of Boryeong. It passes through Namdang Port, which shakes with cockle in winter when it is winter, and reaches Daecheon Port. The Boryeong Mud Festival, beloved by the world, is held here. The beach is proud of the long sandy beaches of the West Coast. Thanks to the festival, there are plenty of accommodation facilities along the coast.
If you want to enjoy swimming and shellfish more quietly and leisurely, go to Muchangpo. Muchangpo, which opened the first beach in the West Sea, is popular with family travelers thanks to its soft sandy beach and peaceful atmosphere.
Muchangpo Beach where the water falls out and reveals the flesh
At low tide, you can catch shellfish in the sand for added fun.
Crab caught in Muchangpo Tidal Flat
Not only that. Three or four times a month, “Moses' Miracle” unfolds in front of Muchangpo.
Barnacles caught in Muchangpo Tidal Flat
When the time comes, you can enjoy a mysterious and fun experience of catching sea cucumbers, seashells, and octopus along the sea path that leads to Seokdae-do, 1.5 km away.
Exciting tidal flat experience for both children and adults
This year, three days from August 14, the Muchangpo Mystery Sea Road Festival will be held.
Exciting tidal flat experience for both children and adults
If there is Muchangpo in Boryeong, there is Chunjangdae in Seocheon. Chunjangdae Beach, filled with lush pine trees and soft sand, can be used for fine sandy beaches, shellfish and camping.
Chunjangdae beach where you can enjoy tidal-flat experience
At low tide, shellfish can be caught in the sand. The clam and the clam are caught. After the water has drained, you can gently step on the sand tidal flats to reveal the clams.
Chunjangdae beach, where you can enjoy bathing
You can enjoy fresh seafood at Hongwon Port and Maryangpo-gu, located near the coast of Chunjang Dae Beach.
Camping in Haesongrim which surrounds Chunjangdae Beach
Remember that Maryangpo-gu's fall is one of the best spots in the West Coast along with Muchangpo.
A shade curtain where you can relax looking at the sea from the sea
Seocheon representative eco-travel! Wol-ha Castle & Sundori-ri Tidal Flat Experience
The Wolheung Tidal Flat Village, famous for its “taste shellfish,” is crowded with people from all over the country during the holiday season. Unlike the quiet name of 'Castle under the Moonlight', visitors are filled with tidal flats.
High Tide in the Wol-ha Castle Tidal Flat Village
Designated as a fishing village in 2002, an experience program for catching clams, lilies, donjuk, and clams began.
Low tide at Wolha Castle Tidal Flat Village
The long clam-like clam is very popular because of its unique appearance and unusual harvesting methods.
Experience visitors catching shellfish on the Tidal Flats
When the water runs out, you pay the entrance fee (5,000 won). Homina hooks, boots and other equipment are rented separately (1000 won each). If you have prepared in advance, just enter. The clams and donjuk are found throughout the wide tidal flats, and clams are found in pairs.
Entrance to Wolheseong Tidal Flat Village
Let's learn how to catch a clam for a while. Use a shovel to gently roll the mud flats and add salt to the eight-shaped hole. Then the clam will appear slightly out of the hole. If you are in a hurry, wait. After a while, you can take out the clam that has been soaked over the sand tidal flat and you're done!
Dongjuk and Flavored Clams from Wolhaseong Tidal Flat Village
Here, Seocheon-ri's other tidal-flat experience village and Sunni-ri are also indispensable. Wolhaseong Tidal Flat Experience Village and Sundae-ri Tidal Flat Experience Village, about 3.4km away, are also representative of Seocheon.
The high tide of the Sundae-ri Tidal Flat Village
When you pay for the experience fee (5,000 won for adults and 3000 won for underage), a wide tidal flat spreads around the road leading to Ssangdo.
Low tide at Sundori Tidal Flat Village
In Sundori, there are free buses that run to places where there is a lot of copper. However, more than 10 people must gather.
Visitors are harvesting clams from Sunshin-ri Tidal Flat

As mentioned above, to properly enjoy the tidal flat experience, it is necessary to check the “watery time”. National Maritime Research Institute or Wolhaseong Tidal Flat Experience Village (041-952-7060) http://www.westsea.net/

item.title: Hongcheon-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea - Trip to keep me in 1.5 pyeong, prison in me
item.description:
'Prison within me' located in Hongcheon

Trip to keep me in 1.5 pyeong, prison in me

Hongcheon-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea

8 o'clock in the evening. Lock with a 3rd visit outside. The only way to connect to the outside is to serve as a food court. It is time with myself from the moment. When you're running too hard and you don't want to move too tired, let's leave everything and pause. 1.5 pyeong small space in the prison inside of me.
Face with me
The battery is charged when it runs out, and the burned candle is replaced by a new one when worn out. How can a dead person regain energy? Fallen power can be replenished with meals and exercise, but mental exhaustion is not the way to find it. However, if you are in a prison in me, located in Hongcheon, Gangwon-do, you may be able to lift a limp soul.
Prison training in me that looks over the pampas grass
The prison in me is a reflection program that looks back on you. Through Prison Stay, staying in a solitary period for a period of time, Father Hwang Ji-yeon's' Prison within Me 'who breaks habitual daily life through anneagram and meditation,' Kim Kang's' Uncertainty 'who look inside, and plays himself There are various programs, such as Hei Ji-hyang's "Pleasant Prison".
A picture of the history of the Happy Factory, which runs the 'Prison within me'
The prison head of the prison in me is Kwon Yong-suk, a lawyer from the prosecutor's office. The period behind the creation of a 'prison' that anyone is reluctant to go back to the late 1990s. During the prosecutor's case at Jeju Prosecutor, he worked nearly 100 hours a week, and he needed to recharge both his body and mind. It was prison that caught his eye at that time. His request to spend a week in prison for the prison warden was now the seed of 'the prison within me'.
Jail in me where you can find good writing here and there
The Hongcheon Training Center, where 'the prison within me' is located, consists of three buildings: the training center, the Gangdang-dong, and the administrative building.
Prison training in me
Suyeon-dong, a reflection space for residents, is used as a solitary classroom and 32 cozy rooms on 2nd and 3rd floors. Group activities such as recreation and meals take place in the auditorium building, and managers stay in the management building.
The entrance to Suyeon-dong's iron gate is blue with snow.
The special feature of the program is that the participant is kept in solitary like a real prisoner. Toiletries and writing instruments are all you can carry. Not only mobile phones but books are also allowed. A small table and a single futon occupy me inside of a room that is full.
Inside view of the training center
1.5 pyeong is wider than 15 pyeong
The winter in Gangwon-do is more peaceful than I thought. Instead of rippling streams, you'll be able to jump on ice and, if you're lucky, you'll find elk that's been running through the mountains. However, the concentric filling begins for a while in a small 1.5-pyeong room with a blue jumpsuit and a number instead of a name, with a pit under the door.
The space where you meet me, 1.5 pyeong solitary
The room is large enough for five steps for a man and six steps for a woman. In a room that doesn't even fit a single bed, there's a small drawer and desk, a single teapot and an electric pot, and a toilet and a small sink. It may be frustrating, but if you go through it, space is left. Things that seemed inconvenient because of it are rather cumbersome.
Feeling warm happiness in a cup of tea during the morning sun
When you enter the room after the group schedule, the visit will be locked outside with 3 kinds and you will start your own time. Before going into a solitary confinement, let's leave the worldly thing as possible for full concentration. The anxiety that arises from the loss of the concept of time is brief. Only the sound of the bells, the bells ringing in time, the rice coming in through the pot, and the relaxed nature of the sun rises and falls.
The appearance of the monk Keumkang
The first time he spends in the silence is 'But'. The surroundings are quiet, but the head is eaten with the sounds of various thoughts. I want to run out of the world wondering about it. But at some point I find myself immersed in myself instead of regretting the outside.
When it's time for meals, you'll get meals through the visiting pit.
The programs that make the most use of training centers are short-term programs for homeless people and non-communities. A non-communist means a monk, who is a monk and a monk who concentrates on the topic for several years in a solitary cell. It starts at 108 times every day for seven nights and eight days, and during the morning, he frees his head while listening to the Kumgang monk's broadcast lecture, which releases the public commentary `` Munjikan ''. In the afternoon, only beginners will be interviewed with beginner lectures. If you are not willing to attend, you can immerse yourself in a 1.5-pyeong single room for seven nights and eight days. Your day will be an unfamiliar experience that no one disturbs.
If you visit in the winter, you can stroll on a frozen river.
There is a moment where you stop and wander in front of you. In that case, let's get out of the world and lock yourself in solitary confinement. It's time to listen to what you want, not the world, to give you a richer inner life than you think.
Participants enjoy the nature lying on the ice

item.title: Hapcheon-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea - Hapcheon Healing Trip
item.description:
Hapcheon Cinema Theme Park

Hapcheon Healing Trip

Hapcheon-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea

Hapcheon has a quiet but beautiful scenery. Headed by the Haeinsa Temple at the foot of Gayasan, he prepared a healing trip to soothe the mind and body, focusing on Odosan Sunrise, Hapcheon Film Theme Park and Samga Hanwoo Street.
This line starts at Gayasan and Haeinsa, which are located in the northernmost part of Hapcheon, and meets one by one as it goes down to the south.

What kind of locality is it? Hapcheon means “narrow mine”. If you read Chinese characters literally, it is Hyecheon. There are many mountains and no fields. The narrow valley surrounded by mountains is named after many topographical features. However, in March 1914, when the administrative district was reorganized, it was said that the sum of the three villages was combined as the basins of Chogye and Samga were incorporated into Hapcheon-gun. From then on, the Chinese characters were used as is, but the pronunciation was '합천'.

Along the Haeinsa Temple
Let's go from Mount Kaya (1430m), the northern gateway to Hapcheon. Gayasan is located on the border between Gyeongnam and Gyeongbuk. Gyeongnam Hapcheon reaches south and Seongju County Gyeongbuk reaches north. The highest name in the region where the gaya was located was called ‘Gayasan’. It was designated National Park No. 9 in 1972.
Road to Gayasan Haeinsa Temple
If you enter the foothills of Gayasan along the winding road, you first reach Haeinsa Temple. Haeinsa Temple, which has the eighty-four grandfather, is considered one of Sambo temples in Korea along with Tongdosa in Yangsan and Songgwangsa in Suncheon.
Go to Haeinsa through Haeinsa Seongbo Museum
Haeinsa was founded in 802 by Hae Jun and Lee Jung.
Go to Haeinsa through Haeinsa Seongbo Museum
‘해인 삼매’ refers to a state in which the reality of the legal world can be perceived as it is, as if all the shapes seem intact when the sea is stopped. As you savor the meaning, it seems as if you are drawing a softening on the sea.
Haeinsa Daewoong Preservation
The reason why Haeinsa is called “Law of Legal Affairs” is because it seals the Korean Colonial Police Commission. The name 'Palman Daegyeongkyeong' is presumed to come from the use of the name 'Palman Sacheon' when the Jang Kyung-pan's Jang Kyung-pan is also a Palman Woman and refers to so many things in Buddhism.
Haeinsa One Order
As the name suggests, the eighty-four colonel was published in the Goryeo Dynasty. The colon was made twice, and the first edition, published first from 1011 to 1087, was lost to the arson of the Mongolian army. The blacksmith who's left by us now disappears.
View overlooking Daeungbojeon
The tree used for the large sized plate was soaked in the whole sea cherry tree for three years and then sculpted. After that, finely carved with a planer carved the door. First, he wrote a sentence with a brush and carved out each letter. Every single letter carved
Haeinsa eighty-large colonel that can only be seen from outside
I'm curious. How have you been in the game for years? First of all, the location of the Gayasan Valley wind, the floor covered with sand and charcoal, and the window with different size up and down are selected as the secrets. My heart is eaten by the wisdom of my ancestors. The shape of the window can be seen with both eyes.
We soothe regret with photograph of the eighty-eight million people
Journey through film and drama, Hapcheon Film Theme Park
When you get out of Haeinsa, the colorect theme park welcomes you. 80,000 units I couldn't confirm myself
Odo mountain peak is considered the sunrise point
There is a telecommunications relay station at the top of Mt. To go to the relay station, you must go to Myosan-myeon Kayama. You can reach the summit of Mt. Odo in 25 minutes by car on a rough 10km road. This is why Odo Mountain is considered a sunrise spot where vehicles can enter.
Only after coming down Odo did the sun appear

Hapcheon Film Theme Park was born in 2003 to shoot the movie `` Taegeukgi Flying ''. Various movie and drama sets including <East of Eden> and <Seoul 1945> from the Japanese colonial period to the 1970s and 1980s

Hapcheon Cine Theme Park
My parents would have dated this in Jongno Street and had a drink in Daepot House. It's obvious, but it's amazingly polite. Travel freely between layers of time. Oh, remember that there is a thrilling horror experience at the video theme park in summer.
Hapcheon Cine Theme Park
Leaving behind dimness, he heads for Hanwoo Street. Why did Hanwoo Street enter into Hapcheon, a mountain village? As we saw earlier, Hapcheon was not a rich land. The story of raising cattle because there is no land for farming
Korean beef street of Samga-myeon formed by the market
If you want to taste Korean beef in Hapcheon, you should go to Samga-myeon in the south. There is a big market place where there are meat houses around. Even now, more than a dozen Korean cattle houses are gathered. You can taste fresh Korean beef for 20,000 won per serving (200g). If you're a vegetarian, keep in mind the wild vegetables located throughout the Gaya Mountains and Hapcheon. As it is a deep mountain valley, various mountain vegetables have been developed.
You can taste loess eaten Korean beef at a reasonable price.

item.title: Gokseong-gun, Jeonnam, Korea - Colorful transformation of abandoned back road, Gokseong Tukbang Market Tour
item.description:
One sunny day Ttukbang Market <Picture Credit. Gokseong-gun Office>

Colorful transformation of abandoned back road, Gokseong Tukbang Market Tour

Gokseong-gun, Jeonnam, Korea

Gokseong-gun. It is the place where the valley and the ashes were born as designated. Clear water and green mountains spread out everywhere. In recent years, there has been one more attraction in addition to the Qingsu Mt. Ttukbang Market, which enters once a month, is its main character. About 50 teams of sellers sell handmade crafts and jeonjeonburi on Gokseongcheon Ttukbanggil. Let's go to Gokseong Ttukbang Market, which is being reborn as 'the field of Jeolladomin unity'.
Gokseong Train Market Ttukbang Market
Gokseong Dangbang Tukbang Market is a new flea market that opened in May. On the last Saturday of every month (2nd and 4th Saturday of every month from 2017), guests are welcomed for 5 hours on the Ttukbang path lined with cherry trees. Ttukbanggil, which has been abandoned for a long time because of its distance from major tourist attractions, began to enjoy its heyday with the arrival of Ttukbang Market. It played a big role in urban regeneration by helping tourists in the town limited to train villages. Tourists can also enjoy the unique atmosphere of Gokseongcheon, so there aren't any two birds.
The road is not difficult. After setting the destination as Gokseong Train Village Traditional Market, you can park your car at the luxury building next door. When you get out of the car, you can see the crooked path with yellow sunshade behind the market. You can also take a bus instead of driving. It is only 500m away from Ttukbang Road and can be reached on foot.
A rainy course
On rainy days, the place is moved to the traditional market instead of the open air path. Since the traditional market operates for 5 days, the interior is usually empty. Even if you move indoors, the yellow sunshade, a symbol of Ttukbang Market, hangs on the ceiling.
Ttukbang Market moved to traditional market
Why is it a yellow cloth? The answer is simple. This is because the yellow goes well with the fresh green of the cherry tree and the clear sky. There is also a reason that the soft and warm feeling of yellow is a good match with the image of Ttukbang Market, which is connected with local residents and tourists and has emerged as a place of communication.
Various items in Ttukbang Market that attract visitors
The opening is at 2 pm. It is a good time for tourists to have lunch after visiting the nearby train villages.
Various items in Ttukbang Market that attract visitors
Nevertheless, excessive procrastination should be avoided. You will come to see only the empty stand. If you have something you want to buy, we recommend visiting at the opening time.
Various items in Ttukbang Market that attract visitors
Most of the items sold here include diffusers, plaster fragrances, candles, mini-blocks, fairy tale books and baby clothes, but rarely duplicate items. Even if duplicated, each seller's personality is melted in the item, so it is fun to compare.
Various items in Ttukbang Market that attract visitors
Sellers come and age as much as personality. The story of a man who runs for an hour in Jeonju to participate in the Ttukbang Market while operating a nail art shop is his main job.
Various items in Ttukbang Market that attract visitors
Most of them have experienced steadily from the first time, and surprisingly, there are few cases where a separate offline store is operated. If you like the homemade cookies, you can't stop by at any time.
Pretty Jellyflower
A housewife who sells homemade cookies at the Ttukbang Market laughed wildly, saying, “If you respond to the occasional business, you may be able to open a store if you respond well.”
Various homemade cookies
There are also young couples who sell their newborn babies. The cookies they sell are baked directly, and the rice cake is taken from a father-owned mill. As soon as they were born, the baby's eyes were painted here and became mascots.
Pretzel eating in line
Some sellers chose to return home from the dentist's life. After taking free aroma courses for farmers, the company began to make and sell natural cosmetics such as moisture cream, cleansing oil, lip balm and toothpaste. The shelf life is not long enough to make products even on the morning of the market. The reason for this simple business is to see a younger man at an age when his head is grayed out. Hopefully later, if you have a big child, you thought, 'Mom did something for me.'
Handmade fruit
Ttukbang Market
If you talk with people like that, you will quickly find hunger. It is basically adjacent to the traditional market, and there are plenty of foods to eat at reasonable prices such as red bean kalguksu, anchovy noodles, tteokbokki, tempura, and pretzel. Among them, on the sunny days, they are lined up in a line of instant noodles, sweet tteokbokki, and assorted tempura.
Tteokbokki sold with hotteok
The slightly felt genus is soothed with homemade lemonade from a young couple with a newborn baby. It's not too sweet, but it's fresh.
One of the best snacks
The charm of Ttukbang Market is its low price and warm heart. Homemade snacks don't cost more than 5,000 won, and crops grown directly in the field are sold at a much lower price than the market. Calculations are made in cash only and sellers write receipts upon request. If you spend more than 10,000 won, you can get a prize by submitting a receipt to the organizer's table. Gifts of the day were buckets and fabric softeners.
Making lemonade on the spot
Live bands that increase the tempo of shopping are another specialty of Ttukbang Market. Unconsciously, Oga makes their steps lighter. Some people sit in front of them and enjoy witty progress and skillful playing.
Making lemonade on the spot
Seomjin River Train Village
If you still feel sorry, you can take a tour around Seomjin River Train Village. I visited in early October when the Gokseongsimcheong Festival was held.
Farm Market selling grain and agricultural products
As usual, if you break the ticket for 3,000 won, you can explore the beautiful rose park, the theme booth where you can experience various things, the local restaurants selling Gokseong's agricultural products, and the farm market.
Tasting Grilled Mushrooms
The best part is a bunch of 3 million roses of 1,004 varieties that wear Yongke peaks despite the pouring autumn rain. Yellow, pink, red, white, and orange are all fun to see.
Homemade Sesame Seeds and Sesame Oil
In spring, the World Rose Festival is held here. It's not a waste to see a rose only.
A rose park full of flavor
When you go around the wheel of a train village, you encounter small happiness. Laughing in the small landscapes such as the words “Let our family be filled with good things” written on the wishes or the soap bubbles flying around, the children gathering around the Piero, the lovers who swear by eternal love and the drums of hope. Comes out.
A wish
If you are planning a more rich trip to Gokseong, take a Gokseong Tourist Taxi (1522-9053). The taxi, which runs a total of six courses, is useful because the route can be changed on request. The pilot will be in full operation from March next year.
Children gathered around soap bubbles
Travel info

Gokseong Train Market Ttukbang Market

Inquiries: 061-363-9900

Rooms

item.title: Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea - Go back to Changsin-dong Alley where Park Soo-keun and Nam June Paik lived
item.description:
Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong are the outer villages of Hanyang Castle

Go back to Changsin-dong Alley where Park Soo-keun and Nam June Paik lived

Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea

The house where Seo Min-hwa, Park Soo-geun lived, and the house where video artist Nam June Paik lived are in Changsin-dong. Seo Min-hwa walks Park Soo-keun along the alleys of Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong, Jongno-gu, outside of Dongdaemun, Hanyangdo Castle.
It is a half-day trip to the Dongmyomun Design Plaza (DDP), where you can enjoy the night view of Heunginjimun Gate and alleys.
The marketplaces and alleys of Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong resurrect as cultural streets
Changyang-dong and Sungin-dong, a town outside Dongdaemun, Hanyang Castle
Exit through Dongdaemun Station (Seoul Subway Line 1) and go up Dongdaemun Castle Park. The neatly finished Hanyang Castle is a symbol of the Joseon Dynasty in 600 years. If you continue along the castle road, you can climb to the top of Naksan Castle, and the Hanyangdoseong Dulle Road is connected to Ewha Mural Village, which attracts domestic and foreign tourists.
Hanyangdoseong Museum is located at the top of Dongdaemun Castle Park.
The Hanyangdoseong Museum is located at the top of Dongdaemun Castle Park, and you can see the Heunginjimun Gate at a glance. The Dongdaemun Shopping Town is lively, with the Heunginjimun as the center, and the outer diameter of DDP stands out as the former Dongdaemun Baseball Stadium. Heunginjimun and DDP's night view, which is popular as a date course for families and young couples, will meet at sunset, and they will set the course at Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong, the lower villages of the castle.
Heunginjimun and downtown view of Dongdaemun intersection from the view of Seongseong Park
Changsin-dong and Sungin-dong are the villages outside the city where the common people lived outside the city of Hanyang. As soon as you descend the castle and turn around, the trails are well maintained outside the castle and the Changsin-dong alleys are connected. Changsin-dong is still a cluster of 2,000 sewing factories. As you walk in the alleys, you will hear a sewing machine sound through the window frame of a small sewing factory between a steep hill and a curved alley. Recently, as a part of the city's urban regeneration project, themed alleys will be built around the sewing alleys and the sewing museum will be built.
Changsin-dong Plush Alley under Naksan
If you step down to the Changsin-dong Alley, you will find the Changsin Market Taste Alley, where the pace of finding restaurants is increasing. You can get a glimpse of the hanok between the alleys. Now exit the market alley and down the street. In front of Woori Bank, you can see the signpost of Changshin Market, exit 3 of Dongdaemun Station (Lines 1 and 4). Turn left into the small alley and you will see Seongjin Super on the corner. It is a raw garter (197-33, Changsin-dong, Jongno-gu) by video artist Nam June Paik (1932 ~ 2006).
Changsin Market's Alley with Food and Old Scenery
500m from Nam June Paik's Garter to the house
Unfortunately, Nam June Paik's house was torn down in the 1950s and operated as a restaurant until recently, but it was bought by the city of Seoul in August to create a cultural exhibition space to commemorate the 10th anniversary of Nam June Paik's death next year. Nam June Paik was born in Changpo and lived in Changsin-dong until he was 18 years old. Nam June Paik's house, which had a total area of 9,900m², was a hanok, a rich house with a cadillac, which was the only two in Korea. He finished his work in 2004 after finishing his last presentation. In an interview at the time, he said, "I want to go to Changsin-dong where I grew up." I can't look inside the house, but I'm glad that it will be a new cultural space next year.
Garter of Nam June Paik
Now, he goes back to Changsin-dong Station Alley and visits the house where Seo Min-hwa artist Park Soo-geun (1914-1965) lived. If you are with children, Changsin-dong Station Alley is a must. This alley is nothing short of Treasure Island in the eyes of the children who hold the hands of mom and dad on the weekend. Princesses who can't keep their eyes in front of large dolls and princes who hold their toy cars and howl are making memories forever.
Changsin-dong Station Alley is a must for children
Crossing the crossing in front of Dongmyomae Station Exits 2 and 3, the starting point of Dongmyo Flea Market is on the left, and the left side of Park Soo-Keun painter's house (393-16, Changsin-dong, Jongno-gu) is located. Currently there are restaurants and authorized brokerage offices and there are no milestones. However, someone wrote 'Park Su-geun's house' in small letters on the wall.
Changsin-dong House where painter Park Soo-keun lived
It's a pity, but if you illuminate Park's life, its meaning comes to me. Park Su-geun, who is considered to have the strongest Korean colors, is accompanied by a qualifier called 'Sum Minhwa'. His masterpieces, including Wells, Washer, and Roadside, were all born in Changshin-dong. He drew common people who sat in alleys and markets. The old man squatted with children and the peddlers were models. Park Soo-geun lived in Changsin-dong from 1952 to 1963 and portrayed many common people until he died of illness.
A small sign written by someone who paints Park Su-geun like hope
The alleys and marketplaces of the common people drawn by Park Soo-keun
Park Su-geun, a poor painter who loved the common people, walks to Sungnye-dong Dongmyo Flea Market. The Dongmyo Flea Market, which is held only on weekends, retains the alleys and marketplaces of old times, and has recently attracted attention as a new cultural playground. Dongmyo is located in the center of the marketplace, and it has been called Dongmyo Flea Market. The tomb is the shrine of Confucius. The market place runs like a spider's web in a small alley, centering on the tomb and the main street. On weekends, young couples holding their hands, lovers on a date, and blue-eyed foreign tourists who are interested in our culture are common. As you slowly look around the marketplace, you can see the people in the paintings. It overlaps with the faces of the alleys that the poor painters faced.
Dongmyo flea market scenery attracts people every weekend
To find the Dongmyo flea market, all you need is a light pocket and a bit of snow. For a thousand won, you can taste a cup of warm Americano, a king-headed dumpling with a little boy's face, or you can pick up your style without having to notice it. A young dad holding a child's hand and going on a holiday outing says about Dongmyo Flea Market.
Tourists visiting Dongmyo in the center of Dongmyo Flea Market
“The playground is easy to reach by public transport and enjoyable with curious children. I find mystery items at my disposal so I can buy them cheaply. It is the best holiday holiday destination. ”
Changsin-dong Alleys and Marketplaces
Don't miss the tombs in the center of the market. Dongmyo is located in a relatively spacious space, so it's enough to take a break.
Heunginjimun, DDP, Dongdaemun Shopping Town
From the Soong-dong house of Park Su-geun to the Changshin-dong house of world-renowned video artist Nam June Paik, it is only 500m away. Walking along the alleyway where two artists representing 20th century Korean art lived, and looking around Heunginjimun Gate and DDP Night View at dusk, a one-day Seoul outing is enough.
Night view of DDP, popular as a date course for lovers
Travel info

Hanyang Doseong Museum
Address: 283 Yulgok-ro, Jongno-gu, Seoul
Contact: 02-724-0243

Dongmyo Flea Market
Address: Dongmyo Park, 84, Nangye-ro 27-gil, Jongno-gu, Seoul (Exit 3, Dongmyomae Station, Subway Lines 1 and 6)
Opening hours: Weekdays from 2pm to sunset, weekends from 10am to sunset
Contact: Jongno-gu Office 02-2148-1114

Dongdaemun Design Plaza (DDP)
Address: 281 Euljiro, Jung-gu, Seoul
Contact: 02-2153-0000

http://www.ddp.or.kr/MA010001/getInitPage.do


1. Nearby restaurants

item.title: Boryeong, South Korea - A few hours spent alone at Treasure Island Chamber of Hanok
item.description:
You can enjoy the sea and hanok scenery at the Sanghwa Garden.

A few hours spent alone at Treasure Island Chamber of Hanok

Boryeong, South Korea

Hanok entered the island. The tree that guarded the island wrapped up the old house after it was declared. Man reached out and made his way and made a pond. The sea from the island was harmonious and named it Sanghwawon. It is the story of a garden on Jukdo. Because of the beautiful scenery, rumors spread across the island. If you're eager to avoid the heat and quiet alone, head to Boryeong-si Jukhwa Garden.
The whole island becomes a garden
It takes about 10 minutes to Jukdo after getting off at Daecheon Station on Janghang Line. The island, originally floating on the West Sea, was connected with land by roads for reclamation. Although once in danger of development, the island owner's insistence on maintaining the nature of Jukdo could be preserved.
The owner pondered a meaningful way to protect the island. It was decided to create a garden named Sanghwawon with the meaning of worshiping harmony. Jukdo was determined not to hurt the nature. What did you think about bringing hanok to the island? The encounter between the two, which felt only heterogeneous, was exquisite when I think about it today. Visitors were happy to meet an unexpected Hanok on the island. It was a hanok that prolonged life in front of the crisis.
Lee Dae Cheong House
Wherever in the Sangwon Garden, the sea seems to be in your hands. Dense forests on the road and shoulders are enough to hide. If the crowded destination is burdensome, the Sangwon House is a wonderful hideaway that will make my whereabouts brief.
Hong's house door
Walk the path of the Sangwon Garden
It takes about an hour and a half to roam the whole house. Need to hurry up to the island? Let's set aside the haste. As you enter the Sanghwawon, you will see a handsome Hanok in front of you. It is Uigo Hall. It is a hanok that was built to be used as sperm in Hwaseong Gwana, Gyeonggi-do. It is assumed that it was built during the late Goryeo or early Joseon Dynasty. Before moving to the upper house, he pitched his tent and wrote it as a coffee shop. If you didn't come here for preservation, the house would have been demolished.
Uigok Hall is currently used as a visitor center. Provide a simple drink and rice cake to the audience. Note that there are no restaurants or stalls inside the Sanghwawon. If you do not have enough water to drink, you can use the bottled water stand on the corridor.
The Sanghwawon viewing starts from the right side with the back of the entrance. Walk along the corridor over 1 km. Give your eyes a green leafy hack before heading to the cloister. There is a humorous wooden boarder who writes about 200 years old, who writes down. A generous shade of trees is a thankful season.
Uigok Hall from the entrance of the Sanghwawon
The signpost written 'entrance to the walk' is the starting point. The white strip on the floor of the corridor serves as a milestone for visitors. Every 50 meters you will see how far you've walked. This saves you the trouble of finding your way and doubles the size of your landscape.
Just follow the white line and you can go round the island
The corridor followed the path of Jukdo Aboriginal people for a long time. There is no bird boring at the height of the island that resembles the contours of the island. The roof is not difficult to walk in bad weather. There are many stairs, so it is inconvenient to go with a stroller or a wheelchair. There is plenty of shelter with chairs and tables in the middle of the street.
If you're thirsty, you can buy it at a bottled water stand.
The curve of the cloister roof that looks a bit off the road from the forest is beautiful. Rising, lowering and bending may look like waves in the West Sea or mimic the roof of a hanok.
Drilled holes in the streets and ceilings without cutting wood
I didn't cut the tree because it hindered the way. To protect the nature by drilling holes in the floor and ceiling. The inconvenience of having to walk away from the trees is rather interesting.
Sangwon Corridor from the Forest
Walk the corridor to rest your mind and body
The beach pond along the corridor is also worth seeing. Cute aquatic plants and fish live. The stone wall around the pond was built directly by human hands. Walking along the corridor, you can see the Hanok Gate in the middle. Thick rust has already sat in the traditional patterned knocker. I hear the squeaking sound I hear when I open the door.
There are 33 beach ponds where aquatic plants and fish live.
The traditional window frame inside the main gate is a popular photo zone. Let's leave the picture against the backdrop of the sea view through the window frame. The window frame pattern is filled with straight lines and curves. You can also open and close it yourself.
If you open the gate of old hanok, another world will come out.
The beach reading room comes out when you arrive at about 500m. Is there such a scenery that I can fall for reading slowly? Even if you haven't brought a book, don't miss it. Watching the sea unfold before your eyes, time goes by well. It's a great place to listen to music you've stored on your phone. Buy a bottle of water at a bottled water stand and let your neck cool down for a while. On the far sea, yachts from Boryeong Yacht Stadium float in the wind. Ships sailing often hear pleasant cheers.
You may sit anywhere and read a book.
Go to the last resting place of hanok
The last course of the Sanghwawon walk is Hanok Village. There are seven hanoks in the village. The house, which was soon to collapse, moved to the Sanghwawon to find a haven. Hanok Village was built on terraced fields, which were the homes of Aboriginal people. One or two houses are seated on a staircase. Thanks to this, you can enjoy the sea view that spreads out in all hanoks. Climbing behind the Gochang-eup government office at the top of the village, you can see the soft lines of the hanok roof and the sea.
Relaxing alone in a cup of tea
On every pillar of the house there is a signboard detailing the use, history and structure of the house. If you are interested in hanok, it is fun to read. You can also see photos taken before moving to the Sangwon Garden. It's an old house that won't be weird right away. It is easy to imagine that the restoration was as expensive as it is now. Problems that could not be solved by money were replaced by devotion. If the damage is severe, some houses have been restored separately from the main house and the door. Detachable glass walls were installed to protect the house. The small island of the West Sea was the process of becoming the home of Hanok.
Lee Dae-cheong's house is an a-shaped hanok that looks up to the left after climbing a corridor. The floor has a water purifier and tea bag tea. Enjoy the luxury of a cup of tea while admiring the spectacular view of the West Sea from the wide window. The best cafes are not envious moments. On the other side is Dongheon in Naganan-eup. It was the place where Lee Se-dol 9dan and Park Jung-hwan 9dan played the finals at the 2014 Go tournament. In order to commemorate the competition at that time, a board and a goggle were placed. Everyone may sit for a while and play Go.
If you go to Dongheon, anyone can have Go or engrave
The most prominent hanok in the village is the Gochang-eup Office. It is located at the top of Hanok Village. A pine tree, bowed like a bow, stands through the edge of the cornice. While sitting on the terraced terrain, Hanok was preserved without cutting the original pine tree. Thanks to this, trees connect to life and travelers capture memories of strange landscapes.
I put the original tree without cutting while restoring
Going up behind the Gochang-eup Office is a pine forest. Imagine if the fog of the island will come from beyond the forest on a foggy day. Heading towards the villa, it is the sky garden. The roof of the villa was built. The roof deck is full of flower pots. The Sangwon Garden is a good place to stay for a few hours. It's easy to take a stroll around the island, and there's plenty to see and do. If you are unhappy with your day trip, you can stay at the villa. Open daily except July-August. During the rest of the year, you can only watch on Fridays, Sundays and public holidays. It is closed from December to March.
I put the original tree without cutting while restoring
Travel info

Sanghwawon

Inquiries: 041-933-4750

item.title: Yangpyeong-gun, South Korea - Summer trip to sunflower village and rural train station
item.description:
Large signstone written `` Muwang 1-ri ''

Summer trip to sunflower village and rural train station

Yangpyeong-gun, South Korea

Many people are worried about where to go with their families on this summer's vacation. It is a good place for those who are looking for a place where they want to spend their time quietly rather than a place where a lot of people gather. It is the sunflower village of Yangpyeong-gun and Seokbul Station and Gudun Station, which are rural railway stations. Don't forget to take a camera with you to leave your family in a wonderful photo.
A village where you can see sunflowers faced to the sky
Sunflower Village, Seokbul Station and Gudun Station are located on Jipyeong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun. This area is famous for Jipyeong Makgeolli. You can get there by train, so you don't have to waste time during a busy holiday season. Not a lot of people come to visit, but it is perfect for a day trip quietly. If you set the date well, you can also enjoy the Yongmun oil market.
Sunflowers are on the road to the village
If you take a bus from the Yongmun Intercity Bus Terminal near Yongmun Station, you can get off at the bus stop where the large signpost written 'Muwang 1-ri' stands. 初 川 (chocheon) used together on the stone is the old name of the sunflower village. The water flowing through the Yeoju into the Namhan River began in the sunflower village and was called as follows. Pass through the stone and meet the typical rural village landscape. Sunflowers on the road seem to give the name of the village. The village boasts a peaceful landscape in the form of a basin at 300m above sea level.
A sunflower-themed mural was painted on the wall of the village.
The sunflowers that bloomed here were planted in late May and began to bloom in late July. In 2014, with the support of the Gyeonggi-do Agricultural Technology Center, sunflower seeds were planted for the income of the villagers. After the sunflower bloomed, the scenery began to spread. In the summer, photo club members often come to town to capture the flowers that fill the fields. Note that there are no restaurants or stalls in town.
Sunflowers began to bloom in late July
Sunflowers meet like a hidden picture
If you walk about 10 minutes from the stone, you will be able to park your car. This is the village entrance. Now it's time to find the sunflowers in full bloom and take a walk as you wish. In the villages, sunflower fields are not fixed, but they are planted using land, so you can find flowers everywhere. Sunflowers are also slightly bloomed, so you can go to flower viewing as if you are looking for a hidden picture.
Travelers taking commemorative photos with sunflowers in the background
In the middle of the road, the voices of those who look at the sunflowers and admire the beautifulness are often heard. There are many visitors who take commemorative photos standing side by side with sunflowers. Sunflowers are too tall or they turn their heads in the wrong direction, making them hard to see. It is also common here for children to marvel at the bees rushing toward a full-blown seed sunflower.
Bee rushing towards sunflower
If you want to know where sunflowers are spread throughout the village, you can refer to the guide map of `` Muwangri Sunflower Road '' installed on the crossroads before going to the town hall. In the parking lot, you can see a lot of sunflowers on the hill road, near the town hall, and on the way to the Muwang Church.
You can see the `` Muwang-ri Sunflower Road '' guide map at the crossroad
The village also held its 3rd Sunflower Festival 2016 (July 29-31). This is a village festival prepared for the flowering period of sunflowers. During the festival, visitors sold sunflower barley rice, yeolmu noodles, and pan-fried rice to visitors. There was also a marketplace selling sunflower seeds, barley, corn, potatoes, and bokbunja grown in the village. Sunflowers are expected to open until the end of August. The festival is over, but it's a good place to go to see flowers with your family.
Muwang-ri Town Hall
Seokbul Station is like a toy country
A simple station is a train station with few passengers. There is a station station where employees are in charge of their duties, but stop only trains without even having to. Thanks to the unique atmosphere and dignity, many people deliberately come to the station to feel romantic and memories.
There is a working room but no staff. To take the train towards Cheongnyangni, cross the underground passage to the right of the entrance. The distance from Sunflower Village to Seokbul Station is less than 3 km. If you drive by car, it's easy to get there, but it's not convenient to use public transportation.
Seokbul Station with red roof and blue exterior wall stands out from far away
Originally, Seokbul Station was destined to disappear due to fewer customers. It was unfortunate that the county and the county government jointly signed a campaign to prevent the removal of the Seokbul Station and built a new building in 2013. Thanks to this, there is no atmosphere of an old building that is expected of a simple station, but rather a small and small station building.
Many visitors take commemorative photos against the blue wall.
The pointed red roof of Seokbul Station and the outer wall of a blue building are easy to see from afar. Thanks to this, if you travel by bus or car from Yongmun or Muwang-ri, you can see the beautiful blue building in the distance. Standing in front of Seokbul Station building, it feels like a visit to Toy Land. The exterior walls and windows are a great backdrop for taking pictures. It's like a sketchbook with pastel colored walls.
Passage for downline train from Seokbul Station
Gudun Station, Memory of First Love on Hill
three
Climbing the hill leads to Gudun Station, a registered cultural property.
After passing Muwang-ri, cross the Ilshin 2nd Bridge and you will see a hill. If you go up the street, you will come to Ilsin Church. Since you have to walk the hill road based on Ilshin 2nd Bridge, if you are visiting this place in summer, it is recommended to climb slowly. Because the road is narrow, be careful when driving with you. There is space for parking in front of Gudun Station.
Long wooden chair staying inside the station
Complete your mission to the train station, and now you'll be able to walk through the tracks at the retired Gudun Station. Gudun Station is also famous as the filming location of the film Introduction to Architecture. Like the heroes in the movie, many people walk along the railway and leave memories on the camera. It's a great place to recall the fresh memories of your first love or to explain your old train station to your children.
Memo that the person who visited Gudun Station wished
Inside the station, there are long wooden chairs, train schedules and passenger fares. If you go out to the railroad tracks, you will see a wish tree with a memo of the people who visited this place. What did you write down? I peek at the short texts of strangers and write down my wishes and hang them by my side. Next to the tree stands a carriage that is not running. Take a walk with the whole family on a railroad train. About 100 meters of railroad tracks remain from the station building. The well-preserved closed area and the surrounding landscape are beautiful and it is a good place to spend some time.
Cars stopped at Gudun Station no longer run
