item.title: Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea - The unique bookstore exhibition where culture blooms in a book
item.description:
Independent publication beef stew in pamphlet form

The unique bookstore exhibition where culture blooms in a book

Mapo-gu, Seoul, Korea

With the development of internet bookstores, it is hard to find bookstores around the house, as it is necessary to go to large bookstores to serve books. However, bookstores that can smell books and taste more than that are attracting people's attention little by little. Let's meet a unique bookstore that pursues a different direction than others.
‘Bookbook’, have you heard of it? Book by Book
Sangam-dong Media City Building With forest in front of the road, there is a bar, the alley where rice cakes boil together, and the old bookstore “Bukbaibook” is run by the sister and brother. Although it is bewildering to have a bookstore, it is always captivated by the charms of the Book By Book.
When you enter the entrance, you meet
Book-bookers are usually regulars when they love books. You can feel it as a space filled with hearts for the owners' books. First of all, I applied vinyl full of analog sensibility to one book so that the book did not wear out like the textbooks wrapped in vinyl in elementary school.
I have categorized it with interesting naming names, such as ‘The author Holic Jung’.
Books on display are beautifully coated with the tails of customers or authors who leave a story or recommendation about the book. There is also a customer reading card that allows you to record the books you read, so you can't erase the feeling of space for me.
Booktails packed with customers' attention
The reason for the popularity of this place is 'book mac'. Only the person who has experienced the comfort of reading typefaces with a glass of cold beer leans on the sofa on one side can know. Not only that. The owner's seal is also generous. Present free coffee coupons to customers in various ways, including writing a booktail, selling a book, and posting it on social media. Points that can be earned in a variety of ways can be used like cash, from buying coffee to purchasing books to special lectures.
Office workers relax after work
Bookstores are often transformed into different clothes. First, there is a pop-up store on one side of the bookstore. 'SUNDAYJAM', famous for homemade jam, is now in the store with a cute phrase that 'people will buy bread to eat jam'.
Sweet SUNDAYJAM
In addition, small but well-known concerts and lectures are often held, including “writer lightning” where writers and readers meet and talk. If you're curious about the schedule, visit the host's sns. In addition to blogs, Kakao Story, Instagram, and other channels through a variety of information, such as news and schedule information.
Sweet SUNDAYJAM
Red bookstore
If you're a bookworm, you might have heard the podcast ‘Red Bookstore’. In May 2012, Lee Dong-jin, a film critic, started as the main MC, and now has overwhelming No. 1 in the book category. Not only that. Thanks to its popularity, a cafe called 'red bookstore' was opened in front of the mecca of young people, Hongdae.
A mailbox that connects with critic Lee Dong-jin
Unlike the nose, which responds to the scent of coffee when you open a large, thick door like a hardcover, your eyes respond to a large, red bookshelf. Bookstores are located in the cafe area where you can enjoy coffee and chat, or spend a quiet day reading books.
Small exhibitions are held throughout the cafe
Most of the books in the bookshelves are new books and bestsellers recommended by critic Lee Dong-jin. In addition, there is a bookshelf full of books introduced in the podcast, and red bookstore enthusiasts are tempted to buy and read every book.
Don't miss out on coffee and desserts
If you want to see the critic's recording of the red bookstore, you can visit the red bookstore. There is a recording booth on the 3rd floor for podcasts on open radio.
Podcast “Red Bookstore” with listeners
Put a story in the red mailbox labeled Dear.DJ on the 2nd and 3rd floors to win the luck read by Lee Dong-jin. The schedule can be found on the official Red Bookstore blog.
‘이동진, a book I wrote’
Only sell limited edition! Your mind
Independent Publishing. This may be unfamiliar but good for people who like writing and for those who are thirsty for new books. Independent publications are books that are held in someone's arms through the help of one person from content creation to publication and distribution. Most of them are published at their own expense and do not have many copies. Instead, the preciousness doubles because it is a hard-to-find book. There are some books that aren't released, so it's like a limited edition.
Your Mind mascot cat, Morro, sitting on a stand
Your Mind is a bookstore that distributes these independent publications. Unlike other bookstores on the first floor, it is unique because it is easily accessible to people. Even without an elevator, you have to go through hard times. Instead, you will be lucky to meet a book full of author's devotion.
Your mind feels like attic
The height of the floor is quite high, but the interior, which is designed like an attic, a bookshelf, a small stand, and a desk, is warm like my library. It's warmer because there are cats sitting on the cushions in front of the bar, picking their hairs and nodding them. Independent bookstores are as different from their uniform counterparts as their production. From handbook-sized pamphlets to thin magazines that are published occasionally, their shapes, designs, and content vary. So the fun is more diverse.
Books are placed around like a desk at home
The owner is a couple addicted to independent publications. Before becoming a bookstore owner, he is a veteran producer who publishes writing, photographs, and designs by himself, including the award-winning magazine "M". Various workshops are held to lower entry barriers for those who like to write their own books.
Visitors looking at books for a long time
If you want to know more about independent publications, you can participate in the annual Unlimited Edition. You can meet independent publishers and producers who have a sense of distance from general promotion through the 'Direct Sales Booth'.
Grooming cutie cat

item.title: Gangbuk-gu, Seoul, Korea - Happy forest path for the whole family to walk together
item.description:
Anti-tank obstacle

Happy forest path for the whole family to walk together

Gangbuk-gu, Seoul, Korea

Uiyeong-gil in Bukhansan is a good way for the whole family to walk together. It is a mountain path, but the road is wide so you can walk with your shoulders. There are no steep or steep sections, so children walk well. In the autumn and solstice, the scent of the forest scents, and when you walk on Uyi-Ring, laughter blooms in your family's face.

1.8 km from Uyi-dong to Ui Tam Prevention Center

Wuyiling Road is 6.8km in total. Among them, about 4.5km from Bui Mountain National Park Ui Tam Prevention Center to Gyohyeon Tam Prevention Center in earnest. Get off at the entrance of Doseonsa Temple and walk about 1.8km from Ui-dong Food Village to Ui-dong Food Service Center.

'Ui-dong Food Village' signboard at Ui-dong, Ui-yeong-gil
The area around the signboard of Ui-dong Food Village is untidy. Follow the road through the signboard, and there are many restaurants on both sides of the road. It's not a good place to walk. Especially on weekends, there are many cars that people who use restaurants can ride. This section is about 1.3 km long. Also, this section is an uphill road, so some people struggle from the beginning before walking in earnest.
Uiyeong-gil through Ui-dong Food Village
However, if you take this inconvenience and walk up 1.3km, the road that the vehicle cannot enter is started. If you go up this road about 500m, you will come to Bukhansan National Park Ui Tam Prevention Center. It is about 1.5km from here to Uyi-Ryeong Trail, which is easier than the road that has been walked up until now.
Bukhansan National Park Ui Tam Prevention Center
4.5 km from Wuyi Tombs Center
Uyiyeong-gil is named after the rock “Uiam” which resembles the ear of a cow. But Wuaiam is not visible in Wuyiling Road. Wooiam is on the Wuyi ridge which leads to the main peak of Dobongsan Mountain.
Ui-Ryeong-gil is a path between the listed ridge line and Songchu Nam-nam line, connecting Jangheung-myeon, Yangju-si, Gyeonggi-do and Ui-dong, Gangbuk-gu, Seoul. It was a shortcut between Seoul and northern Gyeonggi. In the past, the wagon was a narrow road, and during the Korean War, the US Army Corps of Engineers paved the way for military operations. There is a monument to the opening of the operation road on the hillside of Uyiling.
A small sign for walking barefoot
On January 21, 1968, following the so-called January 21 incident, when North Korean armed forces invaded the Blue House, military forces and combat police were stationed in 1969 to control civilian access. Since 2009, civilians have been allowed to enter the city, but only 1,000 people per day should be restricted and reservations must be made.
People walking barefoot on the road
Departure from Uytam Prevention Center starts full-scale forest road. The road is made of Masato made from weathered granite. On the side of the road, you can see a short sign called ‘Uyi-Ring Forest that feels barefoot.’ But as I walked this road, I saw only one or two people walking barefoot. Because it is not a soft soil like ocher but rough soil, people who are not used to walking barefoot or have weak skin on their feet can wear shoes again even if they walk barefoot.
Beetle anesthetic flowers bloom on the side of the road
Light purple hummingbird flowers bloom on the wide dirt road in the forest. Yellow flowers that you may not know are visible everywhere. Green forests surround the road. Children unfamiliar with the forest trails are initially hardened by the humming bees and beetles, but adapt quickly. The slope runs up a gentle uphill and then comes back.
Wuyiling Road can walk with its shoulders
Arrived at the Hui-Ring Trough. It is 1.5km from Wuyi Tam Prevention Center. The hillside remains an anti-tank obstacle, a military facility that drops a lump of concrete on the pedestal to the road to prevent enemy tanks from entering. From this place, it is going downhill to the Gyohyeon RDA. As you pass the antitank obstacles, you will see an observation deck overlooking Obong. One of the most beautiful landscapes you can see from Ouiyeong-gil is Obong.
Family steps walking lightly
Obon refers to five rocky peaks. Five bachelors who lived in a village competed to throw the rock of the listed ridge (the ridge facing Obong) into Obong to marry his beautiful daughter.
Milestones of Uyi-Ring Trough
The children also admired the landscape, “Wow look over there!” Points to the five rock peaks. From Obon Observation Deck, crouch down with water and walk down the road again.
Observation deck overlooking Obon
Children look more energetic than when they come up. Running through a wide dirt road, you can see the valley water flowing along the side of the road and look up to the blue sky. The children, who are in love with computers and smartphones, make a blue smile that resembles a forest in the fresh nature. The faces of parents who see such children are also bright.
Obon, where five rock peaks are spectacular
I walked to the Gyohyeon RDA. Ui-yeong-gil, the whole family walked together, laughter bloomed on the forest road.
Valley water flowing sideways

To walk on the road

( www.knps.or.kr )

You must make a reservation. Reservations by phone are only available for people over 65 years old and disabled and foreigners 1,000 people will be booked per day (500 people from Ui-dong and 500 people from Yangju). Wuyiling Road is open from 9:00 am to 2:00 pm and must descend by 4 pm. All passengers and companions must bring identification when using Uyi-Ryeong-gil.

Wuyiling Road through Green Forest Road
Sansa, Seokguram, hiding in Uiyeong-gil
If you go down about 1km toward the Gyohyeon Rural Guard Center from Uiyeong Trail, you will see a large vacant lot. From there, the path to the cave begins.
Road to Gyohyeon Detection Center
It is about 700 ~ 800m from the large glade to the cave. After looking around Seokguram Rock, come back and go down to Gyohyeon Rural Prevention Center.
Seokguram Rock Order
Seokgulam was founded as a costume ambassador of the Silla period, and it is said that Seolam Gwanik ambassador was heavy during the Joseon Sejong period. Although it was bombed during the Korean War, it faced a mortality crisis, but from 1954, it has been developing new features of Seokguram Grotto, including expanding the cave and building the Daeungjeon.
Grottoes
The temple is small and catches a glance. One of the most fascinating is Nahanjeon, which was built in a natural rock cave. Next to Nahanjeon, there is a staircase going up the Samsung angle. Stand up in front of Samsung Pavilion and look at the scenery in the distance. It is pleasant to see the scenery that does not obscure the view.
Three story stone tower in front of Seokguram Samsung
Travel info

item.title: Paju, Gyeonggi-do, Korea - In Camp Greaves, I'm a descendant of the sun!
item.description:
Camp Greaves Youth Hostel

In Camp Greaves, I'm a descendant of the sun!

Paju, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

`` The Descendants of the Sun, '' a drama that heats up 2016. At the same time, Songsong Couple has taken away people's hearts, and the filming location is also a hot topic. One of them is Camp Greaves, which is located in the DMZ like a military drama. As it is pre-production drama, set is demolished and remains, but how about still? If you see a little familiar spot like Deja vu along Song Joong-gi's hand, you can do it anywhere!
Camp Greaves, troops that saved Ryan
If you are a fan of war movies or dramas, there is a place that will open your eyes and interest you. The 506th Regiment was the main character of the American drama Band of Brothers, and the hero of Ryan, the hero of the movie "Saving Private Ryan," which featured World War II. They are Camp Greaves stationed in Korea.
The familiar Urk base, which occupies most of the 'sun descendants' background, is one of the oldest US military bases where the 2nd Division 506th Infantry Battalion, which remained after the Korean War Armistice Agreement, returned to it in August 2007. At present, the appearance of the military forces is so high that it might be a job for Captain Yu Si-jin.
Entrance to Camp Greaves
Camp Greaves is just 2 km from the southern limit of the demilitarized zone (DMZ), a demilitarized zone designed to prevent clashes between the two Koreas. The military withdrew in 2004, but the trace remains intact and tells the story. On the land of more than 200,000 square meters, various facilities such as the repair shop where Song Joong-gi performed great action through the fighting scene with the US military in the `` Descendants of the Sun '', officers' accommodations, dormitories and gymnasiums are preserved as they are. It is worth it.
Unit mark with salute relief.
Despite sufficient cultural value, Camp Greaves, which was in danger of being demolished, was transformed into a peace and security experience facility for civilians after the efforts of Paju, Gyeonggi-do. In addition to various experiences such as security tourism and DMZ ecological experience, the first youth hostel that can spend the night in the civilian access control line (civil communication line) came to us.
Gymnasiums used for various events such as film festivals
Army? Youth hostel?
To visit Camp Greaves, you must first apply to the military. The excitement in front of the open Unification Bridge is thrilled with the countless varieties of barricades and the captured soldiers who thoroughly check their IDs. The bare-hearted mind falls down in front of the entrance to the Camp Greaves barbed wire, which is like a military unit with the words 'No entry'.
Confusingly similar to military units
The youth hostel, remodeled from a quarter of US military officers' quarters, is designed to accommodate up to 240 people. There are offices and small auditoriums on the first floor, quarters on the second and third floors, and auditoriums and restaurants for indoor activities on the fourth floor. If you encounter three kinds of set, you will be enlightened by the fact that you can see the military quarters, lodging that is reminiscent of the army quarters, meals that are used by the military, and Nara Love Concert, a music concert enjoyed by security officers of the 1st Division.
Meal too!
It does not have training facilities such as physical training, but welcomes those who seek unique security experiences using the uniqueness of the civilian line. DMZ 1129 is a mandatory field trip program for the day, two nights, two nights, and three nights.It explores nearby attractions such as the 3rd Tunnel, Dora Observatory, Dorasan Station, and Dorasan Peace Park to solve special tasks in the workbook That's the way. The program, which means 1129 days of long war, is popular because it can naturally learn about the DMZ and the reality of the current division between North and South.
Daesung High School students visiting the DMZ exhibition hall
In addition, in order to satisfy the tastes of various participants from elementary school students to high school students, various programs such as security OX games, unification, mini-jangseung, or soot-making, express warrior selection, camp play yard, and challenging DMZ Golden Bell are prepared.
Daesung High School students are taking group photos
At the end of the event, the Peace Prayer Ribbon, which was written by a young student, was written in a single letter.
Students in the Strategic Domino Program
In addition to the experience program, Camp Greaves will also meet with outsiders in various ways, including using the gym as an event venue for the opening ceremony of the DMZ International Documentary Film Festival. It is more precious and meaningful only because you can experience the only site DMZ that contains the pain of division. Isn't the time to raise the desire for unification through Camp Greaves be the key to our unification?
The wishes of the participants who pushed on 'unification of the two Koreas' are conveyed in their hearts.
Travel info

item.title: Taean-gun, South Korea - Flower path to the sea, Taean Cheongpodae Caravan Village
item.description:
Caravan camping grounds with a view of Cheongpodae Beach

Flower path to the sea, Taean Cheongpodae Caravan Village

Taean-gun, South Korea

The heyday of Korean camping is still ongoing. But for beginners it's hard to find a lot of camping gear. Of course, it is not easy to care about the economic burden and learn how to use it. Camping is a taste of equipment, but I don't want to do that. . Then the alternative is caravans! Camping atmosphere to the fullest, more comfortable than my home base, there is a great view of the West Sea and upscale trails! Cheongpodae Caravan Village is such a place.
I'm from the original caravan of mic ~
Taean Cheongpodae Beach is very accessible from Chungcheong area, Seoul, metropolitan area and Jeolla Province. Two hours will be enough if you avoid routine stoppages like weekend mornings
Meet a group of caravan troops in the middle of a small Cheongpodae beach. Today's base camp! Cheongpodae Caravan Village.
Cheongpodae Caravan Village
Cheongpodae Caravan Village overlooks the vast West Sea in the future and leans back to the pine forest. The campsite, run by a young broken woman, has eight caravans. They are all from the waters of the caravan's original country of `` Mikuk ''.
Caravan Village Entrance
Maid in USA inscribed with a yellow lacquer on the bumper guarantees this. That little paint pride. He is not made in China but Mije. In those days, Made in USA was synonymous with luxury goods. It's been a while since I met you. 'Nice to meet you!'
View from the inside of the caravan
Cheongpodae Caravan Village's most prominent feature is its 'large'. A total of eight caravans are big at a glance. "Others are for 4-6 people, but we operate for couples." The owner's explanation. Smart! Try to get inside. 'Isn't it a caravan?' The prominent courtesy misses nicely. In addition to the double-bed queen size bedroom, the kitchen, living room and bathroom have a shower booth. Eight caravan interiors also vary. The caravan is an experience product, so the differentiation strategy is to have a different feeling every time it comes.
Cheongpodae Caravan Village
We didn't come to see the house, but delay the caravan admiration in the evening and go out to the sea in front of you! As soon as you exit the entrance guarded by the giant Indian dolls, the white sandy beach of Cheongpodae Beach begins. After passing the small windbreak forest, it is Cheongpodae Beach.
Bunk beds for children
Best sea promenade
The ocean is right in front of the caravan, so you can measure the temperature of the West Sea with your big toe in less than a minute, but it's not fun. I decided to eat some of the main dishes, then eat appetizers first.
Flower path to Cheongpodae Beach
Go up 300m to the right from the entrance of Cheongpodae Caravan Village and you will find many nice pensions with views of the sea. In front of the pension, there is a beautiful flower garden on the white sand beach.
Flower path to Cheongpodae Beach
The flower paths that seem to come out of fairy tales unfold in the background of the sea. Especially, yellow wildflowers forming a colony attract visitors.
Cheongpodae Beach Boardwalk
The flower path of seduction leads to the sea, and the seaside road parallel to the West Sea provides a nice walk for Cheongpodae visitors. Walking slowly down the Cheongpodae beach with the cool sea breeze, I can see that the campsite owner said, "There are 34 beaches in Taean. In fact, the caravan business has been fascinated by the charm of Cheongpodae.
Cheongpodae where you can enjoy the quiet beach
Cheongpodae Beach is small and still free. Since the peak season, there are plenty of spaces at the auto camping ground and the beach is just enough to take you to the sea.
Cheongpodae where you can enjoy the quiet beach
On one of the sandy beaches, children riding four-wheeled motorcycles became gods. At night, it also turns into a rustic fireworks display.
Cheongpodae
It is downtown of Cheongpodae off the sandy beach. There are several food trucks in the small vacant lot, and another caravan colony with the beach back. The Stream of Maison transforms the caravan into a small beer firm and a small stage. But accommodation is not possible.
You can ride a four-wheeled motorcycle on the beach
Caravan's Magic
The pride of the West Sea is the wide tidal flat. Water drains on the beach, revealing a wide tidal flat. Since it is a tidal flat of a tourist spot, it is different from the real tidal flat of Namdo, but it is popular among children.
Tidal Flats
If you catch small shellfish, you do not know how to go and squat on the mud flat and become one with the sea.
The harvest isn't good, but the children are immersed in the tidal-flat experience.
Another attraction of the West Sea is a nice sunset. When the weather is clear, red sunsets moisten the sea water more than Hongsi. If there is a lot of clouds, you will continue to stare at the horizon of the West Sea, where the sun is falling to the wide horizon.
The harvest isn't good, but the children are immersed in the tidal-flat experience.
The darkness lies on Cheongpodae Beach, where the sun is hidden. A softly lit caravan and a dad or boyfriend in front of the grill produce the typical mise en scene.
The night came to the caravan camping ground.
Finally camping flowers, barbecue time! The advantage of barbecues is that any food can be reborn as the best food when sizzling on fire. However, you should eat quickly before the food cools off and before the smell goes away.
Campsite night
After dinner, go inside. The children are already on the caravan bunk bed. The sofa in the living room opens up into a nice bed. I saved my sleeping bag and lantern from the main island. Take a cool shower, take a canned beer from the fridge, and watch a drama on your HDTV. All of them are caravans.
"Are you all done?" Camping Flower! Barbecue

item.title: Changnyeong-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea - Exploring the Beautiful Cultural Heritage of Changnyeong
item.description:
Gyodong Tombs

Exploring the Beautiful Cultural Heritage of Changnyeong

Changnyeong-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea

Changnyeong reminds me of Upo Swamp first. However, if the only thing that comes to mind is Upo Wetland, we will underestimate Changnyeong. Changnyeong is the place where Bihwagaya, one of the Gaya nations, gained power. It was also the hometown where King Jin-ra, the King of Silla, declared the land of Shilla after subjugating Gaya. There are vast historical remains from the Gaya era to the Joseon dynasty, and you can find precious cultural heritages, including two national treasures and four treasures.
Non-professional with the history of Gaya
If you go out to Changnyeong IC on Buinland Expressway, Mt. Hwangwang stands out from the wide open Changnyeong-eup. In the Three Kingdoms era, it was called non-military army and Hwawang-gun. Changnyeong, based on the Visage Army of the Three Kingdoms Period, is called Bisabeul, meaning “red field.”
National Treasure No. 34
Bisabul is a place where Bhagagaya, a small country of Gaya, gained power. Gyodong Tombs and Songhyeon-dong Tombs, considered to be the traces of Bihwagaya, including the Jinheung Royal Guards, established by the King of Silla Jinheung and established in the land, the Sulwha-dong East-West Three-stone Pagoda, Yinyangsa-joseongbi, Songhyeon-dong The Changnyeong Seokbingo and Changnyeong Hyanggyo are scattered around the town.
Treasure No. 520 Liquor Tower
It is good to meet cultural heritage one by one, but it is also recommended to walk the 'Jungheung Wanghaengcha-gil' and 'Songhyuni-gil', which are built around the cultural heritage of Changnyeong-eup. The Jinheung Wanghaeng-gil road is centered on the Jinheung Wangcheok Guard and the distance of travel is about 7km. Songhyeon Yi-gil is a way to get into the story of a Gaya girl 1,500 years ago, the owner of Sunjang Ingol, excavated at Songhyeon-dong Tombs. It was discovered in Song Hyun-ri, so the girl was given the name 'Song Hyun-i', and Gil followed the name. Songhyeon Lee's moving distance is about 4 km. Although the two roads overlap each other, it is perfect for enjoying cultural heritage exploration while walking in the small town of Changnyeong.
Treasure No. 310 Changnyeong Seokbingo
The Jinheung Wanghaeng-gil departs from Changnyeong Museum to Manokjeong Park with the Jinheung Royal Scenic Guard, Changnyeong Seokbingo, and Suljeong-ri High Pass, Suljeong-ri East and West Three-story Stone Pagoda, Orthogonal Dangji Branch, Seongsa-sa Temple Monument, Sajik, Mandeokji, and Changnyeong Hyanggyo. Songhyeon Yi-gil is a course that takes you back to Gyodong Tombs and Changnyeong Museums from Changnyeong Museum through Gyodong, Songhyeon-dong Mounds, Songhyeon-dong, Maae Yeosang Statue, Jinheung Wangcheok Guard, Changnyeong Seokbingo, and Changnyeong Hyanggyo.
Treasure No. 227 Salvation History
Meet beautiful cultural heritage that shines Changnyeong
The first to meet on the way from Changnyeong IC to Changnyeongeup is Seojeongli Seoseom Pagoda. It is good to look around compared with each other in the Suljeolli East Three-storied Pagoda, which is less than 1km away.
Remains of the old temple around the Three-story Stone Pagoda
The two three-storied pagoda is divided into the east and the west of the Sulgori. Both are stone pagodas of the Unified Silla period, but they differ in many ways. The East Three-storied Pagoda is designated National Treasure No. 34, and the West Three-storied Pagoda is Treasure No. 520. The Dongsam Three-storied pagoda is a bit large, and the form and appearance of the pagoda are generally similar. The Dongsam Three-storied Pagoda has a sense of stability, sharp lines, and refined feeling. In comparison, the West Three-storied pagoda is a bit slender, and the lines are blunt and soft. West Three Storey Stone Pagoda can be met by following a narrow road to Namjung Park, while the East Three Storey Stone Pagoda is easy to find Changnyeong Public Market.
Seojeongseom Seoryon Stone Tower
When you exit Changnyeong Permanent Market and turn right along Myeongdeok-ro, you will meet Changnyeong Seok Bingo, a masterpiece of Joseon Dynasty. Seokbingo is an ice warehouse that was built during the Joseon Dynasty. The movie 'Gone with the Wind,' starring Cha Tae-hyun, which was released in 2012, was based on Servingo, a stone ice bin of Hanyang in the Joseon Dynasty. Seokbingo is also located in Gyeongju, Andong, Qingdao, and Dalseong. There are two Seokbingo in Changnyeong-eup and Yeongsan-myeon. Changnyeong Seokbingo was designated Treasure No. 310.
A monument engraved with records about Changnyeong Seokbingo
Yinyangsajoseongbi (Treasure No. 227) near Samjin Apartment near the entrance to Changnyeong-gun Office, and Songhyeon-dong Mae Ehagae statue (Treasure No. 75) near Changhwa Temple at the entrance of Songhyeon-dong Tomb are also to be seen in Changnyeong-eup. It is a valuable cultural heritage.
Monk's face carved into salvage
Trace of the secretary and the sun-drenched girl
National highway No. 20, which runs through the town of Changnyeong, crosses the Qingdao to the north and the Nakdong River to the south, leading to the Rural Land. Gyodong Tombs are located near the national road from Cheongdo to Cheongdo and Songhyeondong Tombs are near Changhwasa at the entrance of Hwawangsan County Park. Two burial mounds were grouped together and designated Historic Site No. 514. Gyodong and Songhyeon-dong burial mounds were formed in the 5th and 6th centuries, and are traces of the non-gagaya who developed their forces around the non-professionals. According to Samguk-yusa, built by the Goryeo Dynasty, non-gagaya was included in the 5-gaya along with the Gwan-gwan-gaya, the elderly, the Aragaya, and the Seongsan-gaya.
Gyodong and Songhyeon-dong burial mounds formed over 150 mounds before the Japanese colonial rule. Excavations were made in 1918, during the Japanese colonial rule, when a huge relic was excavated. However, most of the artifacts were taken to Japan, and tombs were thoroughly destroyed.
Travelers walking in Gyodong Tombs
In Songhyeon-dong burial mounds, there were traces of sunjang 1,500 years ago. In the burial mound, only traces of grave robbers remained, and when they were removed, four bones were found along with various ornaments and earthenware. The first one, which remains intact, has been restored by a team of experts in archeology, forensics, anatomy, and formative arts. The name given to this Sunjang girl is ‘송현 이’.
Tomb Creation Diorama of Changnyeong Museum
The traces of Bihwagaya remain intact at the Changnyeong Museum. Various relics excavated from Gyo-dong and Songhyeon-dong tombs, as well as restoration materials of Sunjang Ingol are also displayed. Outside the museum, there is an exhibition hall that relocates and restores Gyeseong burial mounds discovered near Gwanryongsa.
Changnyeong Museum Exhibition Space
Gyodong Tombs and Songhyeon-dong Tombs are quite good trails. As you walk along the towering tombs, the surrounding scenery changes every moment. The scenery is as beautiful as the Jisan-dong Tomb of the elderly in Gyeongbuk.
Jinheung Royal Guards Monument in Manokjeong Park
Jinheung King is the king who expanded the territory of the Silla era the most. As he pioneered the territory, the pure rains that he set up in each region remain in Mt. Bukhan, Maun-ryeong, Hwangcho-ryeong, and in Changnyeong, there is a guard for Jinheung Wangcheok. Chuck Kyung-bi refers to the rain that was made in commemoration of public sentiment by patrolling the land after King Jinheung pioneered the territory. Another pure rain built in the Jinheung Wangdae has a title of 'Pure Water Pavilion (巡狩 管 境)'. It is a monument that was built after the king patrolled by the king, and the list of the servants who performed the king is engraved. Whether it is a steal guard or a pure expense, it is clear that this is evidence of the expansion of King Chin's territory.
Jinheung Royal Spine Guard
If you go to Manokjeong Park, about 400 meters from Changnyeong Seokbingo, you can meet Jinheung Royal Guard. A student who had a picnic near Mt. Masan fortress at the foot of Mt. Hwangwang during the Japanese colonial rule discovered it and found it to be a stone monument of Silla and moved to its present location in 1924. In Manokjeong Park, there is also a selection fee for Chosonhwabi, which was built during Heungseondaewon-gun, and the three-storied pagoda of Tokcheon-ri, Changnyeongsa, and officials of Joseon dynasty who passed through Changnyeong.
Chuckhwa Monument, built during Heungseondaewon

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - “Where is the delicious vegetarian diet?” An omnivorous vegetarian restaurant experience
item.description:
Bad Farmers Cleanse Juice and Salad

“Where is the delicious vegetarian diet?” An omnivorous vegetarian restaurant experience

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

It is natural that modern people who have a great interest in health are worried about food. I know that 'what you eat' determines your body, but it's not as easy as you think to eat 'healthy food'. So prepared. Enjoy a Healing Vegetarian Trip in Seoul! Hongdae & Sinchon, a street where young people live in diverse cultures, Jongno & Insa-dong where temple restaurants are gathered, and Detox juice and salad specialty shops. Start with a vegetarian restaurant that is healthy and delicious!
Confess before starting the article. The reporter is an omnivorous man who is close to carnivorous, sharing a strong friendship with his flesh. Those who have been accustomed to the taste of chewing without caring about vegetarianism or sharing vegetarianism. This does not mean unusually looking for meat. Ordinarily, to put it plainly, I have eaten as soon as it is unbalanced. Paradoxically, this part is easier to understand by flipping the vegetarian tale of “There is no restaurant to eat.” That's because there aren't many restaurants in the land where vegetarians can eat comfortably.
Vegetarian, what is it?
Let's get to know here. For those who are indifferent to vegetarianism, 'vegetarians' are just people who eat grass without eating meat, but the type of 'vegetarian' is more subtle than you think. First, depending on whether you eat fish and seafood ‘Vegetarian’ 과 ‘Semi Vegetarian’ Divided into Vegetarian Is vegan Vegan Allowed only, milk and dairy products Lacto Allowed only eggs Ovo , Eggs, milk, dairy products Lacto Ovo Belongs. All of them do not eat meat, fish and seafood.
'Semi-vegetarian', which allows fish and seafood, eats milk, brown, fish and algae except red meat. Polo And milk, brown and fish Pesco And usually vegan, but depending on the circumstances Flexitarian Divided into Nowadays, more and more people are choosing 'vegetarian' as their practice for personal health and environmental protection.
Hongdae & Sinchon

There are some vegetarian restaurants in Hongdae, the “diversity special zone” as “the liberation zone of youth.” The atmosphere is different from that of Jongno & Insa-dong. Is it cafe which can serve meal? You can enjoy the brown rice health specialty restaurant Slobi, located near Exit 9 of Hongik Univ. I looked at <Jack's Bean>.

First, Sloby is the closest to Hongik University Station. At that time, the table is the most popular. We serve simple house rice with soup and some side dishes. It is popular as a dining place for those who aim for 'vegetarian' and 'healthy'.
Inside the sloppy
The Monday meal, which can be tasted only on Mondays, is only available as a vegetarian. At that time, he will show him a meal table (8000 won), assorted mushroom rice bowls (8000 won), fire (thong) meat bowl (8000 won), and then curry (8000 won).
Hongdae Café Slobby's most popular menu “Then That Time”
Vegetarians and non-vegetarians can "healthy eat" together.
Mushroom bowl of Slobby which is popular among modern people who want healthy food
Next is Sukara, located on the first floor of the Sanwoolim Small Theater in front of Hongdae. A new world unfolds with the menu board. In addition to the main dishes, desserts such as cakes, drinks and ice cream are also available for vegans. For those who don't eat milk, they also have soy milk drinks, a variety of fruit juices, tea, decaffeinated coffee, and organic wines.
Inside Sukhara, located on the 1st floor of Sanwoolim Small Theater
Of course, not only drinks, but also a la carte dishes such as meals and snacks are also available. Homemade natural yeast bread (5,000 won) for vegan, natural yeast bread and brown rice soup plate (12,000 won), Shinan village for fermented vegetarian cheeses (11,000 won), seasonal vegetable vegetables whole wheat pasta (12,000 won) and butter chicken curry (11,000 won) are also available. All menu items are available except cheese omelets, wholemeal pasta, and today's menus (12: 00-15: 00, 17: 30-20: 00).
Tofu Cheese Cake
Healthy desserts such as summer fruit cakes, amaretto ice cream (7500 won), tofu cheesecake (6,000 won), and homemade yogurt parfait (7500 won) are also available.
Homemade Yogurt Parfait
Not far from the Sanwoolim Theater, there is a falafel specialty store called Jaxbin.
Falafel Platter
In Korea, chickpeas, which are not grown, are called `` Falafel '' by grinding garlic, onions, and parsley into round pieces. When you cut the crispy outside, you will find a fresh skin that tastes like croquette. There is no meat, but it seems to eat meat.
Middle Eastern Sauce with Olive Oil, Garlic, Hummus
The flavor is revived by grinding chickpea with ‘pallafel’ and adding hummus, a sauce from the Middle East with olive oil and garlic.
Hollow Bread without Additives, Pita
When ordering a menu, say “Vegan” and cook it. Falafel wrap (6500 won), falafel sandwich (4800 won), falafel salad (6500 won), hummus (4500 won), falafel platter (15,800 won).
Bean dish with chickpeas and cheese
Ah, Slunch Factory near Sangsu Station and Loving Hut in Sinchon are also vegetarian restaurants near Hongdae.
Sandwiches made with palafel and salad in pita
Insadong & Jongno next to Jogyesa Temple… From temple food shops to simple vegetarian shops
There are a lot of specialty restaurants around Jongno & Insa-dong, where Jogyesa Temple is located. Temple food, commonly referred to as “zebap,” is literally their food. According to the Buddhist doctrine that prohibits 'killing', it has a natural vegetarian diet and tastes without coming (green onions, garlic, soothe, leek, red cherries). The taste of modern man, who is domesticated by various seasonings and seasonings, is boring to the mouth, but after eating, many people find it comfortable and healthy. Hongger is a plant that is not available in Korea and bans onions in Korea.
Wood bean soup at temple specialty shop <Bow Gongyang>
In the area around Jogyesa Temple, there are vegetarian restaurants such as <Gallery> and <Bow Gong Gong>, where temple food is served as a course. Of course, there are also (relatively) inexpensive menus that can be enjoyed on weekday lunchtimes.
Sacheol Rejuvenation Bath at the temple specialty shop <Bow Gongyang>
In Gosang, you can taste buckwheat miso rice bowl (15,000 won), balwoo (19000 won, perilla sesame tofu and mushroom gangjeong), and offerings (29,000 won, burdock vegetables, sodam soybean, mushroom hotpot). . In Bawong Gongyang, which offers course dishes, you can enjoy lunch specials such as lotus leaf rice set meal (12,000 won) from 1:00 on weekdays.
Mushroom Gangjeong showed that vegetarian food is also delicious
In Kwagane Food, located in Tongin Market, just a short distance from Insa-dong, there will be regular foods such as Ssambap (12,000 won) and Ginseng Pork Bulgogi (9500 won). In Five World Flavors, you can enjoy vegetarian noodles (5500 won), plum sweet and sour pork (15,000 won), and bean cutlet (11,000 won).
Meal of <Bowoo Gongyang> course, lotus leaf rice and modern miso soup
The victory of Jogyesa Temple is also known among Shinto people. You can enjoy feast, bibimb noodles, and seaweed soup (4000 won) at a reasonable price. In temples, noodles are called seung seung. This means that the noodles are delicious enough to make the monk laugh.
Lotus leaf rice with fragrant lotus leaf scent
Have you heard of? Juice Cleanse Cleanses My Body
Finally, we introduce 'Klen's Juice', which excludes even the chewing taste. It is a popular detox diet that cleans the body with detox juice, which removes toxic substances from the body. The practice is to replace meals with juices squeezed with only vegetables and vegetables instead of rice. Juices made up of only vegetable and fruit juices taste better than you think. Depending on their physical condition, detox juices can be taken from 1 day to 2 weeks in length. It's gaining celebrity thanks to the stars who have seen dramatic diet effects with the Juice Cleanse program.
A variety of juices from Detox juice shop Energy Kitchen
There are specialized Klens juice bars in Gangnam area such as Bad Farmers and Energy Kitchen on Sinsa-dong Garosu-gil. Juice prices vary slightly depending on the ingredients, but are higher than franchise coffee shops. The idea of juice instead of rice would be filled with the juice name 'Sorry, my body' and 'Well you're good to live' disappeared. I just laughed and was so sorry to end.
Bad Farmers Cleanse Juice and Health Bar

item.title: Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea - Spring in the Forest and History, Seosan Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest
item.description:
Children learning nature at Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest

Spring in the Forest and History, Seosan Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest

Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea

I want to see the spring of trees and grassy forest. Enter the Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest next to the valley of Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do. The sound of water in Yonghyeon Valley flowing with the melting of ice and wild flowers reaching out over the fallen leaves announce spring. On the road to the recreation forest, you can also see the history of Baekje era.
Nature to learn by the five senses
Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest is located in the Gaya Mountains of Chungcheongnam-do. Gayasan 678m above sea level is a famous mountain in Chungcheongnam-do and is famous for retaining various cultural remains of the Baekje era. It was called Sangwangsan at that time, and it was named Gayasan in the Unification Silla era, when it set up Gayasa under the mountain. Although it is not a high mountain, many peaks, such as Gayabong, Seokmunbong, Okyangbong, and Jungbongbong, form the ridge, and the Yonghyeon Valley flows between the valleys. The valley, which is about 5 km long, is plentiful and the surrounding forests are dense and many people visit. Yonghyeon Valley is designated as a large national forest. Thanks to the forests and valleys that consist only of natural forests, the ecosystem is highly preserved. Natural monument No. 452 Golden Bat was found, and endangered species such as crayfish and fireflies are inhabited.
Yonsei-dong accommodation in Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest
The recreational forest has a variety of forest experience programs. Forest commentary, early childhood forest experience, forest school, forest healing five senses experience, and interior culture forest road trip. It runs from March to November every year, and anyone who wants to participate as well as recreational forest visitors can participate. Forest commentary starts at 10 am and 2 pm daily, and takes about 2 hours. Other programs are available after contacting the information office.
Forest Experience Center in Recreation Forest
In the woodworking room, which is located next to the management office, the living woodworking classroom is operated. Participation is possible after advance booking at 10am and 3pm. You can make small crafts with natural materials such as wood and stones.
Small crafts that can be experienced directly in the woodworking room
Accommodations in recreation forests include forest houses, coal alleys, and forest culture and recreation centers. There are also camping sites with 25 camping decks, 5 of which are the only loess thermal decks in Korea. The ocher thermal deck is made by laying ocher on the floor of a camping site to collect the heat in the middle of the day and catch the warmth for a long time. It's not as warm as installing an electric blanket, but you can feel the warmth, not the coldness of the bottom.
Ocher thermal deck campsite
When you visit here for camping, be careful of the hard floor, so you may have difficulty using the tent pack and the deck area is 3 × 3m. It's a good idea to get a rope to hold your tent in, and prepare a small to medium size tent for your floor space.
Ocher deck floor
Spring trails along forest trails and mountain trails
Various forest trails cross the Yonghyeon Valley, where the recreation forest is located. In the vicinity of the recreational forest, there is an ecological trail, a forest interpretation course, and a forest trail. In the distance, a hiking trail that leads to Mt. Naepo Culture Forest Road and Seosan Arame-gil can also pass near the recreational forest.
The ecological trail is a recreational forest path through the forest classroom, forest school, and forest experience field. The 500m side of the valley is decorated with bare foot paths. If you want to walk a little longer, a forest trail of about 3km is a good option. It is a path that leads to a wooden staircase through a wooden bridge installed on Yonghyeon Valley. Not walking long from the wooden bridge, she arrives in a forest resting place with several wooden chairs. Above it, you can see the four sides of the valley, which controls the level of the valley. Suriba is a rock with a strange shape formed at the top of the mountain. It is named after a pair of owls. May-July is the Owl's spawning season, so be careful not to make a fuss when you pass.
Forest trail starts in recreational forest
Naepo Culture Forest Trail is a walking path created along the remains of cultural relics throughout Seosan, Dangjin, Hongseong, and Yesan-gun. So far, it is the longest trekking course in Chungcheongnam-do. Among them, the section covering the recreational forest is one or two courses. It is one course that leads to Gaesimsa through the Recreational Forest Observation Deck. The two roads lead to Okyangbong along the Naepo Culture Forest Trail.
Naepo Culture Forest Trail through Suriba
Seosan Arame-gil is an eco-friendly trekking course created by Seosan. '아라' refers to the sea, and 'Me' refers to the mountain, which is a way that reflects the natural characteristics of Seosan that encompasses the sea and the mountain. A total of seven sections were created around attractions around Seosan. Not all courses are connected so it is good to walk for each section. Courses with recreational forests are divided into sections 1 and 1-1, which include five tourist attractions, including the Mae Ae Samseon Statue and Gaesimsa Temple.
Maa Eae Sansam Statue
Another historic site in spring
The Maae Yeo Samsam Statue, the second Gyeongsang Seogyeong, was designated as National Treasure No. 84 by the late Baekje. It is located about 3km away from Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest in the direction of Seoul along Yonghyeon Valley. If you go up the stairs about 300m from the valley, you will see the station and the entrance, and if you go up a little more, you can face the three-phase statue carved on the rock. In the center, there are statues of Buddha statues, Bodhisattva statues on the left, and Bangasa statues on the right. The face of Buddha is very gentle, but the smile looks different depending on the direction of light. The delicate sculpture of the Baekje era can be seen from the hem and sagging folds across the shoulders.
Mae Ae Samseon statue with delicate sculpture
Bowonsaji Temple, which was a Baekje era temple, is 2km away from Maaerae Samjon.
Borwonjiji Temple Holdings (Treasure No. 103)
Relics, stone temples, and five-storied pagoda, believed to have been built around the 10th century, are designated and protected as national treasures. In 1968, Baekje and Unification Silla era statues were found together.
Bowonsaji Five-storied Stone Tower (Treasure No. 104)
When you cross the Bowonsaji Temple, the trail to Gaesimsa begins. Walking along this road takes about 1.2 km to the entrance to the reconciliation gate and about 16 km to take the car.
Open review
Gaesimsa, the horseman of the budget county Sudeoksa Temple, was built in the 14th year of King Baekje's King Sejong (654) and belongs to the 4th Seosan. The buildings on the grounds were rebuilt in 1484 as they were lost in 1475. Among them, the base of Daeungjeon, a nationally designated cultural property, is said to have been built during the Baekje era.
Reconciliation
You have to be careful of the steps you take in the springtime to walk through nature and history. Small grasses and wildflowers lie softly over the leaves.
Wild flowers on the leaves
Travel info

Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest
Address: 339 Maae Samjonbul-gil, Unsan-myeon, Seosan-si, Chungnam
Contact: 041-664-1978

1. Nearby restaurants

Yonghyeon Collection: 66, Maaesamjonbul-gil, Unsan-myeon, Seosan-si / 041-663-4090
Native Yard: 176-7 Maaesamjonbul-gil, Unsan-myeon, Seosan-si / 041-664-8892
Natural Agriculture: 312-25, Gaesimsa-ro, Unsan-myeon, Seosan-si / 041-688-9999

2. Accommodation

Blue Mountain Garden Garden: 262 Maae Samjonbul-gil, Unsan-myeon, Seosan-si / 041-664-1715
Forest Pension: 125-30, Maae Samjonbul-gil, Unsan-myeon, Seosan-si / 010-3737-9290
http://www.forest-in.com/index.php

Mountain Village Pension: 326-9, Gaesimsa-ro, Unsan-myeon, Seosan-si / 041-688-1112

http://www.gaesimsa.com/

item.title: Gangneung, South Korea - 2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 01, Pyeongchang Gangneung
item.description:
Alpensia Ski Jump

2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 01, Pyeongchang Gangneung

Gangneung, South Korea

<Travel Course>

Nami Island → Pyeongchang Woljeongsa → Alpensia Ski Jumping College → Lodging (Gangneung) → Gangneung Ojukheon → Mission Field → Olympic Public Relations Hall → Gyeongpoho → Anmok Coffee Street

2018 Pyeongchang-gun. The long-awaited Winter Olympics will be held in Pyeongchang-gun. Winter sports festivals, nature encounters, the passion of athletes and the harmony of wonderful destinations have already led the body and mind of travelers to Gangwon-do. It's fun to imagine the scenes of the athletes at the Alpensia Resort in Pyeongchang and the Olympic Public Relations Hall in Gangneung, where the ski ski slopes are set up.
Was Nami Island an island from the beginning? no. The construction of Cheongpyeong Dam in 1944 unintentionally made it an inland island that borders Chuncheon, Gangwon-do and Gapyeong, Gyeonggi-do. Purchased and planted by various individuals in 1965, it is now a huge forest with thousands of trees.
Nice forest path is the attraction of Nami Island
On Nami Island, he spends his time walking through forest trails, riding bicycles, taking photos at drama locations, and experiencing art. Ginkgo, pine, and cherry trees along the island are good for walking around. Wherever you go, you'll find Nami Island's charm. The most famous way is Metasequoia Road, which also appeared in the drama Winter Sonata. Metasequoia is tall but its shape is so fascinating. The green leaves on the branches are added to give the illusion of being in the background of the film.
Bicycles are an important means of transportation on Nami Island
Bicycles are useful for traveling on the island. You can go to the place you want quickly and conveniently, or you can feel the relaxed and relaxed atmosphere of the island by slowly running through the forest. Visiting the location of Winter Sonata and leaving a photo of your memories is the best way to have a romantic time.
I am happy to spend time with Nami Island writers. You can not only appreciate the wonderful creations of the artists such as art, ceramics and crafts, but also experience them.
Nami Island Metasequoia Road
The Woljeongsa Temple in Pyeongchang is famous for its fir forest path created by millennium time. It is a little over 1km from the one order written to 'Woljeongdaegaram'. The dense forest, where the sunlight is hard to see, is stable and cozy as if it contained extraordinary in ordinary.
Woljeongsa entrance fir forest path
At the end of the road, Woljeongsa, the world of Buddha, welcomes travelers. The unfailing sound of loneliness and the incense filled with devotion, conveyed for a thousand years, make us feel different from the human world.
Woljeongsa Temple
Although there is no shrine that shows great history during the Korean War, you can see the pagoda and the shrine's colorful scenery when you look straight at the Octagonal Pagoda (National Treasure No. 48) in front of Daegukwangjeon. Afterwards, the blue energy of the pines is reflected. Woljeongsa Pagoda Pagoda is a symbol of Woljeongsa Temple.
Monk knocking on the neck
From Woljeongsa, head to Alpensia Resort, where the 2018 Winter Olympics will be held. The ski jumping stand, used as a ski jumping stadium, reveals its magnificence. It is a familiar landscape as it is the location of the movie <National Representative>.
Alpensia Ski Jump
If you take the elevator from the tower to the 90m high jump lounge, the bridge will be taller than you think. There are two ski jumps: K98 and K125.
Alpensia Ski Jumping Observatory
K stands for German Kritisch Point, which stands for critical point. K denotes the flight distance. The K98 jump stands have a flight distance of 98m. You have to fly 98m to get the basic score, and if you fly further, you get extra points.
Ski jump
Written on Star Line, I remember the movie `` Butterfly '' from the movie <National Representative> "Fly away so you can see the world." In the photo zone, you can take pictures that look like you are actually jumping.
Athlete ski jumping practice
Crossing Daegwallyeong in Pyeongchang is Gangneung. The characters that are indispensable when talking about Gangneung are Sinsaimdang and Yulgok Yi.
Ohjukheon was born
Ojukheon is Yulgok's mother and the Shin-Sangdang's home. Sindangimdang was born here and lived until the age of 38. Yulgok was also born and grew to age 5. It is called 'Ojukheon' because there are many black bamboos. The shrine has a dream of 'Mongryong-sil' because the shrine has dreams both when they have Yulgok and when they give birth. Moon Sungsa orients Yulgok in the backyard.
rate...
In January, the drama 'Saimdang's Diary of Light' started with Shinsaimdang as the main character.
Ojukheon Souvenir Shop
Along with Ojukhun, Yangban House, representing Gangneung, is the mission field. It is the most well-kept house in the traditional Hanok of this land, revealing the appearance of the sign of Manseokgi. It is a house with 9 buildings and 100 squares, including Anchae, Dongryang, Seoryang, Yeolhwadang, and Hwaraejeong. The Dongbyeol Party and Anchae form one house, and the love house, the Fire House, forms another house as a space for welcoming guests.
Mission Field
In front of the mission place is a square pond and a small sperm called Live Rae Jung. Ponds and sperm greet the person who visited them first and then see them off. When the pond was full of lotus flowers, the owners would have a glass of wine with their stewards.
Missionary Fever
Jung Bin (Kim Min-jung), who fell in love with Yoon Seo (Han Seok-gyu) in the movie <Naughty School Student>, appeared in a scene where he spent a quiet time inviting him to the palace.
Missionary Bow Rae Jung
At the mission field, you can relax and enjoy the Hanok experience. It keeps the appearance of Hanok and has a kitchen, shower and toilet in the room, and it is decorated like a home.
Missionary Tea Ceremony Experience Room
Gangneung is the host city for the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics and Paralympic Ice Skating Games. If you want to know when the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics will be held and how many events will be played, head to the PR Experience Center near Gyeongpo Lake.
Pyeongchang Winter Olympics PR Center
At the Winter Olympics stage, you can see all the process of preparing the PyeongChang Winter Olympics, including the status of stadium facilities and emblems. It is easy to understand by expressing sports events in a model vividly. You can experience winter sports directly at the 4D experience hall.
Winter Olympic Games lively
Gyeongpo Lake is a great place for the Olympic PR. Gyeongpo-ho is named after 'clear and beautiful like a mirror'. One of the best sights in Kanto, there are five moons in the sky, lake, sea, wine glass, and your eyes when the moon shines brightly. Stroll along the lakeside promenade and enjoy the tranquility of a tranquil lake. There are shelter and observatory in various places, so it's good to walk around.
Gyeongpo Lake, one of the best in Kanto
In the center of the lake is a rock called Hongjangam. It contains the love of Gangneung Parasitic Red Jang and Park Shin, Anjeongsa, Gangwon-do. Gangneung-bu Joun Hull invited Park Shin to the Gyeongpoho to play a boating game in the pretext that he wrote that Park Jang died. On the other boat burned a red dress disguised as a fairy attracted Park Shin's attention. When Park Shin looked at the moonlight, I couldn't tell whether it was the soul or the real thing of red bean, and approached me. It was soon discovered that they were Hongjang, and the three of them laughed and rejoiced.
Gyeongpo Lake Observatory with Telescope
Gangneung is a city of coffee. If you think you want to drink coffee while watching the sea, you will find a coffee street on Anmok Beach.
Romantic couples' favorite discerning coffee street
There are about 20 cafes lined up on a 500m coastal road. The famous franchise cafés also stand out, but there are also many roastery cafés.
Savory coffee aroma
Ka
The discerning coffee street is full of rich coffee aroma.
Travel info

Recommended travel season: autumn and winter

Recommended trip: lovers, friends

http://www.coffeefestival.net/


traditional market

-Pyeongchang Bongpyeongjang
Five days long feeling of Bongpyeong. As the buckwheat is held in the town of buckwheat, it is filled with buckwheat noodles, buckwheat pancake, buckwheat jelly, and buckwheat nabi bibimbap.
-Address: 14-1, Dongijangter-gil, Bongpyeong-myeon, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do
-Operating Hours: From 8 o'clock (different every store) / Oil shop 2, 7 days every month (5 days interval)

Gangneung Central Market
Gangneung's representative traditional market, known as a permanent market even before the Japanese colonial rule. Dried fish and seafood markets are popular for tourists. It also sells a variety of food, clothing, and miscellaneous goods such as salted fish, rice cakes, rice cakes, and fish cakes. Eat Alley is full of Gangneung's representative foods, including potato Ongsim and buckwheat pancake.
-Address: 21, Geumseong-ro, Gangneung-si, Gangwon-do
-Hours: 8 am (different every store) / Closed on the first and third Sundays of every month (Closed on the first Sunday of every month)

http://www.gncmarket.com/


-Chuncheon Romantic Market
It is a representative traditional market located in Chuncheon downtown. Every corner of the market is decorated with works of art and murals, and there is an alley where the old scenery remains deep inside. Adjacent to the Myeongdong Chicken Ribs Alley, it is a popular tourist attraction.
-Address: 34 Myeongdong-gil, Chuncheon-si, Gangwon-do
-Hours: From 8 o'clock (varies by store)

Gangneung City Tour
-Gangneung trip around the main attractions of Gangneung conveniently. Depart from Jeongdongjin Station at 8:00 am and pick up passengers in areas with many guesthouses, including Geogak, Gangneung Station, Gangmun Bus Terminal, and Gyeongpo Bus Terminal. It is operated by Gangneung Guest House Association and can be inquired at each guest house.
<Tour course> Jeongdongjin Station → Samyang Ranch → Gyeongpo Beach → Gangmun Beach (Lunch) → Ojukheon → Sun Cruise Sculpture Park

item.title: Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea - Pyeongchang Sightseeing Road 08, which is previewed in advance, takes you to Untan Altitude, an old road carrying coal
item.description:
Untan Altitude at high altitudes of more than 1,100 meters above sea level

Pyeongchang Sightseeing Road 08, which is previewed in advance, takes you to Untan Altitude, an old road carrying coal

Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

<Travel Course>
High1 Ski Resort Mountain Gondola

→ Untan Altitude → Samtan Art Mine

→ Taebaek Cheoram Coal History Village

The Sabuk and Gohan regions of Jeongseon, Gangwon-do, were Korea's representative coal mining sites. When the coal industry boomed in the 1970's and 1980's, money was overflowing enough to say that dogs carry ten thousand won. However, in 1989, the coal industry walked down due to the rationalization policy of the abandoned mine and production cuts. As the coal mine disappeared, the mining villages of Sabuk and Gohan were devastated. Like the words `` Sae-ji-ma '', they rose to coal and stagnated to coal. Now, Sabuk and Gohan are rising again with tourism based on coal. Along the fascinating coal mine attractions, we look forward to the past, present and future of Jeongseon.

The center of Jeongseon Coal Mine Trip is Untan Altitude. Reminiscent of China's Chama Island, this road used to carry coal from Manhangjae to Hambaek Station. Trekking on the Untan Altitude requires time and stamina as it is the only mountain trail in Korea to be built at high altitudes of more than 1,100 meters. But don't be scared before you start. Because there is an easy way to climb. The mountain gondola (2832m) of High1 Ski Resort is used.
Gondolas are the easiest means of access to Untan Altitude.
Gondola from Mountain Base to Mountain Top takes 20 minutes to the summit. Don't think of a gondola as a simple means of transportation. It is also a moving observatory. Skiing, Gangwon Land and Baekdudaegan are spread under your feet while riding the gondola. The slopes on the ski slopes are filled with summer wildflowers such as daisies and lions. The ridges of Baekdudaegan are pushed like waves to create spectacular scenery. You can enjoy the scenery from the gondola that you can't see without climbing the high mountains.
Gondola to the top of the mountain

Once you've climbed the mountain top, you don't have to head straight to Untan Altitude. Surrounded by a rustic colony of wildflowers. A shy flower blooms in the wind and sends out a gesture of temptation. The mountain trails behind the wildflower community make it a mountain country.
There is more to see. High1 Alpine Botanical Garden is located at the top of the mountain at 1380m above sea level. In the highest botanical garden in Korea, 330 species of alpine plants are classified into themes such as Manbyeongwon, Alpine Grass Garden, Rock Garden, Sink Garden, and Wildflower Garden.

Wildflowers bloom below the gondola
Time to trek to the full-scale Untango. You can meet Untan Altitude at the top of the mountain by 1.4km down the mountain porch behind the observatory. From here, take the road to High1 Hotel, Manhangjae. It's a bit uphill, but the road is flat and smooth, making walking easy. Taebaek's spirits take off while walking for two and a half hours.
Skyway from Uncle Altitude to the summit
As it is the only mountain in Korea, it is a mountain path that leads to highlands and ridges that are more than 1,000 meters above sea level. The reason why Untan Altitude is special is that the beautiful landscape contains the history of the coal industry. The old road that carried coal. When the Hambaek Station was opened in 1957, about 2000 construction workers made shovels and pickaxes to transport coal.
In the past, coal chambers used trucks
The 1177 gang that meets during the trek is an acid witness to the coal industry. The 1177 gang, which was first opened in the area by Dongwon Sabuk Mining Co., Ltd., has restored the entrance of the mine. Hanging on the shaft, a wooden structure that supports the shaft, also hangs the oysters that the miners hung to die.
1177 Gang Entrance at Untan Altitude
For half a century, a truck loaded with coal flew black dust, creating a trail that Gangwon Land combined with the history of coal mines. The busy roads of the trucks became heavenly paths with hundreds of wild flowers growing on them. It also meant 'high roads with clouds spread like rugs'.
The road is flat and smooth and easy to walk.
In addition to Untango Island, there are several promenades called Skyway. There is a squirrel, a hare, a deer, and an elk course, and each course has a name that shows the characteristics of the section, such as Sky Mae-gil, Mountain Bamboo Road, Mt. Unless you're on a coal-themed trip, you can walk on the sky and breathe with nature.
A camellia flower at Untan Altitude
If you are curious about the actual appearance of the coal mine, Samtan Artmine will solve that question.
Samtan Art Mine has been reborn as an art space
This place is special in that it uses the actual abandoned mine.
Sculptures in the Laundry Room
'Samtan' refers to Samcheok Coal, which was one of the representative coal mines in Korea. 'Art' and 'Mine' are derived from 'Art' and 'Mine', the English notation of art and coal mines.
A photo of miners' lives
The Samcheok coal thrust, which had been mining coal since 1964, was abandoned in October 2001, and it became a new space by combining culture and art.
Even filming the earthquake disaster scene in Descendants of the Sun
The clan chiefs and laundries, which show the miners' lives, have been transformed into wonderful exhibition halls with more than 100,000 works of art collected from 150 countries and works of contemporary art artists.
Shower room where Kang Mo-yeon was held hostage in Descendants of the Sun
If you go to Taebaek beyond the rugged mountain range in Jeongseon, traces of the heritage, life and history of the coal industry remain under the name of Cheoram Coal Mining Village.
Cheoram Coal Mining Village intact
During the prosperity of the mining village, the buildings such as Perika, Honam Super, Bonghwa Restaurant, Jinju Castle, and Hanyang Tea House, which were booming in the magpie building used by miners and their families, were made into historical villages.
The magpie bridge building with pillars in Cheoramcheon
The magpie foot building refers to the pillar, or the building that built the magpie foot, on Cheoramcheon. It is a building that many people can live in a small area.
Exhibit showing the life of miners
Signboards and crumbling buildings of old faded shops welcome travelers by transforming them into galleries and exhibition rooms where miners live and experience contemporary art.
A statue of a miner's wife who sees her husband off to work
There are lots of interesting things to see from the records of the miners' living notices and records of the residents who recorded the personal information of the residents, as well as the exhibits recreating various household goods and iron alleys used at the time.
If you climb the observatory, you can see the Cheoram Coal Mine.
Coal mines piled up like mountains are still in the coal mine across the street. The Cheoram Coal Mining Cousin is a space where you can meet the old look of coal mine more vividly than the coal museum made of billions of dollars.
Coal miner statue built in Cheoram coal mining cousin

item.title: Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea - 2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 09, Jeongseon Journey along Arirang Song
item.description:
Auraji, the birthplace of Jeongseon Arari

2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 09, Jeongseon Journey along Arirang Song

Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

<Travel Course>
Auraji → Rail Bike

→ Ariari Village → Arirang Market

→ Scenic Walkway Observatory, Straw Wire

"Ari and Ari and Ariari. Ari and pass me over your head." Arirang melodies are melted in Jeongseon. Arirang, which is called at the lowest point of life, is intimately attached to our lives and narrates love, farewell, coalition, and lament. The vibrancy of life at the Jeongseon Arirang Market and the sound of the river flowing with the rail bike are like the rhythm of Arirang. Step on the rail bike pedals to follow Arirang's faults and ride a straw wire to Jeongseon, where you can embrace the Korean peninsula.
Journey starts at Auraji, the birthplace of Arirang. Auraji is named after Songcheon and Goljicheon. The two fabrics combine to form a river from the Auraji, the highest point of the Han River. Surrounded by mountains and boasting beautiful scenery, it is also the birthplace of Jeongseon Ari and love.
Crescent-shaped bridge that resembles a river
In the story that came down, a loved one lived between the auraji. The two promised to go to Camellia to get the camellia, but they couldn't meet because the river couldn't get up because of heavy rain. It is said that longing and sadness, "Please hand over a ship of astronaut voyeur. All the camellia falls, and camellia falls. Fallen camellia piles up. On both ends of Goljicheon, there is a bridge that looks like a stone bridge on one side and a large crescent moon on one side.
Please let me cross the boat
The Auraji is also the destination for selected rail bikes. The train stops due to the abandoned mine, and a three-car train carries locals and Jeongseon Sun stopped due to mismatch. This is where the rail bikes with tourist memories are stored. The starting point is Gujeolli Station. If you pedal hard to 7.2 km to the Aura area, you will arrive in less than an hour. Songcheon flows right next to the rail and it's not hot even if you pedal hard. It is popular because you can feel the nature of Jeongseon with your whole body.
Rail bike running on the rails with two pedals
You can go through the tunnel where the train went, and when you cross the railroad crossing, you will hear a "beep" sound and you will be able to pass safely. It's almost downhill, so it's hard to get to the Aura region at 10-20km per hour. If you take a commemorative photo in front of a natural-memorial cafe that looks like a natural monument and visit the Aura area, you don't know how to go.
From Aura area to Gujeolli Station, take a yellow line of scenic train. Two and four-seaters are available, and during summer peak seasons, tickets for the day are picked up by the stars of the sky.
Chick width with two legs, rail bike
"If the three pyeong flat screens the sky." People who select mountainous features say: How did the mountain people live? In Arari Village, you can see the good old days of Jeongseon. It's sad to think of Ariari Village as a folk village. Arari Village is a place where you can get a glimpse of the life and customs of Jeongseon, the birth of Jeongseon Arirang.
Arari Village to get a glimpse of Jeongseon's old life
Jeongseon Arirang comes to you from the moment you buy a ticket and enter into Ariari Village. Admission fee 3,000 won will be returned to Jeongseon Arirang cultural gift certificate that can be used like cash in Ara Village and Jeongseon.
You and my house in Ararie Village
When you enter Arari Village, you will find a house that recreates traditional life such as traditional waga, oyster house, nawa house, and watermill. It is not a museum where you can touch it, but it is an experience facility where you can experience pottery, crafts, and hands-on experiences at each house.
Arari Village looks like a house in the mountains
Go to Arirang Market with Jeongseon Arirang Cultural Gift Certificate received from Ariari Village. Jeongseon Arirang Market has been a permanent market since the Joseon Dynasty. On the days ending 2 and 7, the tent is crowded with oil tents outside the market. On the oil day, Arirang Sori will be held in the center of the market from 11:30 to 1:30 pm.
Jeongseon Arirang Market
There are also shops selling wild vegetables such as gondre, deodeok, and bear scents, including wild vegetables such as gourds and wild vegetables, and food alleys in Gangwon-do.
You can buy wild vegetables and herbs from Gangwon-do.
The smell of buckwheat pancake is amazed by the smell of the bustling market. In the food alley, there are buckwheat pancake, Chinese cabbage pancake, and sorghum soup, as well as representative foods of Gangwon-do.
Jujeonburi which is indispensable in Jeongseon Arirang Market
Jeongseon namul of Jeongseon is grown only over 700m above sea level.
There are a lot of main bills which can taste good choice
Jeongseon namul of Jeongseon is grown only over 700m above sea level. Nat-dung Noodles are noodles that are made by mixing half of buckwheat flour and half of flour, and like cold noodles in summer like kalguksu in winter. It's called springy noodles because it's elastic, so when you eat it, it's said to be scooped up. I pulled out the hururu noodles, and the tip of the noodles really danced.
Cool Shrimp Noodles Cool Summer Heat
Byeongchi Chi-Skywalk is an observatory suspended from a cliff at 583 meters above sea level, which is twice the height of Yeouido 63 Building. It is a place where Donggang winds around the mountain and has a view of the night islands shaped like the Korean peninsula. It is made of transparent tempered glass, so you can enjoy the feeling of walking while floating on the scenery under your feet. Although tempered glass can be dangerous if people are too crowded, limit the number of people sent in. Wearing overshoes to protect the tempered glass from scratching, a cool breeze blows up when you climb the Skywalk. The village looks like far away from the Korean peninsula-shaped Bamseom. On the right side, you can hear the exciting shouts of those who descend on straw wires.
Skywalk on the Korean Peninsula
Get out of the skywalk and follow the promenade for a zipwire ride. Zipwire is a leports that glides by using a pulley connecting 1.1km to Gwanghari Eco Experience Center below. It's embarrassing to just sit still, but you have to courageously fly down 120km per hour.
Straw wire going down the Korean Peninsula
If you take a deep breath and step toward the air, the Korean peninsula will come to you. The person who screamed at first even opens his arms in about 20 seconds and welcomes the wind and the scenery.
Straw wire freely falling under the cool river
Travel info

Recommended travel season: summer and autumn

Recommended trip: family, friends

traditional market

Jeongseon Arirang Market
In addition to Jeongseon's agricultural products, wild vegetables from the mountains can be purchased at low prices. There is a tasting corner like a supermarket, so you can taste and buy it There are a lot of old foods such as sorghum buckwheat noodles and scampi noodles. You can also watch the Jeongseon Arirang drama, a traditional performance, at the performance hall located in the market.
