item.title: Gwangsan-gu, Gwangju, South Korea - Honam Line KTX to Naduya, Gwangju Mining Area
item.description:
Gwangju Songjeong Station

Honam Line KTX to Naduya, Gwangju Mining Area

Gwangsan-gu, Gwangju, South Korea

The Honam Line KTX Express section has been extended to Gwangju Songjeong Station in Gwangju. KTX, which departed from Yongsan Station, arrived at Gwangju Songjeong Station in 1 hour 33 minutes, and it was possible to go out to Gwangju by taking a day trip in the metropolitan area. In the vicinity of Gwangju Songjeong Station, there are attractions such as Yonga Birthplace, Wolbong Seowon, Wolgye-dong Janggobun, Songjeong Park, and Sinchang-dong ruins.
Convenient for traveling by subway or city in front of Gwangju Songjeong Station
Before the West Coast Highway was completed in 2001, it was convenient for tourists in the metropolitan area to use the Honam Highway Mine Tollgate to travel to Honam provinces such as Mokpo, Yeongam, and Naju. Since then, the emergence of the Gochang-Damyang Expressway followed the emergence of the West Coast Expressway, making the name “mining” faint in tourists' heads. Then, with the recent opening of the Honam Line KTX, the mining district with Gwangju Songjeong Station was revived as a hot topic. Local residents expect that the number of visitors to Gwangju Songjeong Station will increase from 4,000 on average to 12,000.
KTX at Gwangju Songjeong Station
The name 'Gwangsan-gu' was born in 1988 when Songjeong and Mining County were incorporated into Gwangju. Of the five districts that make up Gwangju, the area occupies 222.9㎢ (44.05%), the largest. There is a subway station with the same name right in front of the new station of Gwangju Songjeong Station. The subway in Gwangju runs between Okdong Station, Gwangju Songjeong Station, Gwangju Airport, Kimdaejung Convention Center, Geumnam-ro, Culture Hall, Hakdong and Jeungsimsa Entrance, and Yongsan Vehicle Station. Foreign travelers can take the Honam Line KTX and get off at Gwangju Songjeong Station and transfer to the subway for easy transportation around Gwangju.
Mugunghwa Lake stops at Gwangju Songjeong Station
Yong-A Park Enjoys Literary Journey at Birthplace
One of the most popular tourist attractions near Gwangju Songjeong Station in Gwangsan-gu is Yonga birthplace. 'Yong-ah' is a child of Park Yong-cheol (1904 ~ 1938) who worked as a poet during the Japanese occupation. Born in Gwangsan-gu, he worked with Young-Rang Kim and Jung Ji-yong to publish Literary Literature. The poet published his leading works, Leaving Boats and Sending You in the Night Train, in The First of Poetry Literature. Here's a look at his poem Leaving Ship. The specialty is engraved on the granite fertilization of the flower bed of the dragon child.

I'm gonna go / my young age /

Are you going to send tears?
Are these cozy harborers going to be easy?

Even the watery eyes like the fog
Ripe beak shape on each foot of the valley /

Wrinkles also ripe eyes! Loved ones //
I can't forget the one who throws it away /

What's different about being chased?
The clouds look back, the wind is white /

Will there be hill climbers in front of us //
I'm so pretty / my young age /

Will you let go with tears?

Fertilization set in the dragon birthplace
It is probably because of the song of singer Kim Soo-chul that this poem comes close to us. Kim Soo-cheol quotes a part of the poet Park Yong-chul's poems in the song <Go To Me Too>. The desire to leave younger ages with tears and to find a dream was the independence of the country for the poet Park Yong-chul, and for the singer Kim Soo-chul. Even though the direction is different according to the times, the value is still so many people love their words and lyrics.
Portrait of poets guarding the yard
Unspoken conversations with poets
Let's follow Yonga Park's literary life a little longer. He also published Literary Monthly and Literature, and translated and introduced foreign poems and plays. He also worked as a literary critic, but unfortunately he died in his mid-30s. The cause of death was tuberculosis. In addition to his birthplace, his fertilization, which engraves Leaving Boat, is also set up on the slope of Yangji, which leads to Songjeong Park.
The poet's birthplace is surrounded by stone walls cleared with ocher. It is a thatched house with a wide yard, flower bed, and jangdokdae. Perhaps because of his literary activities with Jung Ji-yong and Kim Young-rang, looking at every corner of his birthplace naturally reminds him of poems such as <Perfume> and Kim Young-rang's <Sunshine on a Stone Wall>.
Another thing that catches your eye is the large paintbrush that painted the faces of six poets. It was used in the Yonga Literary Festival in 2014, and there is even a paint board in the yard, so it is less lively. Poetry poets such as Kim Yun-sik, Jung In-bo, Byun Young-ro, Jung Yong-yong, Park Yong-cheol, and Lee Ha-yun bloomed like flower wine. Their footprints can also be found in the Museum of Literature and Literature (opened in 2012) in Gangjin-eup, Gangjin-gun. Kang Jin is the birthplace of Kim Young Rang. Leaving Yong-Ah's birthplace, I recall Park Yong-chul's other representative film, Sending You to the Night Train.
Thatched house

Now, in the distant winter, spring day

I'll look at it.
Laughing like a spring day, he rushes his train

I'll wait.
“Forget” Meaners Laugh like this /

Let me learn
While walking through the rough road,

Let's follow the example.
At last he will be a follower.

Poet's face as seen from Songjeong Park fertilization
Learned from Wolbongseowon, the high peak
The footsteps of travelers who enjoyed literary journeys lead to exploration of their vows. Wolbongseowon, located in Gwangsan-gu, Gwangsan-gu, is quite old-fashioned from the way from the parking lot to the entrance of Seowon. This is because a low dirt wall, neatly tiled, passes through a village road. Wolbongseowon was founded in 1578, after the death of the teacher. It is now considered one of the eight scenes of Gwangju.
Gobong is famous as a scholar who exchanged the theory with Toegye Lee Hwang. The main auditorium of Seowon is called Bingwoldang. Chungjo bought Gobong's noble school virtues and gave the title of ‘Bingsim Snowwall’. The kindly reading of the jury with the Korean translation kindly adds to the enjoyment of the vow. The book begins with ‘Get a book and find a teacher and rise to a high hermit, 'and ends the middle section with‘ What will be lamented later divided into dragons and pigs? ’. 'Strive today' contains lessons.
“The foundation of the state is to make the people at ease. Only after the people are comfortable can enlightenment be made. It must be taught after the people have been strengthened first, and the people have been made rich. ”
Wolbongseowon View
If you have plenty of time, let's walk the path of philosophers. This is a walking course from Wolbong Seowon to Baekwoojeong, Kyujeonam Ruins, Gobong Mausoleum and Khufujae.
The amount of Bingwoldang, the main lecture hall of Wolbong Seowon
Ruins in downtown, Sinchang-dong ruins and Wolgye-dong Janggobun
After exploring the poet's birthplace and vows, he visits cultural remains that are not well known to foreign tourists, even though they are in the city center. Sinchang-dong ruins and Janggobun of Wolgye-dong are located near the Honam Expressway Mine Interchange.
Sinchang-dong ruins (Historic No. 375) may be disappointed because it is a field with no streets and no museums. However, according to the description of the Gwangju National Museum, there are many relics such as earthenware, wood, keel, and lacquerware that give a glimpse of the agricultural culture of the first century BC. Imagine the days when there would be no driveways or apartment complexes, and you can imagine that people were a very good place to live in groups. In particular, Shin Chang-dong was nicknamed the 'Ancient Textile Factory' in that the oldest silk and burlap relics in Korea, bodies, thread bobbins and bone needles needed to produce these fabrics were excavated. In the main hall on the first floor of the Gwangju National Museum, a special exhibition will be held until May 25, 'The Silk Country, Textile Culture of Sinchang-dong, Gwangju'.
Sinchang-dong Historic Site
Janggobun, Wolgye-dong (Gwangju Metropolitan City Local Monument No. 20) is named after the tomb shape. It was discovered during the construction of Gwangju Advanced Science Park in the 1990s and is believed to have been built in the 5 ~ 6th centuries. A shopping mall and an apartment complex are built around the tomb and it is a cultural heritage that is loved as a place for citizens to stroll.
Wolgye-dong Janggobun
Finish your trip with Tteokgalbi, Naksamtang, and Sundae Gukbap
Go back to Gwangju Songjeong Station to taste the specialties of the mine. Tteokgalbi street was formed around Gwangsan-gu Office a long time ago, attracting travelers' tastes. If the smell of baking tteokgalbi fills the alley, no matter how greedy, you can't help but relax. Nowadays, Japanese and Chinese tourists also come to hear the rumors. Songjeongri Tteokgalbi tastes slightly different from house to house, so you don't have to recommend a house.
Songjeong-ri Tteokgalbi
Naksamtang is also a delicacy in Gwangju. Boiled mung bean porridge with bone bone broth, put ginseng, chestnuts and jujube in it, and then add one to the octopus. Usamtang is a style of boiled boiled egg instead of octopus.
Naksamtang
There are five or six sundae soup restaurants at the beginning of the mine, opposite the entrance to the Songjeong station.
Songjeong station street market
In addition to Sundae Gukbap, head soup, Naejang Gukbap, Seonji Gukbap, and Ampoon Sundae make the stomachs of lighter travelers lighter.
Sundae Gukbap
Wasabi on the market
Travel info

item.title: Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea - Wait for the horse! Samgyetang & Freshwater Eel
item.description:
Horse-free food, grilled freshwater eel

Wait for the horse! Samgyetang & Freshwater Eel

Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea

It's summer. Even if you are still sweating. Both slim and serious people need to take care of themselves in the heat. Samgyetang, which helps smooth gastrointestinal function and eel, has been found for recovery. All are low fat and high protein. If you listen to it, your arms and legs are strong. If you eat too much to take care of your body, however, you may be afflicted with oversized flesh. There is still a word.

Samgyetang is one of the first hands to be a summer food. Samgyetang is a chicken that has fallen in the water that everyone would have tasted if they had been born and raised on this land. When the hot days swelling in the heat or when the body is desolate, the chicken baeksook was carefully pampered. item.title: Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea - Go catch Pokemon! Pokemon Go in Sokcho
item.description:
View from Sokcho Lighthouse Observatory

Go catch Pokemon! Pokemon Go in Sokcho

Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea

In the summer of 2016, the Pokemon Go craze is not unusual. Pokemon Go is not yet officially released in Korea, but games are available in Sokcho, Gangwon-do and some surrounding areas. As this fact became known, Sokcho stood as 'Pokemon Holy Land'. Those who want to catch Pokemon flocked to Sokcho from all over the country. Sokcho buses were sold out, and a quick travel agency also offered travel packages to catch Pokemon. Let's take a look around playing Sokcho and Pokémon Go games that are screaming with the holiday season.
Sokcho, located between Goseong and Yangyang, Gangwon-do, has mountains, lakes, and sea as well as geographical advantages within two hours from the metropolitan area. Why don't you take a more meticulous trip to Sokcho with this Pokemon hunting? If you don't forget to lift your head to the reality behind the phone, it will be a trip to Pokémon holding Pokemon and Sokcho. Be careful about safety accidents.
Pokemon Go, are you?
In Pokemon Go, monsters appear in places where many people actually go. Since Pokemon is one of the most popular destinations, you need to know the local hotspots to meet many Pokemon. In the same vein, Sokcho's 11 most visited sites are the most popular tourist attractions of Sokcho. Among them are the Jangjang, where the bare-handed squid festival is in full swing.
I confess before I start catching a real monster. The reporter does not know the game. I've played Tetris games and have no interest in games or hobbies. The words augmented reality can only sound alien. I didn't understand why I was so enthusiastic that it was difficult to download the Pokemon Go app under the Korean account.
Augmented Reality Pokemon Go with 3D Graphics
Augmented Reality (AR) refers to a technology that displays computer-generated 3D graphics on a visible environment. In other words, if you run Pokemon Go, you will see the environment as if you were taking a picture, and monsters would appear on it. Then throw the monster ball to catch the Pokemon. Of course, it's not as easy as it sounds.
Augmented Reality Pokemon Go with 3D Graphics
Pokemon Go is a location-based game of Google Maps on your smartphone that requires monsters to enter a specific area. South Korea is missing here, but some survived and the Pokemon Go game was executed. That is Gangwon Sokcho and some surrounding areas. In addition to Sokcho, two other Pokemon Go viable areas, including Ulleung and Ulju-gun, Gyeongbuk are being discovered.
33-year-old office workers run from Seoul to Sokcho
Pokemon Go base camp, Sokcho, Expo Tower Park
In Sokcho, the sacred place of Pokemon, the center of Pokemon Go is Cheongcho Lake and Expo Tower Park. Wi-Fi maps and free smartphone charging are also available. Most of all, Pokémon seduces the hunters (?) So that you can take the Cheongcho Lake Expo Tower as a base camp and explore Abai Village, Sokcho Tourist Fish Market, Dongmyeong Port and Sokcho Beach.
Three generations of Pokemon Go
For us, Abai Village, famous for filming the drama "Autumn Fairy Tales", is a collective settlement of displaced people. Originally it was a place where few people lived, but when refugees gathered during the Korean War, a village was formed. There are many specialty shops where you can taste the Sunbuk style. Abai Village (Cheongho-dong) and Jungang-dong are located in a quiet place. Sokcho Tourist Fish Market, famous for Chicken Gangjeong and Alley of Chicken, is also considered a Pokemon hot spot. When you go to the market, take a good look around, and remember the meeting center in the basement of the fish market.
Abai Village where refugees were displaced during the Korean War
The next destination is the same name port. Let's go up to the lighthouse observatory that is Sokcho's proud view point. When the weather is good, you can see Sokcho city, as well as Sokcho Beach and Oeongchi Beach. Don't miss the Sokcho sea view from Yeonggeumjeong Observation Deck.
North Sokcho Port Details
If you go north from Dongmyeong Port, it is a Jangjeo, and if you go south, Sokcho Beach. First, let's go to the market where the squid man-handed festival is held until July 31. Squid fishing is in full swing along the small beach. Enjoy a short walk to the lighthouse with Pokemon.
genus
Sokcho Beach is now. You can enjoy exciting bathing on the fine sandy beach. Here, too, face those who came to catch Pokemon.
Young people from Busan to play Pokemon Go
The seven-year-old kid from Seoul was more engaged in games than swimming. Young people from Seoul and Busan were also busy catching monsters.
7 year old kid from Seoul
If you are uncomfortable with Sokcho Beach, head to Oeongchi Beach.
Sokcho beach view
In both directions, so if you keep the sea on your left and go down, you will reach outland. You can enjoy swimming in a relatively quiet sea.
Sokcho beach view
If you stop at Daepo Port, you will see all the monsters on the coast. Now let's go to Seoraksan.
Road to Mt. Geumseong by Seoraksan Cable Car
Seoraksan is known as an unexpected Pokemon Haunting Area. It is often called Seorak in Sokcho area, and it is enough to take a cable car to look at Kwon Geumseong and look at Sinheungsa, an obscene music inspector. Shinheungsa was founded in 652 by the ruler named Hyangseongsa.
Seoraksan Sinheungsa Temple

Throughout the wait for the cable car, people were busy catching Pokemon. I could not see the face of Mt. Sorak in the thick fog, but it was obvious that it was a different experience. Rumors that there is a Pokemon in Everest will not be rumored. Some even go out of the boat to catch rare Pokemon. In all cases, don't forget it's a safety first. Pokemon Go's completion is a safe return.

Due to the Pokemon Go craze, Sokcho City began providing the integrated Pokemon Go online map on the City Hall website (www.sokcho.gangwon.kr) on July 26th. The integrated map, based on Google Maps, shows 8 locations of Sokcho tours, including the location of the `` Pocket Stop '' charging station, Pokemon training and combat space `` Pokemon Go Gymnasium '', and a free battery charging station. If you have a Pokemon Go hunting plan, you should check the benefits to the game users. If you catch 30 Pokémon by August 8, you can visit Sokcho City Museum for free.

item.title: Yeongam-gun, Jeonnam, Korea - Power burned! Galaktang, Nakjitangtang, and Octopus Horong: A refreshing journey to Yeongam.
item.description:
Gal Nak-tang is one of Yeongam's delicacies.

Power burned! Galaktang, Nakjitangtang, and Octopus Horong: A refreshing journey to Yeongam.

Yeongam-gun, Jeonnam, Korea

"If you feed three or four octopus to a falling cow, you will have a strong power."
This is a sentence explaining Octopus in Asset Asset. An octopus that makes a fallen cow jump up. The nickname of “sea ginseng” has a high content of taurine and histidine, which is excellent in tonics. It is the reason why it became famous as stamina food for tired people. Today, we went on a refreshing trip to Dokcheon in Yeongam, Jeollanam-do, known as 'Octopus Street'. The abundance of springtime scenery in South Korea is a bonus.
Tribal Octopus, a gift of abundant southern island tidal flats
Yeongam-gun, with its rich tidal flats in Namdo, was famous for its tribal octopus. If you look at the map for a while, Yeongam is located along the west coast of East Sea, which leads to Mokpo along Hampyeong and Muan, which are also famous for their tribal octopus. It is no wonder that the three-headed octopus became famous in Yeongam Land, where salty and fresh waters of the west coast were mixed along the stem of Yeongsan River in Namdo. The Yeongsan River Hagotduk construction has now lost its reputation as a mountain producing tribal octopus. This is because one day, octopus paradise was created by the development of various octopus recipes.
Octopus street leading to Dokcheon 5-day market
Dokcheon Octopus Street is located in Dokcheon-ri, Haksan-myeon, Yeongam-gun, Jeonnam. More than 30 octopus specialty shops follow the Dokcheon 5-day market. The Dokcheon 5-day Market, which is held every 4th and 9th of every month, is also a must-see. This place, where five or six octopus specialty shops were located, became the same octopus street since people gathered by word of mouth. In addition to beef chops and beef octopus, they also offer a variety of octopus dishes, including Yeonpotang, Octopus Horong, and Mountain Octopus.
Dozens of octopus shops
Tribal octopus with eight thin legs, what taste?
Before tasting the octopus, let's take a look at the identity of the three-foot octopus. What is a tribal octopus? When I was young, I thought 'three foot octopus' was a three foot octopus. Even though I sometimes watched a whole tribal octopus on TV, there was no doubt that his feet would be "three". Faith continued until we realized that the tax in the three-foot octopus was not a tax, but a tax.
Tribal octopus, commonly called 뻘 octopus, is small but tender and has a taste of taste. Whole or cooked octopus can be tasted by rolling it on wooden chopsticks. Of course, you must chew on the octopus, which tells you that it is still alive in your mouth.
Hansang's taste in octopus specialty shop in Dokcheon Octopus
Fresh sesame oil added to sesame oil is delicious, but the tribal octopus recipes are varied. Let's break it down into raw and cooked food. Depending on your taste, it may be a little different, but your first hand is to taste live octopus. Sweet and chewy texture is alive. It's small and soft, so it's easy to eat raw. In addition to the octopus Tangtang (an octopus cut out to be easy to eat), some of the octopus specialty stores in Dokcheon come out with a full-bodied tribal octopus.
Nakjitang-tang cut into live octopus
Boiled octopus dishes include grilled octopus, stir-fried octopus and roasted octopus, as well as hot-dip dishes represented by gal-nak and yeonpo-tang. Octopus horong is a food that is cooked by rolling around three heads of octopus from chopsticks. Bake the sauce and bake. In addition to the octopus stir-fried and marinated with radish, Gal Naktang and Yeonpo Tang, which are considered representatives of Yeongam, are added. Let's take a closer look at Gal Naktang, one of Yeongam's delicacies.
Roasted octopus with wood chopsticks
Yeongam Delicacy Superstar, Gal Naktang
Galactam. As the name suggests, it is a soup with ribs and octopus. If Yeonpotang is boiled only with octopus, the beef ribs are added to Galnaktang. Octopus is abundant place, the octopus utilizing the octopus would have developed. But where did the ribs come from? No matter how you think about it, octopus and ribs don't seem to matter.
Spatula, Gal-naktang
The curiosity was released from the name of Dokcheon Village. This is because Dokcheon Village came out of the “Calf Poison”. Dokcheon Village was a village that raises good cattle. Thanks to this, the octopus shops sold their ribs. Then, as the price of cows plummeted, they cooked “Gallak-tang,” which is filled with octopus, and the taste was amazing. The ribs and octopus will meet, the meat will be softer and the soup will be cooler. In addition, the two foods representing the land and the sea met, so did not fall into the food. The sea and land meets Galumnaktang, which is based on its taste and nutrients.
Yeonpo-tang cooked entirely in octopus
Where can I taste brown lacquer and octopus? There are about 30 octopus specialty shops in Dokcheon Octopus Street, including Dokcheon Restaurant, Haenam Restaurant, and Jeonju Restaurant. Galnaktang and Yeonpotang costs between 17,000 won and 19,000 won, while Korean dishes such as octopus soup, roasted long-roasted octopus, and fried octopus range from 30,000 won to 50,000 won. The price of food varies slightly depending on the size of the large, medium, small and each store.
Octopus Yeonpo-tang with a soft texture

item.title: Republic of Korea - “Secret Forest” and “Seoul Grand Park Forest Healing Forest” Experiences Revealed in 30 Years
item.description:
and

“Secret Forest” and “Seoul Grand Park Forest Healing Forest” Experiences Revealed in 30 Years

Republic of Korea

In July, the "secret forest" that Seoul Grand Park had hidden was released to the public in 30 years. The main theme is the “Health Healing Forest” in Seoul Grand Park, which comforts modern people who are tired of everyday life. Introducing the `` Healing Experience '' where the stress accumulated in the walk is relaxed as you walk along the quiet forest path that stretches from the lush forest to the valley of Cheonggyesan Mountain and the natural waterfall.
'Hot' is not enough weather. There was a news about the "secret forest" that appeared in the world in 30 years, when it was just breathing in the hot sun as if it burned everything. In addition, the name 'Forest Healing'. 'Healing' and 'healing' are not a hot word for modern people who have passed the summer because they can't get hot.
Go through the fir and pine forests and cool waterfalls at once!
The protagonist is Seoul Grand Park Healing Forest, which has been open to the public since July 13th. It is a natural forest boasting 50,000 square meters and contains Cheonggyesan valley valley and natural waterfall. To protect nature, which has been resting for 30 years, only 50-60 people a day can visit. Seoul Grand Park homepage http://grandpark.seoul.go.kr ) And Seoul Public Service Reservation System ( http://yeyak.seoul.go.kr You can predict by).
Visitor center at the beginning of the forest healing forest of Seoul Grand Park
The deadline is so fast that it's a bit difficult to book, but if you want to blow away the fatigue from the 'secret forest' and the 'healing forest' for free, you can try. You can experience 'forest healing' which means activities to increase the immunity of the human body and restore physical and mental health by utilizing and analyzing the forest. If it is not closed, you can register two days before your desired date. Reservations usually begin around 20 days of the delivery date. The date may change, so it's a good idea to check the website beforehand. It is so popular that it closes at the beginning of the booking.
Forest square where pre-bookers gather
The program booked by the reporter is Majung Forest Road, which is open to the general public. It aims to introduce and experience forest healing, and it will be held twice from Tuesday to Friday from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm and from pm to 16:00 pm. Children are not allowed. In addition, the Silver Forest Road aims to reduce muscle strength, prevent falls, and improve vitality for adults aged 65 to 75 years. Operate. Healing programs for adults 55 and older are offered once a week. The capacity of all programs is 15 on a first come, first served basis.
Forest healing forest beginning where full-scale healing walk begins
As it is operated by advance reservation system, a reservation confirmation certificate is required for identity verification in order to experience forest healing forest. Dress should be comfortable, long-sleeved to prevent sneakers and mosquitoes from running shoes or hiking boots. Have a hat ready for the sun and water for your day. If you arrive before the program starts, you can experience the program after checking the stress index at the Healing Forest Visitor Center.
Forest Healing Advisors Explain Before the Healing Program
Oh, let's also know how to visit the forest healing forest of Seoul Grand Park. If you are using your own car, search for ‘7-1, Makgye-dong, Gwacheon-si, Gyeonggi-do’ on the navigation. If you go by public transport, you can get off at Seoul Grand Park Station on Subway Line 4 and go to the Forest Healing Forest or the nearby Dongmun Parking Lot.
Forest healing forest beginning valley
According to the guide, the journey time to walk, elephant train or forest healing forest is similar to 40 minutes. If you are riding an elephant train, you only need to move one stop and get off at the main entrance to the zoo and walk toward the Museum of Modern Art. Instead of entering the Museum of Modern Art, if you go straight down the main road, you will see an orange signage indicating the way to the Forest Healing Forest. From now on it is mountain climbing. The orange ribbon will guide you kindly.
Healing forest path for elderly people to walk
Healing walk with forest healer
How long did you walk? The Forest Healing Forest Visitor Center is located in the valley behind the vacant lot where the banner of 'Seoul Grand Park Healing Forest Path is available to pre-bookers'. The Visitor Center gathered for those who applied for a healing program together today. The Forest Healing Advisor recommended a cup of cool buckwheat tea and said, "Let's cool down and move in the valley before the forest healing program begins."
A little
Forest Healing Advisor's Hemotherapy Course
Forest healing forest Forest, sky forest, tree relaxation forest, sunlight relaxation forest, water relaxation forest And so on. First arrival Forest activity Stretch and relax at the gym. Forest activity Opposite the pine trees Sky Forest This place. Just walking in the tree, breathing open. Walking for all ages Along the forest path, head for the waterfall. Fir trees Tree relaxation Decided to stop by on the way home. The name Rigida pine trees Sunlight Relaxation Forest Past Water relaxation forest That touches the waterfall. There is such a waterfall in Seoul Grand Park.
Cheers living in cool, clean first-class
Although it is temporary, a 10m high waterfall welcomes the participants. Soak your feet in the valley that runs from the Cheonggye Mountain Valley and take a rest while looking at the waterfall. Take a picture with a waterfall in the background to cool down and go back. Sunlight does not leak in midsummer, so it is not sick. In the relaxation tree filled with firs, the healing meditation 'rest meditation' takes place. Rest on a wooden deck or floor here. Forest healers hand out the mattresses one by one. Lying comfortably in the sound of cicadas, the sunshine leaking through the vivid green leaves, and the fresh air provided by the trees. All the worries and troubles are laid down and Orot comes out with me. It's not long, but the effect is quite good. It takes you through the fragrant forest path where fragrant herbs greet you with a light step.
Path from tree relaxation forest to sunlight relaxation forest
It's something different from 2 hours ago to enjoy “Healing Forest Healing” with a one-day experience program and get back to reality. The weight and face are the same worries, but something is light. Is it because the trees that he met in the healing forest filled up the energy that was exhausted without knowing himself?
Natural Falls in the Forest Healing Forest of Seoul Grand Park
Seoul Grand Park Healing Forest also has special long-term programs for menopausal women, children who use smartphones, children with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and their families. If you apply for a long-term program, your registration will be confirmed after consulting a forest healer. Contact the Seoul Grand Park Forest Healing Forest (02-500-7575, 7576, 7511).
Participants take a break to cool off at the waterfall
TIP. How to use the Forest Healing Forest in Seoul Grand Park
Opened in 30 years, the Seoul Grand Park Forest Healing Forest is operated by reservation in advance to preserve the forest. Majung Forest Road (Tue ~ Fri, Twice a Day) for Adults, Silver Forest Trail for Seniors 65 to 75 Years (Once a Week), and Gold Forest Trail for Adults 55 to 65 Years (Once a Week) Operate. The deadline is fast, with a limit of 15 visitors per program. For reservations, please visit the Seoul Grand Park website ( http://grandpark.seoul.go.kr ) And Seoul Public Service Reservation System ( http://yeyak.seoul.go.kr You can do All is free. It also has special long-term programs for menopausal women, children with high levels of smartphone use, children with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and their families.

item.description:
Boryeong Mud Festival, a Honorary National Festival of Korea

Boryeong Mud Festival waited for baby!

Boryeong, South Korea

One of the first exciting festivals in summer! Boryeong Mud Festival at Boryeong Daecheon Beach in Chungnam, South Korea will be held from the 15th to the 24th. Let's go to a young and energetic festival. If you enjoy the festival, mud packs that naturally fall on your body is a bonus.
Boryeong Mud Festival no longer needs explanation. Younger people as well as family units with young children, and this year, even the elderly and seniors who came to hear the rumors have expanded. Let's take a look at Daecheon Beach where the Mud Festival is held around the popular Mud Experience Center (paid zone).
Go to Daecheon where mud pours!

Let's look at the transportation first. Boryeong Mud Festival is not difficult to find by public transport. If you're not good at driving, or if you're a lover, don't have a car. If you are a novice driver and want to go to the festival on weekends, you should park your car far away or use public transportation.

Color mud painting is fun!

Daecheon Station and Boryeong Bus Terminal are located in front of you, and it is only 10 minutes from Daecheon Beach where Boryeong Mud Festival is held. It means you can reach the festival as much as you like. One night and two days is enough to enjoy the mud festival. (This is based on a person with average fitness in their early to mid 30's.) If you're looking for a mud festival for a family summer vacation, you can afford this hot summer vacation, but you can't work properly like a cow. We recommend a salty one-night two-day course after work.

Color mud painting is fun!
Daecheon VS. Silent iris

Once the hostel is caught in Wuchang. During the festival, the price of accommodation in Daecheon Beach is soaring. 2.5 to 3 times the low season. If you're bothered to come and go, and you have a lot of room to pay, you can find a place to stay in front of the festival. But if you don't want to be noisy and crowded (Jeju loves Korean tourists' love of Korean sake all night long), Muchangpo is a 15-minute drive from Daecheon Beach. Accommodation is stable and much quieter. In addition, Muchangpo Beach is beautiful. It is not too much to enjoy tidal-flat experience with children, and if you are lovers, it is also a good date course. If you want to whisper something sweet, everyone recommends a relatively quiet ritual rather than passionate, youthful Daecheon.

Kids Zone for Families with Children
After drinking a glass of shellfish at Muchangpo, he diligently goes to Daecheon the next day. The flowers, mud experience and special stage of the Boryeong Mud Festival are located at the Mud Square between Citizens' Pagoda Square and Fountain Plaza. There are various experience programs to enjoy mud all over your body. General 10,000 won, youth 8,000 won. Groups of 20 people or more will receive a discount of 1,000 won. There is a difference between them, so please inquire at the site. There is a space for children.
Kids Zone for Families with Children
Mud Experience is in time for opening!
In order to enjoy the mud experience room a little, please use it in the morning at the opening time of the mud experience center (10:00). After 11 o'clock, the number of people grows rapidly and the line must start. If it is hard, you may be restricted from entering the garden.
Cockfighting at Mud Experience
The Mud Experience Center, which is open from 10 am to 6 pm, is open from 12:30 pm to 1:30 pm.
Get into jail and get a full body massage with mud!
If you enter the mud experience in time for the opening of 9:30, it is a success. 'Matching' and 'hanging tails' are fun in a large mud bath! I waited for more than an hour and only enjoyed a few minutes, but once I enjoyed the game, the wait is gone.
Get into jail and get a full body massage with mud!
However, if you move a little diligently, you can enjoy various mud experiences such as Mud Superslide and Mud Prison.
The Jin Team are muddled in groups.
Oh, since the Boryeong Mud Festival holds a photo contest every year, you need a sense to cover your face with 'colored body painting'. This is because photographers from all over the country flock. A face that doesn't know where it was taken could be used as an image to promote the Mud Festival next year. Expose your body and cover your face. This is a fun way to enjoy the mud festival.
The Jin Team are muddled in groups.
The next finish of the mud pack is the sea bathing

If your whole body is full of mud, and you have enjoyed the mud experience to the fullest, let's run to Daecheon. It's time to enjoy swimming. Wipe the mud with the streams throughout the festival, enjoy the sea bathing, and go to the shower. Don't worry if you don't have a car or accommodation. There is a locker and a paid shower in the festival. Cards, mobile phones and cameras move in waterproof packs. Even if you do not prepare in advance, you can easily get it at the convenience store. Just wear a waterproof pack. However, care should be taken with UV protection. Sunglasses can be broken at the mud experience, so it's a good idea to have a cap that fits your head. The mud also blocks UV rays, making it a stone. A chill in midsummer will wash the mud-washed head out of the cold shower.

If you enjoyed the mud experience enough, now you can do what you like. You can also enjoy painting and swimming. There is also a booth for making mud soap. Games on the tidal flats, short marathon competitions and beach futsal competitions are also held. If the time is right, enjoy anything. Why don't you fill it up with a variety of stuffed foods all over the festival grounds and run until you get back to reality.

Take a bath at Daecheon Beach where the Mud Festival takes place!

Finally, one tip to enjoy the Boryeong Mud Festival. Get some earplugs. Because our cochlea is precious. One more thing to add to the old lady is to wear a bathing suit. It's free to wear what kind of coat on it! Regular underwear can't stop the mud. You will also need a waterproof pack that will hold the car key, card, and cell phone mentioned earlier.

tip. Precautions for Enjoying the 2016 Boryeong Mud Festival

The most basic thing is to follow the safety rules. Warm-ups are a must before playing water or mud, and after drinking. Snow and nose at the mud experience. Be careful not to let mud get into your mouth or ears. It is useful to prepare earplugs with a waterproof pack. Also, be careful of mud slippery mud inside. You can enjoy this mud festival if you keep this much. Oh, not necessarily underwear, swimsuit!

Along the Daecheon Beach, where festivals take place, there are many accommodations and restaurants. The restaurants along the 4km-long sandy beach are hard to pick up. As you embrace the sea, there are many flavors awaiting you, from sashimi and seafood kalguksu to cafes and fast food. item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - Kung Fu Panda, how were you born?
item.description:
Kung Fu Panda Po in front of the Seoul Museum of Art

Kung Fu Panda, how were you born?

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

To the terrible kingdoms of Shrek and Fiona, to Qing Qingshan where the Kung Fu Panda Po was born, and to the Viking village of Burke where dragons fly. How were these places that seemed to exist somewhere in the world? If you're curious about the wonderful story and background that caught our eye, start here at DreamWorks Animation Special!
Dreamworks reveals the inner skin of animation
The characters in the movie move my way! DreamWorks Animation Special Exhibition, where Kung Fu Panda 'Sipu Sabu' makes you smile and you are waiting for a wonderful experience of Burk Island with Dragon 'Twosley'. This exhibition, which takes place from April 30 to August 15 at the Seoul Museum of Art, is an interesting event for anime enthusiasts.
The timid giraffe Melman of Madagascar
From the entrance of the museum, the big `` po '' greets you, and at the entrance of the exhibition, the dragon `` Twosleys '' greets you. This is where 20-year-old blood sweat animations are revealed.
Melman's cute face can be found inside the exhibition hall
You can see about 400 works of various types, from initial concept drawings to storyboards, original paintings, 3D characters and set models, movie scores, and masks.
Audiences Watching the Animation Exhibition
As you can see, it adds to the seasoning of each person in charge.
You can also see the initial animation in video
From sketch to screen

This exhibition is not just a place to introduce works. In order to look at the various collaborative work and the whole process to complete the animation one by one, it introduces it into three fields: character, story, and world.

Initial appearance and completion of current characters
There are various sketches on the wall of the character section that show how the initial idea was born as a character through concept drawing and sketching. Looking at the initial sketches, the character on the screen is unimaginably different and uncooked.
Visitors viewing various sketches
Familiar characters made of clay or plaster greet the audience in a transparent box.
Inside of special animation
Children also have no time to be bored. The Face Poser corner, where you can make facial expressions of famous characters, including Sifu Sabu from Kung Fu Panda, is perfect for children who are interested in art to raise their animators' dreams by changing their facial expressions.
Corner Face Poser to change the look of characters
What about the process of telling stories to these characters? The story section captures the eyes as if the artists were working and just moved away from the studio. Hundreds and thousands of storyboards, as well as video, convey the progress intact. In particular, the 'pitching' video, which conveys the story vividly like a grandmother who told a story in her childhood, is a must-see point!
Storyboards full of walls
The last section of the world is full of fun. There are numerous studies and worries to express the worldview of each piece in a realistic way. In particular, the best way to experience this exhibition is Bird's Eye View! Like the main character 'hiccup' in the taming of the dragon, it is mysterious as if flying on the back of the dragon 'Twosleys'.
Moved the animation studio table
DreamWorks' animation is not just for children. Dreams, hopes, and courage are the works that have been loved by the public by melting the values that humans should always pursue. Let's take a look at how these works are made and experience the true courage of children and the precious dreams that adults have forgotten. Your tomorrow will change anew.
The movie theater dragon flight which can experience bird eye view

item.title: Geumsan-gun, Chungnam, South Korea - 'You see yourself? Please leave it to Geumsan Ginseng! ”
item.description:
Ginseng porridge and ginseng deep-fried at Geumsan Ginseng Porridge

'You see yourself? Please leave it to Geumsan Ginseng! ”

Geumsan-gun, Chungnam, South Korea

Geumsan, the home of ginseng, is a mountainous area located near Buyeo, the capital of Baekje. Many people gather at Geumsan where the national ginseng festival is held every fall during the harvest season. We stepped ahead and headed to Geumsan one summer day before the first blessing. Traveling along the ginseng body, go go!
Geumsan Ginseng has a history of more than 1,500 years.
Once upon a time, more than a thousand years ago. In Geumsan, there lived Gang Sae's house in Seonggokri. Kang Hyo-ja, a well-known Hyoja, runs back to life to save her mother when her mother is sick. Then, I prayed and prayed for healing my mother's disease at Jinaksan Gwaneum cave. As the spirit of the mountain was rooted, my mother was completely relieved.
Geumsan Ginseng Center called “heart” of Geumsan Ginseng Market
Here is not the end. Gangchusa handed out the seeds of the perennial plant to the local people, who carefully planted the seeds and healed them with thick roots. The root of the grass resembles a human being more mysterious. That's why he got the name 'Ginseng (人蔘)'.
Fresh ginseng weighing 42,000 won for 750g
This is the legend of Geumsan Ginseng. Geumsan began to plant grass that grew in the mountains. 946, Seonggok-ri, Namnam, Geumsan-gun, where Gangchusa first planted ginseng is called 'gasamsam'. This is where ginseng began. Every year, thanks to Sanshin and Gangchusa who helped grow ginseng, they celebrate the good harvest.
Ginseng Market in Geumsan-eup
The history of Geumsan Ginseng can also be found in the records. In Kim Bu-sik's Samguk Sagi, there is a record that Baekje Muryeong King sent “Baekjesam” as a gift to the Chinese Yang dynasty. Geumsan is a mountainous area near Baekje capital, Buyeo, and it can be inferred that Baekjesam's main production site was Geumsan. In the Joseon Dynasty, Sinjeung-dong Guyeojiseungram, Jinsan-myeon, Geumsan-gun, records Ginseng. After that, after the Japanese colonial period and the Korean War, Geumsan became the home of ginseng that is responsible for the production and sale of ginseng.
Geumsan International Ginseng Market
Can a festival fall out of ginseng? Around September, the annual harvest season of ginseng, Geumsan is thrilled with medicinal merchants and tourists from all over the country. At the same time, the Geumsan Ginseng Festival will be held. Participants go directly to the ginseng field to harvest ginseng, select good ginseng, sample ginseng dishes, and enjoy various ginseng experiences. Buying ginseng at an affordable price is a bonus for those who visit the festival. Of course, even if not during the harvest season and festival season, you can always get high quality ginseng in Geumsan. Ginseng that boosts immunity, where to live.
Geumsan Herbal Medicine Market
From Geumsan Ginseng Pipe to Fresh Ginseng Center All about ginseng
If you want to come to Geumsan and choose ginseng properly, first go to Geumsan Ginseng Building in Geumsan Town.
Geumsan Ginseng Pavilion, which released everything from Geumsan Ginseng
Think of it as a ginseng museum on the first and third basement floors opened in 2011.
1st floor lobby
This is a good place to go for ginseng after studying “ginseng”.
Miss Ginseng King
If you step outside the door, it is the bottom of the Geumsan ginseng market, which accounts for 80% of ginseng production and distribution. Geumsan International Ginseng Market, Geumsan Fresh Ginseng Center and Geumsan Fisheries Wholesale Market are located.
Mr. Ginseng King
To buy fresh ginseng, take a look around the Geumsan Fresh Ginseng Center, where fresh ginseng from all over the country gathers and holds auctions every 1 to 6 days. You can find a variety of fresh ginseng at affordable prices. Fresh ginseng means non-dried biological ginseng. White ginseng is dried without processing, and red ginseng is cooked and boiled. In addition, depending on the quality of the product and the time of cultivation, it is also divided into ginseng, rice, and ginseng.
Geumsan Ginseng Museum displaying various dishes made with ginseng
Fried ginseng, ginseng porridge, ginseng chicken soup… Geumsan Ginseng Delicacy Three Musketeers
Now, let's go to taste ginseng that doesn't like high temperature or excessive moisture. Ginseng porridge and ginseng ginseng soup are the challenge menu of today.
Fried ginseng at a restaurant worth 15,000 won
First ginseng fried. You can taste it anywhere in the market. If you put a cup of ginseng Makgeolli for 1000 won on a root of 1,500 won of ginseng, it is also a good yogi. If you find Geumsan, you should definitely take root! The followings are representative gyosam ginseng porridge and ginseng samgyetang containing Geumsan ginseng.
1,500 won per ginseng market, fried ginseng
Eomdeum is a delicacy that can be tasted at the bottom of Geumgang including Geumsan, Yeongdong and Okcheon Muju. Common style of the common people who make freshwater fish from the stems of Geumgang. 4 to 5 hours of flesh as well as bones to soften the sieve and strain. Cook the broth with rice and add miso and red pepper paste. Depending on the breakdown, noodle and sujebi may be added.
Jewon Bridge in Geumsan Ginseng Jujuk Village
Ginseng added to this is Geumsan's delicacy Ginseng porridge. Ginseng is added to the end almost to make it unique. Ginseng porridge which is good for body, where should we taste?
Ginseng fields found all over Geumsan
Fortunately, there is a ginseng porridge village in Geumsan. Ginseng specialty shops are gathered in Cheonna-ri, Jeogok-ri, and Yonghwa-ri, which wear Geumgang. A golden fish holding a ginseng on the Jewon Bridge, located in the center of the village, with a thumb up, announces that this is a ginseng porridge village.
Deep-fried freshwater fish cooked with seasoning
The thick and thick ginseng is deadly. Spicy yet juicy, light and thick. Ginseng's bitter scent is added to ordinary fish porridge. Nearby restaurants also sell ginseng porridge, torii bang bang and freshwater fish, as well as ginseng tempura. Either way, add some appetite.
Ginseng Samgyetang, the best summer food
Ginseng Samgyetang can be tasted in the town where Geumsan Ginseng Market is located. Ginseng Samgyetang, which contains ginseng in the familiar Samgyetang, is more popular as a tourist for locals than tourists. It is a nutritious food that can be solved without any side dishes. Why don't you go on a trip to Gumsan for two days and one night in front of the coming summer?
Ginseng Samgyetang, the best summer food
Travel info

1. Nearby restaurants

Ogol Restaurant: Ginseng porridge, Doribangbang / Cheonnaori, Gewonsan Jewon-myeon / 041-752-2638
Geumsan Wonjo Kimjeong Isamgyetang: Ginseng Samgyetang, Abalone Samgyetang / Geumsan Geumsan-eup Ginseng Yakcho-ro / 041-752-2678

item.title: Andong, Gyeongbuk, Korea - Ahem, five senses satisfaction, Goan Andong travel
item.description:
Mandaeru Viewed from Byungsan Seowon Enrollment

Ahem, five senses satisfaction, Goan Andong travel

Andong, Gyeongbuk, Korea

Andong, Gyeongsangbuk-do, is considered one of the first hands in the 'Korean Yangbango'. Known as 'the town of Hahoe Village', Andong is not only a traditional Yangban culture but also a popular folk culture such as Hahoe Mask Dance. Hahoe Village, Byeongsan Seowon, and the Gyeongsangbuk-do Provincial Office, which is nested in Hahoe Village, were added as the representative tourist attractions of Andong. Andong OLD & NEW travel.
Andong, Gyeongbuk. The vague feeling of 'far' may be due to the influence of space-time rather than the actual distance. This is because spaces such as Seowon and Hyanggyo stop at the time, including Hahoe Village in the Nakdong River. Thanks to the traces of our ancestors who enjoyed academics and styles, emphasizing righteousness and courtesy, we thought of Seonbi and Yangban in Andong.
Some ways to travel Yangban
Andong is said to have originated in Changnyeongguk, founded by Yeomsang Dosa in 57 BC. It is called Gotaya-gun and Gochang-gun in Silla era. Afterwards, he entered the Joseon Dynasty and was promoted to Andong-do. Daedohobu is the name of a local administrative agency that was placed in the main town of the Joseon Dynasty. In addition to Andong, it was installed in Gangneung, Pyeongan, Yeongbyeon, and Hamgyeong, Yeongheung. In 1896 (Gojong 33), Andong-gun was passed to Andong-eup in 1931. In 1995, the Andong-gun was merged into Andong-si. This is the reason why it has the largest area among the nation's counties.
Byeongsan Seowon from the side of the entrance hall
Therefore, Andong travel should be considered in consideration of the line. It can be divided into Hahoe Village, which binds Hahoe Village, Byeongsan Seowon, and Gyeongbuk Provincial Offices, Dosan Seowon, which binds Dosan Seowon, Toegye Jongtaek, and Andong City Area, which combines Andong Cultural Tourism Complex, Old Market, and New Market. This trip is a course that combines the Andong-gu market and the new market with a view of Gyeongbuk Provincial Government, Hahoe Village and Dosan Seowon. Of course, one night and two days can be enjoyed in order to taste Andong's special mackerel and hut jesak rice and enjoy Andong Lake's night view.
Hahoe Village Yangjindang
Gyeongsangbuk-do applicants located in Hahoe Village
After entering Andong land, I first went to Gyeongsangbuk-do. The plan is to move to Gyeongsangbuk-do, Governor, Hahoe Village, and Byeongsan Seowon.
New Gyeongsangbuk-do Office of Information Center in Andong
You can stop by Gyeongsangbuk-do on the way to see Hahoe Village and Byeongsan Seowon. The visitor information center appears when you enter Gyeongsangbuk-do, which opened in March 2016.
Main office
Brochures as well as cultural commentators are available. The first floor of all buildings in the Metropolitan Government is open to outsiders.
Semi-circle modeled after Gyeongju Donggung and Wolji
There are buildings such as Gyeongbuk Provincial Council, Gyeongbuk Provincial Office, Welfare Center, and Multi-purpose Performance Hall, Sesimwon, modeled after Gyeongju Donggung Palace and Wolji, Saemaul Square, and Gyeonghwamun.
A large exhibit at the main office, the Brush of Seonbi
As you enter the main building, various exhibitions and shelters are welcoming. Leave everything behind and head to cafes and restaurants. Books filled with books are a great place to relax and have a drink. Internet and cell phone charging is free. In fact, I rarely come to the city to go sightseeing, but it's not enough to come to the heat in midsummer.
Most popular with visitors
If it is easy to transport, backpackers will be able to search for travel information and recharge their mobile phones.
Book room with internet access and mobile phone charging
It's also a cafeteria next door, so it's good to have a yogi. Meals are served on weekdays and gimbap, feast noodles and karaoke noodles are sold on weekends (11: 00-15: 00). Go straight from the main entrance of the provincial main building to Saemaul Square. Outdoor performances are held at 2pm and 5pm on weekends.
Cafeteria that is open on weekends
Andong Travel NO.1 Poongsan Ryu's Zipseong Village Hahoe Village
It is 5.7km from Gyeongsangbuk-do, Gyeonggi-do and Hahoe Village in 10 minutes by car. Hahoe Village, a 600-year-old village of Pungsan Ryu, flows in the 'S' shape with the Nakdong River surrounding the village. This is why the village name became 'Hahoe'. In feng shui geography, it is 'soft softening type' which is considered as the best road. It resembles a lotus floating on water. It is famous for being a good place for people to live in since Joseon Dynasty because there are mountains and rivers centering on villages. In July 2010, it was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Jong-ae Chung Hyo-dang of Seo-ae Ryu Sung-ryong
Hahoe Village is located 1.2km from Hahoe Village Marketplace. There is a shuttle bus connecting them. From 6 pm to 9 am, guests can enter their own vehicles for the guests of Hahoe villages temporarily. Once you enter the village, time travel begins. Many houses, including Hahoe Old House, are under construction, but the time accumulated along the dirt roads of the village remains.
Yang Jin-dang where Ryu Joong-young and his eldest son, Ryu-am Ryong, lived
Because of the town's shape, which is softened, it is heavy when a stone wall is piled up. It is good to take a map and look around every corner, but walking slowly and comfortably along the dirt road is a good way to travel to Hahoe Village. To get around Hahoe village properly, it takes from 2 hours to half a day. If time is running out, take the treasure Yangjin-dang (Treasure No. 306) and Chung Hyo-Dang (Treasure No. 414) that Hahoe Village holds. Yang Jin-dang was the home of Ryu Joong-young and his eldest son Ryu Un-yong, while Chung Hyo-dang was Jong-taek of Ryu Sung-ryong.
Chunghyodang
Ryu Tae-hyuk, who met at Yangjin-dang in Hahoe Village, said, "There are currently 112 households and 173 people in Hahoe Village. About 140 of them are Pungsan Liu."
Hahoe Village requires at least 2 hours to see properly
If you have time, you can look down Hahoe Village from Bouyongdae. You should take a ferry from Hahoe Village to and from Buyongdae. Contact 010-4154-1315.
Most of the villages are dirt roads because they might sink if the stones are piled up.
Byeongsan Seowon is devoted to the study in harmony with nature
Passing the volcano (271m) from Hahoe Village, it is Byeongsan Seowon. The beautiful Seowon, which overlooks the flowing stems of the Nakdong River, began in 1575 when Seo-ae Ryu Sung-ryong moved Pungak Seodang in Pungsan-eup. Ryu Sung-ryong's pupils and larvae set up his shrine here and became a formal vow. It is one of 47 vows and shrines that received the sum of 'Byeongsan' in 1863 and survived the Seowon Abolition of Heungseondaewon.
Baksanseowon Mandaeru in front of the Nakdong River
Passing through the Baptist Gate, the main gate of Seowon and Mandaeru, is the area of pedagogy. The entrance hall, where the director and the larvae gathered and discussed, is the most important building in Seowon. Myeong-jae Jae, the east room of the auditorium, resided by the director, and faculty members lived in Gyeongui-jae, the west room. Dongjae and the library, located to the left and right of the auditorium, are spaces where larvae lived. Standing on Daecheong Maru, the instructor is a spectacular view of the river and the mountains that stretch beyond the bay.
Mandaeru is unfortunately can't go up right now.
If you are drunk with nature and enjoy playing fresh, it is time to fill your hunger. Go to Andong-gu Market Steamed Chicken Alley. If you enter the front gate of Andong-gu market, you will find dozens of steamed chicken specialties such as Joongang, Eugene, Maeil, Woojeong, and Modern Steamed Chicken. You can enjoy Andong Braised Chicken, Andong Stewed Chicken, and Fried Whole Chicken. Andong Stewed Chicken minced vermicelli from Andong Braised Chicken.
Andong-gu Market Steamed Chicken Alley with Dozens of Steamed Chicken Houses
Andong Braised Chicken is a good size to eat, and the bone-cut chicken is cooked in advance. A large amount is not enough even if three or four people eat. The price is 25,000 won per head. Thanks to the generous amount and low price, it attracts a lot of light college students and beginners. You can adjust the spicyness when ordering. After the steamed chicken, the market size is a bonus. Don't miss the new market, which is a 5-minute walk from the old market. You can see Andong Gourmet Mackerel as well as see how it is made.
Andong Braised Chicken can be adjusted when ordering

item.title: Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea - Dip your clams and make ecchi chocolate! 'Sea Village Diary' used at Seosan Village Village Village
item.description:
Junglipo-gu with a tidal flat

Dip your clams and make ecchi chocolate! 'Sea Village Diary' used at Seosan Village Village Village

Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea

Fresh spring has settled down at the Jung-ri Village Village, which is located along the wide tidal flats of Garorim Bay, Seosan-si, Chungnam. When the tidal-flats in front of Jungripo-gu reveal the locals, there are crowds of residents who came out of the clams and experienced visitors who held hands with their children.
From treasure hunts in a golden fishery to making crafts, strolling through the villages with springtime plains, and exploring Seosan Creative Art Village. Let's leave the family outing to the all-round beauty village.
Smiling children holding clams
Find it! Treasure hidden in the mud flats
Garorim Bay, surrounded by Seosan-si and Taean-gun, Chungnam, is one of the five largest tidal flats in the world. It is so clean that the sea is added to the forest with dew. Fresh seafood springs up like pollination in all seasons. Jungali Village Experience Village in Jigok-myeon, Seosan-si is famous for the Oeok-nakji Festival in Gaet Village in autumn. In March-May, the clam that has been plump for the season waits for Gilson. Thanks to the abundance of fishery resources, experiences, and unspoiled natural environment, we won the Grand Prize at the 2014 Fishing Village Advancement Competition.
Experiencers gathering for three or five
The experience time changes daily depending on the time of the day, so you should inquire in advance. If you look for a good day before and after the full moon, it can make the tidal flat experience easier.
Seasoned clams
At the Jungali Village Experience Village ticket office, which arrived on time, the booths were crowded with experienced visitors who changed their boots from early morning. As soon as the kids with the net and hoe got on the electric cart, they were excited. Jungripo-gu is an endless stretch of tidal flats. The children, who traveled around the tidal-flat of their feet, fall into a clam samgye with a hoe in their fern hands.
A scallop shell with a wish is hanging at the entrance of the village.
Pick a floor with a hole and scrape it with a hoe and the clams will come out as a bunch. Every time a clam comes out of the mud, the children who run into the river are ecstatic.
Electric cart moves from ticket office to tidal flat
The small shellfish is saved and the thick one is picked up in the net. However, the shellfish at this time is full of flavor even though it looks small. The clam filled with one net is about 2-3 kg. The time required for the experience is not set separately, but after a couple of hours, the tidal flats are filled with water. The experience fee is 10,000 won per person, including tools.
Children who clam with their hands
If you look for the time when the water comes in, you can try fishing on board. They are mainly caught, songme and flatfish. It is possible to get into the shallow water, catching ponies, mullets, crabs, shrimps, and other side nets in June when the water temperature starts to rise. After mid-May, octopus catching experiences await families. The bamboo primrose, a traditional primitive fishing method, is installed 20m long so that you can catch octopus by tumbling across the tidal flats.
Children who clam with their hands
Making sweet and bitter ecstasy chocolate
After the can, you can stop by the Fishermen's House in the village. The first floor food experience center is equipped with cooking utensils and tableware. You can wash freshly picked fresh clams clean and boil clam kalguksu or clam ramen. If you prepare vegetables and noodles in advance, you can enjoy simple meals with your children and enjoy more time.
Instant kalguksu boiled in fresh clam
Fishermen's Happiness Center also runs an experience program such as making taetae chocolate. Ecklonia is a rare seaweed that blooms only from December to April in a limited area of Seosan Garorim Bay. Picking is difficult, and the process of washing and drying by hand is also very expensive. It looks similar to Mae-sae-gi, but it is called 'sea vegetables of the sea' because of its stronger fragrance and excellent efficacy.
Make Ecklon Chocolate
feeling
Make Ecklon Chocolate
Walk through Sinmong Judo, Seosan Creative Art Village and Jungwang-ri Village
Pass the entrance to the experience village and follow the left hill to reach Seosan Creative Art Village. The unspoiled landscape of the village of Jungali Village leads to Jungwang-ri through the art village. Behind the vast landscape of Garorim Bay, the cozy village road is hidden. It's closer to a mountain village than a typical fishing village, so it's good to stroll around talking with your child.
Seosan Creative Art Village Exterior
The starting point of the walk is Seosan Creative Art Village. In 2009, it remodeled the Jungwang branch school of Buseong Elementary School, which was closed. Although it is named 'Simon Hwang Sukbong Modern Calligraphy Center', various art exhibitions are held every month in addition to calligraphy.
Hallway showroom
On the second and fourth Saturday of every month, paintings are held on plates and mugs. Paintings made with pottery pens can be grilled and taken directly to the kiln. The entrance fee to the museum and the experience fee are both free and the experience must be booked in advance.
Pottery works made by experienced visitors
Also worth seeing is the front yard of the museum, where soot and sailboats are located. Standing on the front yard observatory, the Everspring Plain and Jungwang-ri Village look like picturesque. The spring plain, which is also a migratory habitat, means 'to see all the time'. The scenery is varied throughout the four seasons.
Cutely decorated front yard
Follow the steps of the observatory to take a stroll in Jungwang-ri Village. Jungwang-ri is a small village where 140 households live in tight densities. Wall paintings and installations follow the concept of 'Walking through the Shinmong Judo Garden'. Seosan Jigok-myeon, where Jungwang-ri is located, is known as the hometown of the Korean electric painter, who drew the Mont Yudo Island. If <Mondedo Island> was the dream of Anpyeongdae, the landscapes of Jigok-myeon with only the landscape would not affect the style of the dog.
Jungang-ri Village Landscape
Walking from Seosan Creative Art Village to Jungang 1-ri Village Hall, you will find witty genre paintings, cute murals, old mills still in operation, and farm equipment warehouses. Roads embroidered with pale pink flowers and small landscapes caught in the square frame of the village signage add to the taste of walking.
Information signs that go well with the town
After the road maintenance is completed, a program will be conducted in June to explore the village by electric carts at the Village Village Village.
The murals painted everywhere are humorous.
Travel info

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - K-Style Hub Meets Korea's Allure
item.description:
Korean Food Center

K-Style Hub Meets Korea's Allure

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

Modern man lives in a flood of information. Nevertheless, many people are thirsty for real information. Why? Isn't it because information comes to life only when it is connected to the person who needs it? Modern people living in a society where travel is routine and online 24 hours a day are no exception.
K-Style Hub, which opened on April 11, is a new style hub that can show Korean taste and fashion to both Koreans and foreigners. Experience of Korean food and Korean culture, as well as travel information on every corner of Korea, the best veteran travel experts in Korea provides one-on-one travel counseling services.
K-Style Hub, located in the office building of Seoul Tourism Organization, Jung-gu, Seoul, consists of 1,300 pyeong of space on four floors. On the second floor, you can get information on Hallyu and medical tourism, as well as travel information in every corner of Korea. Provide tourism information using Korea's advanced information and communication technology (ICT). If you miss the analog information, you can consult the information desk.
Tourist Information Center
If you are familiar with digital media, you can use digital kiosks, tablets, etc. to get the information, and you can also enjoy the information of the destinations taken by drones.
360 degree view screen
In addition, you can experience Korea's travel destinations right in front of you at the Oculus Experience Center using Virtual Reality (VR), as well as the lively photography corner with Hallyu stars such as Psy using Augmented Reality (AR).
VR experience
You can also enjoy skiing at the Pyeongchang Olympic Ski Jump, which will be held in Gangwon-do in 2018. If you can tolerate some dizziness, like a real ride.
K-Star Photo Zone
Take the escalator to the third floor. Korean Food Experience Center is located. It is also a space to learn about Korean food and food culture through Korean seasons and customs using Korean ICT technology. Along the entrance walls built with traditional Korean timber stacking methods, our seasonal foods printed on Korean traditional grate doors and windows are neat and stylish.
24 seasons and three customs
In the air at the far end of the 24 seasons passage, you can hear a drop of water dropping onto the pottery head and its waveform is projected on the wall. It is a moment when water, the source of life, which is so common and never felt its presence, feels mysteriously.
Head and Ingredients
You can then touch the various cereals, beans and spices in Korea and smell them with your nose. Behind the experience table, Jangdogdae brings back memories of Jangdogok that you played while playing hide-and-seek as a child. The voice yelling, "Hide it, I see your hair," wanders in my ears.
Traditional Changdokdae
On the other hand, three kimono cubes are placed in the middle of the exhibition hall.
Media show using Onggi lid
In the first cube, it is an experience space where you can open our seasonal ingredients one by one as you open the medicine cabinet drawer. The chest of drawers filled with harvested seasonal ingredients resembles our traditional barn. Next to it is a scarecrow hologram, standing alone in an empty rice paddy after an autumn harvest.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
In the second cube, you can turn the handle by hand and read the book about Korean food, and the 9-sided Korean plate on our lacquer plate is round and round, and next to it is a modernization symbolizing harmony and balance of Korean food. There is a traditional Hansang experience corner. Again, turn the handle to line up the colors underneath the food, and the four foods are neatly laid out on a wide plate. It is a modernized Korean style dress considering balanced color and balanced nutrients and calories.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
The final cube is a fixture symbolizing the value of convergence, one of the characteristics of Korean food. We show the charm of our bibimbap, that is, the beauty of fusion, which makes good use of the characteristics of unique ingredients while mixing and blending together to create a new taste through a work that sublimates various ingredients into artistic beauty.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
Arirang resonates from the left side, and images form on 96 caps. Various patterns of Korean food and various foods that accompany them are projected, and the four seasons of Korea are depicted in ink paintings on the wall and over the fence. Korea's advanced ICT convergence technology utilizes our traditional Onggi to create beautiful works of art.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
Let's go up one floor again. The courtyard surrounded by elegant hanok looks quiet. It is a Korean food experience center.
Korean Food Experience Center
Here you can taste the representative foods of Korea. You can buy food made from rice and beans, North Korean food, and various types of rice cakes and desserts in Korea.
Soybean Jeonbeak
At the Korean Food Center, 40 people can simultaneously experience Korean cuisine. In addition to our court food, Jongga food, temple food, Kimchi and Bulgogi, various cultural experiences can be arranged through reservation.
Traditional liquor
It is a space where master classes for famous chefs at home and abroad, as well as beginners, can easily make Korean food.
Chinese tourists taking cooking lessons at Korean Food Center
In addition to Korean cultural products, such as food and crafts, products from various fields created by small and medium-sized venture companies in Korea can be purchased at one place. In the middle of the store, works of hanbok that express the beauty of our hanbok are displayed, and next to it are various hanbok products that can be worn in real life.
Art market selling excellent cultural products
The newly opened K-Style Hub is creating a new paradigm of exhibition culture by combining the world's best ICT technology with our culture.
Venture Business Product Promotion Zone
In terms of design, it is a new landmark of Korean tourism that shows the excellence of our culture and art through beautiful harmony of black and white.
Sun + line + line by Han Young-hee, Hanbok writer
Travel info

K-Style Hub
http://korean.visitkorea.or.kr/kor/bz15/kstylehub/overview.jsp

-Address: 2F ~ 5F, Seoul Office Building, 40, Cheonggyecheon-ro, Jung-gu, Seoul
-Opening Hours: Tourist Information Center (Open all year round, 09: 00 ~ 20: 00), Korean Food Experience Center closed every Tuesday, 10: 00 ~ 18: 00
-Admission fee: Free (Korean food experience hall on the 4th floor sells food for a fee, and cooking class is operated by advance reservation.)
-Tel: Tourist Information Center (02-729-9497 ~ 9499), Korean Food Experience Center (02-6053-7177 ~ 79)

item.title: Goseong-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea - Gyeongsangnam-do Goseong Dinosaur World Expo, Dinosaur Tour No. 1 in Korea
item.description:
Tyrannosaurus made from recycling Soju bottles

Gyeongsangnam-do Goseong Dinosaur World Expo, Dinosaur Tour No. 1 in Korea

Goseong-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea

'Dinosaur Country' will be held in Gyeongsangnam-do Goseong for 12 days from June 12 to '2016 Gyeongnam Goseong Dinosaur World Expo'. The expo, which celebrated the 4th time, was held under the theme of `` Dinosaurs, opening the future with a light of hope, '' so the nightly remodeling has more attractions than the previous event. Let's go to Goseong to find dinosaurs who were owners of this land 100 million years ago.
Tyrannosaurus, Triceratops, Seymosus… '. These are the names you've heard once. If those names are difficult, you may want to think of a comic cartoon, Baby Dinosaur Dooly. As a child, we once met 'they'. Dinosaurs have been the host of the earth for about 160 million years. How exciting would it be if you could meet the dinosaurs you met in a movie or a book?
Why did Gyeongnam Goseong become a dinosaur country?
I wonder in this passage. How did Gyeongnam Goseong become a 'dinosaur country'? It starts off at the coast of Deokmyeong-ri, Hai-myeon, known as Sangamam County Park. In 1982, the first dinosaur footprint was found here. In the course of the investigation, a fossil dinosaur egg came out. Deokmyung-ri Dinosaur Footprint Fossil Mountain, where dinosaur footprints were found in groups, was selected as a Natural Monument (411). Where is it? In 1999, fossil dinosaur footprints were found near Goseong IC in Maam-myeon during the construction of Daejeon Tongyeong Expressway.
View of Danghangpo, President of 2016 Gyeongnam Goseong Dinosaur World Expo
As many as 5,000 footprints are scattered all over Goseong. Of course, the possibility of further excavation cannot be excluded. This is why Goseong is nicknamed 'dinosaur country'. Perhaps Goseong was the center of the Korean Peninsula in the dinosaur age. Thanks to the overflowing traces of dinosaurs, Gyeongnam Goseong is considered to be the fossil producing region of the world's three largest dinosaur footprints, along with Colorado, USA and the west coast of Argentina.
Dinosaur Expo Main Dinosaur Garden
The world-famous 'Dinosaur Country' Goseong started the 'Gyeongnam Goseong Dinosaur World Expo' for the first time in 2006. It was to make it easier and more fun to inform the public about this space of great academic value. The expo, held every three to four years, celebrates four times this year. From the birth of the earth to the dinosaurs' global environment and the life of dinosaurs, there are many programs that can be enjoyed and learned by young children.
Tyrannosaurus model means tyrant lizard
Danghangpo ~ Donghaemyeon ~ Sangsangam, Dinosaur Footprints
Now, let's go on a dinosaur trip around Goseong Dinosaur World Expo. Goseong's representative dinosaur destination can be classified into two places. Danghangpo area, where the dinosaur expo main stage is located, and foot rock area where dinosaur footprints were first discovered. Of course, there are dinosaur fossils scattered all over the place, but if you travel around these two places, you can dive into the traces of dinosaurs that used to play in Goseong.
Real dinosaur footprint fossil at the site of Danghangpo Expo
However, Danghangpo and Sangmyeon are about an hour away by self-driving, so you can travel effectively if you squeeze the line.
Protection angle to protect him
It takes about 20 minutes from Goseong IC to Danghangpo, the main stage of the expo. If you go to Danghangpo tourist spot and search for 'Parking Lot 1', 'Dinosaur's Gate' or 'Danghangpo Auto Camping Ground', it's fast. When you enter the dinosaur's door, you will be greeted by a dinosaur fountain. One of the most famous dinosaurs is the tyrannosaurus. The dinosaur garden stretched out behind it is literally full of dinosaurs.
Dinosaur Footprint Fossil Site
'Seymosus' means 'earthquake lizard', which is named as earthquake that sounds like an earthquake whenever it moves. It's also fun to guess the names of dinosaurs, such as the Plateausaurus, which means a flat lizard, and the Triceratops, which means a face with three horns.
Barionix at the Theme Hall
Go through the dinosaur garden and go to the Digital Dinosaur Experience Center. You can have a dinosaur-like experience. If you take a closer look at the dinosaur character building, the botanical garden, and the Korean Peninsula Dinosaur Footprint Fossil, you will naturally learn about dinosaurs.
Genuine fossilized Mamenkisaurus from Sichuan, China
If you go out, you can eat at the festival. There are many restaurants where you can taste various foods.
A theme museum recreating the era of dinosaurs
After passing the water experience center, take the escalator to the main building and the Dinotopia building. You can also see the dinosaur bones here at the theme hall. Directing the dinosaur age, you can see the dinosaurs moving as visitors pass by.
Children's Digital Experience Center
Night opens during the event, dinosaurs never sleep
The feature of this dinosaur expo is night opening. Open until 10 pm daily during the event. Visitors at night can enjoy a colorful dinosaur country, such as large dinosaur lanterns, luminaries, and night performances.
Gyeongnam Goseong World Dinosaur Expo
The main building, the hologram movie hall, the Korean Peninsula Fossil Museum, and the Dino Aquarium are available for night viewing.
Light Tunnel Created for Night Opening
Remember special shows and parades throughout the event. Every day at 11, 14 and 19:30, a parade takes place in front of the dinosaur fountain. The same fountain runs every day at 20:30, 21:30, twice a day. At 20 o'clock and 21 o'clock, a media facade shows the audience's spring night in front of the dinosaur character hall.
2016 Gyeongnam Goseong World Dinosaur Expo Night Event
If you find the Danghangpo where the dinosaur expo spreads, you can also visit the dinosaur footprints left in the small old school building. It will take about 30 minutes along Route 77, which has been selected as 'Beautiful Road in Korea'. You should see the roadside signs. It's not easy to find on the way, but it's fun to see the footprints of dinosaurs that might have played on this land someday. The owner of a giant footprint over 30cm is estimated to be a giant sauropod that ranges from 110 to 120m.
Event venue shining with colored lights by night opening
It is regrettable to leave out the foot rock where dinosaur tracks were first discovered in Goseong. It takes about 40 minutes from Goseong IC. Satisfy the footprints of dinosaurs along the trail from Goseong Dinosaur Museum to the Festival Village.
Event venue shining with colored lights by night opening
Travel info

Gyeongnam Ancient Dinosaur World Expo 2016
